loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 32 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala, in western Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items, and will help Winnie generate greater profits and increase her business. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more household items for her shop.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, which is located in the region of Kampala in southern Uganda. She is married and has four children. Two of her children attend school.

For the past 16 years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her shoe sales business. Specifically, she sells various children's shoes.

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan in the amount of of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to open up a different shoe shop, and will help Moreen to generate an increase in profits and to renovate her business's rooms. In the future, Moreen hopes to be able to build more self-contained rooms.

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening another shoe store

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es: Zenobio nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), él tiene 24 años de edad y es separado pero tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Zenobio was born in the city of Paucartambo but lives in the city of Salvación. (Salvación is located in the Manu district of the Manu province, in the department of Madre de Dios, Perú). He is 24 and separated from his spouse, but he has four children. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is succeeding in his business.He works mainly in agriculture. He has done this for several years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into it. He belongs to the “Las Palmeras del Manu” communal bank and needs a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. He is grateful for this loan and values it, and promises to repay his monthly quotas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Hijas Del Maiz Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por tres socias comerciantes una de ellas  es Sonia mujer de 43 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como es atol, atolillo, enchiladas, desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertir en  comprar lo que es cosechas de tamarindo. María mujer de 28 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas y Elizabeth mujer de 30 años su negocio es la venta de pollo.
texts.en:
A group of three business associates. One of them is Sonia, a 43 year-old woman in a relationship. For the last three years she has had a business selling derivatives of corn, such as atol (a cornflour drink), atolillo (a rice pudding), and enchiladas. She's requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of tamarind crops.

María, 28, has a business buying and selling crops and Elizabeth, 30, sells chicken.

loans.use: to invest in tamarind crops.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley owns and operates a business of growing and selling flowers in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business in five years, earning for her family. Her previous loan, which she used in her garden, has been successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed another loan to buy new varieties of seedlings and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her flower farm.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta tiene 31 años, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia que se hizo construir en un terreno herencia de sus padres en la comunidad Chimpa Rancho-Candelaria, es una persona trabajadora responsable y humilde se dedica a la producción agrícola con ingresos económicos estacionales dentro del año por la venta de papa, haba y oca, solicita un crédito para comprar un lote de terreno agrícola para poder sembrar en una mayor superficie y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Roberta is 31. She is a single mother and lives in her own home which she built on a plot of land that she inherited from her parents in the community of  Chimpa Rancho-Candelaria. She is a hard-working, responsible, and humble person. She works in agriculture and makes a seasonal income from the sale of potato, beans, and oca. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a plot of agricultural land in order to be able to sow a larger amount of crops and make a greater income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Kasharara Women Group

texts.en:
Kasharara group is located in a village in Kagongo town. The group is comprised of mainly women who range in different categories of married women, widows and a few single mothers.

Hope is a single mother whose husband divorced her in 2009. She was left with two children and she takes care of them alone. Hope runs a small bar with working capital of USHS 400,000. Besides that, she also has a small banana plantation where she gets income to feed her children, boost her bar business and pay workers who work in the plantation. She applied for a loan of 1,000,000=  so as to add more capital in her bar, buy fertilizers to improve her banana plantation, and use the rest of the money to meet the basic needs in life.

Her major challenge is insufficient capital to boost her business and the harsh weather, which affects her cash flow. Despite all these challenges Hope has been able to provide good education and basic needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: M. Khalil

texts.en:
M. Khalil is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students.

To earn a living, M. Khalil is a construction equipment supplier. Since 2008 he has been running this business, which is the only source of income for the family.

Currently, he needs to purchase construction products for his business, but he has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, M.Khalil is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase these products for his business. In the future, he hopes to be able to provide his children with quality education. He is very thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction products.

loans.name: Patience Group

texts.fr: Afi est une femme dynamique qui fait partir du groupe "PATIENCE" composé de 30 personnes du quartier Agoè à Lomé. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Afi mène le commerce des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne une fois par semaine dans le marché de sa localité. Elle reçoit la visite de beaucoup clients par jour compte tenu de la qualité de son accueil chaleureux. Les autres membres du groupe exercent de petits commerces de céréales et des produits alimentaires. Le crédit que Afi sollicite lui permettra d'acheter un sac de riz, un carton de pâte alimentaire et un bidon d'huile végétale. Avec  cette augmentation de son stock, elle pourra attirer plus de clients et gagner plus de bénéficices.
texts.en:
Afi is an energetic woman who is part of the group "PATIENCE", which is composed of 30 persons from the Agoè district in Lomé. She is 40 years old and the mother of three. She has been doing commerce in basic supplies in her district for over ten years. She gets her supplies once a week at the town's market. She has many customers each day because of her warm welcome. The other members of the group have small-scale businesses selling grains and grocery items. 

This loan Afi is requesting will enable her to purchase a sack of rice, a box of pasta, and a container of vegetable oil. With this increase in her inventory, she will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pasta, and vegetables oil

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En la calurosa ciudad de Nazca, vive Lucia, una mujer de 45 años de edad, la cual es madre de 8 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes ha luchado de manera incansable a pesar de las adversidades al lado de su esposo para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor y cariño. Día a día Lucia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y elaboración de pan, ella se levanta muy temprano para poder elaborar sus panes y poder venderlos a sus clientes, sobre todo en temporada escolar, lucia cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Lucia está muy contenta y agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar comprar insumos para la preparación de sus panes al por mayor como  harina por sacos, azúcar, levadura, entre otros y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ampliar su panadería y poder ofrecer mayores productos”.
texts.en:
In the hot city of Nazca, there lives Lucia, a forty-five year old woman. She is the mother of eight children whom she loves very much. Alongside her husband, she has fought tirelessly despite every adversity to provide her children with a decent life, and above all, a lot of love and affection. Every day Lucia works in her small business of making and selling bread. She gets up very early to make her bread and sell it to customers, especially during the school year. Lucia believes that she is succeeding in her business because she is responsible, and above all, she has a strong desire to get ahead.

Lucia is very pleased with and grateful for Kiva lenders since thanks to the support that they're giving to her, she will be able to buy ingredients at wholesale prices to make bread such as sacks of flour, sugar, and yeast, among others. She will also be able to continue striving to achieve her greatest dream: to expand her bakery and offer more products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and yeast, among others.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica al comercio, ganadería y cultivos de caña, arroz, maíz a dos horas e la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con su familia se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales patos, gallinas, cerdos, El se dedica a labores agrícolas en las zonas aledañas al distrito,cultivando maíz y arroz, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para cercar el perímetro de su terreno y de esta manera tener seguridad que personas ajenas no ingresen a su propiedad.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Zana district. The local population is dedicated to commerce, cattle raising, and cultivating sugar cane, rice, and corn some 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast.

With his family, Carlos Alberto raises and sells ducks, hens, and pigs. he also works as an agricultural laborer in the surrounding zones of his district, cultivating corn and rice.

He is soliciting a loan of 1,000 new sols to build a fence around the perimeter of his land. In this manner, he will have more security, preventing outsiders from entering his property.

loans.use: build a fence around his fields.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is 45 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the region of kampala in south Uganda. She is married and has four children. One of her children attends school.

For the past five years, Goreth has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. From her farm, she sells chickens and eggs.

To help expand her business, Goreth has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more poultry birds, and would help Goreth to generate additional profits. In the future, Goreth hopes to be able to acquire more land.

Goreth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Goreth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional poultry birds

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es:
Dimas de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta  6º grado, ya que por problemas económicos de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando, él esta acompañada , su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, sus hijos los cuales conviven con ellos, son los que le ayudan en la agricultura , ademas en la familia hay dos nietos que  tanbien dependen de él.

Dimas se dedica a la agricultura , puesto que él nació cerca de donde se cultivaba mucho maíz y desde la edad de 10 años, inicio con la aventura en los campos agrícolas, junto a su padre;  fue con ellos que aprendió esta actividad. Sin embargo, también cuida 3 bovinos que tiene. Dimas viaja unos 15 minutos a pie, para llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivo de maíz ,actividad que realiza con su hijo y lo realizan  de 7 am a 11 am  todos los días 

Dimas invertirá el crédito, en la compra de insumos ( abono, insecticidas y fungicidas )para 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y un ternero para hacer yunta con uno que ya tiene y poder trabajar con ellos, el cual espera tener buenas cosechas y mejores ingresos  para ofrecerles una estancia adecuada, para su familia  y poder abonarle a su crédito

Los sueños y metas, que quisiera lograr Dimas son: primero que allá una buena cosecha, que es lo básico para su familia, poder darle educación a sus nietos. El préstamo sera de mucha ayuda para Dimas, porque así, podrá beneficiar bien sus cultivos y los ingresos podrán ser mejores, así mismo lograra, tener  de donde cancelar el crédito y si hubiesen ganancias mejorar su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Dimas is 45 years old.  He was unable to continue school after 6th grade due to his parents' economic situation.  He is married and his wife takes care of their household.  Their children live with them and help Dimas with the farm, and there are two grandchildren in the family who are also his dependents.  

Dimas works in agriculture.  As he was born near where a lot of corn is grown, at the age of ten he took up agricultural work which he did with his father.  This is how he learned his occupation.  However, he also has three cows.  Dimas travels about 15 minutes on foot with his son every day between 7:00 AM and 11:00 AM to get to where his corn fields are.  

Dimas will use the loan to buy inputs (fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide) for 7,000 square meters of corn as well as a calf to form a team with one he already has so he can work with them.  He hopes to have good harvests and a higher income to provide his family an adequate home and to pay off the loan. 

Dimas's dreams and goals are, first, to have a good harvest, which is essential for his family, and to be able to educate his grandchildren.  The loan will be very helpful for Dimas because it will benefit his crops and increase his income, which will allow him to pay off the loan and, if he makes a profit, improve his very modest home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide for 7,000 square meters of corn, as well as a calf to form a team along with one he already has

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1971. He is married and a father of four. Mohammad has been running his laundry store for one year. His work is his only source of income. His father helped him in starting this project in the past. To keep running his work professionally, he needs to buy a new clothes washing machine in order to be able to respond to his customers’ requests. This will also help him be more productive and earn better income. But he doesn't have enough money to buy the needed washing machine. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a clothes washing machine

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 25-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for five years, and she earns additional income by providing manicures and pedicures.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Jennifer explains that she has borrowed and repaid 14 prior loans from NWTF. Jennifer aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional sacks of charcoal for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mineene est une commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’une association  d’affaires                 «  Changamuka », âgée  de 44 ans et mère de 5 enfants, dont  trois étudient et les 2 autres sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse d’haricots. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter 3 sacs d’haricots pour accroitre son activité. Son conjoint est  un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir,  elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs en leur octroyant de crédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclus  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Mineene, has been a merchant for two years and is a member of the business association "Changamuka". She is 44 years old and the  mother of five children (three are students and two are very young). She is a vendor of beans and is requesting a loan from Hekima. She is going to purchase 3 sacks of beans to increase her business. Her husband is a civil servant. She had started off with funds from her husband. 

For the future, she would like to provide education for her children and feed them. Thus, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banks by granting them loans without the need for collateral.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of beans

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria de 50 años de edad,  pertenencia a una familia de muy escasos recursos económicos y bastante numerosa y sus padres no teniendo los recursos, no le pudieron dar el estudio a ninguno de sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja la agricultura, dos de sus hijos están acompañados y formada su propia familia, de los dos que viven con ella; una estudia bachillerato, la otra tiene una enfermedad y no estudia.

Gloria se dedica a trabajar en la venta de comida típica, esto se lo enseño su madre, ya que lo hacían para obtener un ingreso adicional para su familia. Hoy en día lo sigue haciendo, le ayuda su hija cuando regresa de estudiar, madruga los días que elabora venta, también le prepara los alimentos para su esposo. Luego,  se dirige de casa en casa a vender cuando su hija no estudia le va ayudar o cuida a su hija que tiene problemas,  también en las épocas agrícolas le ayuda al esposo, al  trabajo de la tierra para el cultivo de maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar animales de granja cerdos y para la compra de concentrados para la alimentación de los mismos.

Su propósito es, seguir trabajando apoyando en el estudio a su hija y espera para el futuro comprar unos animales bovinos(vacas lecheras).
texts.en:
Gloria, 50, belonged to a large, low-income family. Since her parents were poor, they couldn't pay for their children's education. Gloria's husband is a farmer, and two of her children are married and have their own families. Two children still live with her; one is in high school, and the other is sick and doesn't go to school.

Gloria runs a business selling local dishes from recipes her mother prepared to earn additional income for her family. Today, Gloria is following in her mother's footsteps, and her daughter helps her when she gets home from school. Gloria rises at dawn on the days she prepares the food for sale, and she also cooks for her husband. Then she sells door-to-door. Her daughter helps her out when she's not studying, or she cares for her sick sister. Gloria also works with her husband during the farming season, tending to the corn crops. 

She has applied to Fundación Campo to buy pigs and animal feed concentrate. Her goal is to keep working to help pay for her daughter's education, and she hopes the she will one day be able to buy a few dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed concentrate.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa received a Kiva loan that he was able to pay back without challenges. His business improved after the previous loan term and he is back. He seeks a loan to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood for his business. He also owns a motorbike that he uses to transport people to earn an extra income. He has ambitions that in the future he will be running a successful wholesale business. The income that he will raise will improve his standards of living and also pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
Kuña pora se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus hijos por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una.
Juana tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de productos, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene una buena variedad que les ofrece siempre. Quiere seguir trabajando para poder crecer y el día de mañana tener un negocio más grande.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de distintas variedades de productos, para que pueda surtir su negocio, quiere poder comprar golosinas, bebidas, galletitas, etc. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña pora group was formed in the city of Asunción, by 17 ladies, all heads of household who want to help their families through their efforts.  They are all involved in the elimination of poverty program as a means to learn of their individual situations.

Juana has a snack shop where she sells all sorts of items and she says that she has good customers and things are going well for her because she has a variety of products.  She wants to continue working so she can grow tomorrow and have a larger business.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy different varieties of products to stock her business.  She will buy snacks, drinks, cookies, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity that will allow her to continue to grow.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Saibatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il compte de femmes très dynamiques, elles  vivent dans le même village et sont dans le programme des bancs villageois depuis plus une décennie. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Saïbatou (assise dans la troisième rangée à droite,  avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Malgré son âge avancé, elle demeure une femme très active au sein du banc villageois. Elle est âgée de 54  ans, mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 03 garçons et 05 filles. Elle est vendeuse de fruits suivant les saisons : banane, « jabéré » igname sauvage très prisé, pastèque et autres. La banane est achetée dans un village proche via des femmes planteuses, pour le « jabéré elle se le procure à travers les enfants de son propre village.

 Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter des régimes de banane revendus par tas de 100 à 1 000 Frs CFA, et le jabéré cuit par morceau de 25 à 100 Frs CFA voir plus.

Les bénéfices réalises lui permettent d’augmenter son épargne dans le but de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 5, 2000 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It is composed of very energetic women living in the same village who have been participating in 'banc villageois' programs for over a decade. The women's main work involve small-scale commerce.

Ms. Saïbatou (sitting at the right in the third row with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. Despite her advanced age, she remains a very active woman within the 'banc villageois'. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of eight children (three boys and five girls). She is a vendor of seasonal produce:  bananas, jabéré (a highly prized wild yam), watermelons, etc. Bananas are purchased in a nearby village from women planters; the jabéré are procured through the children from her own village. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase some bunches of bananas sold in lots of 100 for 1,000 francs CFA. The cooked jabéré is gotten 25 pieces at a time for 100 francs or more.

The profits earned enable her to augment her savings with the goal of further attending to her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and jabéré (wild yams) to sell

loans.name: Floresmila

texts.es:
Floresmila tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Ternique,ubicado en Morropon su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, brindando asesoramiento a sus clientes que en la mayoría son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa para damas y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Floresmila is 36 years old. She lives in the community of Ternique, located in Morropon. Its residents work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells beauty products, offering an assortment to her customers, most of whom are women. She has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy women's clothing so she can grow her business, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a proud farmer within his local community. He's managed his farming business for 16 years. He grows rice crops, and he earns about PHP 30,000 every harvest season. But on his previous harvest he obtained less income, which is the reason why he wasn't able to supply his rice farmland with complete farm inputs. With his situation, he decided to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 30,000. This loan amount will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He knows that sustaining his rice farmland with complete farm inputs will also enable him to obtain a plentiful harvest. By then, he could let his two children finish their studies and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 27-year-old resident of Nakuru. He is married to Beatrice, who earns some additional income, and they are blessed with one child, aged two years.

Samuel is in the motorcycle transport industry, and he has been running his business for the last three years. To enable him repair and service his motorcycle to ensure effective and efficient service for his customers, he has applied for his second loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, from KADET LTD. 

Samuel's monthly income right now is KES 21,000. He plans to use the profits realized from his expanded business to start a business for his spouse. He hopes and dreams that his future business and his family will be prosperous.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle so he can provide effective and efficient service to his customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married mother of three children living in the Philippines. She explains that she works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she buys and sells dried fish. She also earns additional income by raising pigs.

Virginia is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through 19 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Pekeshe

texts.en: Pekeshe appreciates both Kiva and Yehu for their support. With the help of the previous loan, she has managed to develop her business by purchasing cosmetics. She is requesting a new loan of KES 20,000 to purchase shampoo, hair braids, and body lotions for her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair braids, and body lotions for her business

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego es un joven emprendedor de 20 años, que vive con sus padres, a los que desea apoyar para llevar la carga económica del hogar. Su dinamismo y energía las emplea realizando diversos oficios para conseguir recursos económicos que le permitan aportar para solventar algunos gastos familiares; ha trabajado como lavador de carros y motos, en tiendas de video juegos, como mensajero, como conductor, o en las actividades que le ofrezcan pues debe generar sus propios recursos. Sin embargo, con su espíritu de superación y con el ánimo de tener una estabilidad tanto laboral, como financiera, desea iniciar su propio negocio de alquiler de video juegos, para lo cual ya posee el local, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar los equipos y los mobiliarios (televisores, play station, x box, sillas, entre otros), así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, en el que pretende trabajar de 10:00 am a 10:00 pm, aprovechando la ventaja que en el sector donde estará ubicado hay muchos niños y jóvenes que serían potenciales clientes y, así logrará tener la estabilidad que desea para salir adelante. Diego  es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos debe trabajar con disciplina, empeño y mucho esfuerzo, sólo así podrá salir adelante y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 20 years old and a young entrepreneur. He lives with his parents, whom he would like to help with household expenses. Diego uses his dynamism and energy in various jobs to earn money so that he can contribute to his family’s household expenses. He has worked washing cars and motorcycles, in video game stores, as a messenger, as a driver, and in other odd jobs that are offered to him so that he can earn his own money.

Diego would like to start his own video game rental business, because he would like to better himself and to have some financial and work stability. He already has the location for his business, but he needs a loan to buy equipment and furniture (televisions, PlayStation, Xbox and chairs, among others). With these he will be able to start his business, in which he plans to work from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. He plans to capitalize on the advantage that in the area where he is located there are many children and young people who could be potential customers. He hopes that his business will provide him with the stability he is looking for in order to get ahead in life. Diego is aware that he must be disciplined and put in a lot of effort and hard work to achieve his goals – which are to get ahead in life and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment and furniture (televisions, PlayStation, Xbox, chairs etc.) to open his video game rental business.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
Don José de 70 años de edad, proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos y siendo el mayor de 5 hermanos tenia que responder y ayudar a su padre y madre quienes se dedicaban a trabajar la agricultura y no le pudieron dar ningún tipo de estudio. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, procrearon dos hijas, una con mucho esfuerzo le esta dando el estudio y esta cursando un bachillerato y la otra ya esta acompañada.

Él manifestó que a trabajado toda su vida desde que estaba muy pequeño, ya que su padre le inculco a dedicarse a esta actividad; también a la crianza de ganado, trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos, los tiene cerca de su casa, la esposa le ayuda cuando van a abonar y otras actividades relacionadas a la agricultura, también se dedica a cuidar animales de granja cerdos y gallinas.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para comprar una vaca, la cual ya esta pronto por parir y le ayudara al ingreso familia por la venta de leche.

Desea, sacar adelante a su hija porque ya pronto terminara el bachillerato y quiere ingresar a la universidad y pretende  apoyarla,  ademas con la cosecha espera comprar un par de vacas con las que le puedan producir.
texts.en:
Don José, 70 years old, comes from a family with few economic resources. Being the oldest of five siblings, he was called on to help his father and mother who worked as farmers and who were unable to give him any education at all. His wife takes care of the house and they have two daughters. Through a great deal of hard work they are giving one of their daughters an education, while the other one already has a partner.

He notes that he has worked all his life since he was very young because his father taught him to make a living from farming as well as cattle raising. He works every day with his crops, which are near his house. His wife helps him to fertilize and carry out other activities related to farming. She also helps care for the farm animals, pigs and chickens. 

Funding from the loan will be used to purchase a cow that is ready to give birth; this will enable the family to sell milk and increase earnings.

He wants to help his daughter get ahead since she will soon finish high school and wants to enroll in the university and he hopes to support her. In addition, with his harvest he hopes to purchase a pair of cows that he can reproduce.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 44-years-old. She is a widow and has five children. She stopped school at an early age and got married. She was prompted to start running her own small business after the death of her husband six years ago. Her business deals in the sale of coca-cola products for wholesale and retail in her hometown of Livingstone, Zambia.

The business helps Mercy to pay for her children's school fees and take care of their basic needs. She starts her day at five o'clock in the morning and walks to the local breweries to get her orders. She then makes her way to her shop and makes sure her drinks are displayed very well so that customers can choose to buy from her as there are a lot of people doing the same business. Mercy says in the six years she has been running her business, her profit margins have remained more or less the same.  This is because she has not had the money to invest in her business so that she can order more drinks.

A loan of 5,000 ZMW will help Mercy order more drinks for resale. This will improve her revenue and make it easier for her to provide for her children. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

Her dream is to see her five children go through college so that they can hopefully get good employment and take care of her in the future.

loans.use: to order more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre casado de 46 años de edad, quien vive con sus 10 hijos los cuales son: un hombre y nueve mujeres, cinco de ellos se encuentran casados y los otros aun apoyan a sus padres y viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica al trabajo de jornalero en su comunidad, ya que por falta de recursos económicos no cuenta con su propia siembra. Ahora cuenta con 28 años de experiencia en esta actividad que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a lo económico.
A raíz de esta labor obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de puertas y ventanas para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que tiene ahora.
Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su vivienda y más adelante tener un negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan es un hombre casado de 46 años de edad, quien vive con sus 10 hijos los cuales son: un hombre y nueve mujeres, cinco de ellos se encuentran Juan is a 46 year old married man.  He lives with his ten children, one son and nine daughters.  Five of them are married and the others are still supported by their parents.  They live in the Sololá department.  He says that he works as a laborer in his community because, due to lack of funds, he does not have his own sown land.  Now he has twenty-eight years of experience in this activity and has been quite productive economically.
As a result of his labor, he earns acceptable income and profits.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 6,000 GTQ to purchase doors and windows to improve his living conditions.  He will pay the loan with the income form the work that he currently has.  His dream is to finish construction of his home and later, have a business that will help him improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia sigue trabajando en sus ventas ambulante, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, en su anterior crédito con Kiva pudo comprar varios productos para poder venderlos y asi seguir creciendo cada vez mas, le ha sido de mucha ayuda y utilidad. 
Hoy pide de nuevo un crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de de remeras, blusas, calzas,ropa interior,   sombrero, cacerola, latona,jarra forrada,bolsones, etc. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad de crecimiento que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Emilia is still working as a street vendor. She is a very hard worker and a fighter. Her previous Kiva loan allowed her to purchase several items to sell in order to keep growing more and more. It was very helpful and useful to her. 

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can invest it in purchasing t-shirts, blouses, tights, underwear, hats, pots, brass bowls, thermoses, bags, etc. She is grateful for this new opportunity for growth she is receiving, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy pots, thermoses, t-shirts, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 27 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala, in western Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Douglas has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand his business, Douglas has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase inventory, and will help Douglas to generate greater profits and increased family income that will help him pay his children's school fees. Douglas hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger shop. 

Douglas is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Douglas who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: increase his inventory through buying more buckets, saucepans, and trolleys.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school.

For the past three years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. From her farm, she sells chickens and eggs.

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more chickens, which Cissy feels would help her generate more profits. In the future, Cissy hopes to able to build a better poultry house.

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cissy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional chickens

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 50 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the region of kampala in southern Uganda. She is a widow with five children.

For the past two years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her clothing boutique. To earn a living, she sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more clothes, which Hadija feels will help her generate more profits and open up another business. In the future, Hadija would like to be able to construct a rental house.

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hadija who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy Daniel Mayor de edad casado con tres hijos mayores de edad, originario del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador que lucha día a día para salir adelante. es propietario de un taller de soldadura en general  el cual presta el servicio de elaboración de estructuras residenciales como: vergas, portones, techos en perlines, entre otros, negocio que tiene desde hace varios años el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Freddy desde muy temprano inicia su jornada de trabajo finalizando algo tarde para así brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes, el objetivo de de este crédito es para comprar materiales de soldadura y hierro para la elaboración de estructuras para sus clientes debido a que muchos de sus clientes le encargan para diciembre estructuras. Freddy esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de escasos recursos económicos y países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en: Freddy Daniel is elderly, married, and has three adult children.  He is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  He is known for being a hardworking, responsible man who works daily to get ahead.  He has a welding workshop where he makes residential structures such as spars, doorways, roofs, and other things.  He runs the business out of his home and has many customers.  Freddy gets up very early every morning to begin his work shift and works late to provide better services to his customers.  He will use the money from this loan to buy welding supplies and iron bars to make structures for his customers, because many of them want them for December.  Freddy is very grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who help people of low resources in poor countries have dignified means of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hector Guadalupe

texts.es: Héctor de 46 años de edad, desde hace 8 años se dedica  a la venta de dulces típicos como: maní azucarado, cocada, dulces de leche, de coco, maní salado, etc. vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa. Héctor está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de dulces típicos por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Hector is 46 years old and has been selling candies such as sugared peanuts, coconut, milk candy, salted peanuts, etc.  He has been selling through the different neighborhoods and markets near his home on foot for the past eight years and uses his earnings to pay for some of his household expenses.  He lives with his children and wife.  Hector is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy candy in bulk since this is his only source of income.  In this way he can provide his family with a better quality of life without limitation.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en:
Shoista is married and has four children. She is 43 years old. Shoista for many years did not have any source of income. Her husband is a taxi driver. She decided to start a new business of animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course ‘To Get Ahead’ run by a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her husband will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy cattle so she can organize her new business. She will fatten the cattle in her house for 6 months and sell them in the local market. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle so she can organize a new business.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inaugurer l’installation du banc villageois est la réalisation d’un vœu d’accéder au crédit pour l’ensemble des membres du groupement. Afin de mener des activités génératrices de revenu axées sur le petit commerce.
 
Madame Fatoumata  (assise dans la première rangée à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée  et mère de 07 enfants dont 01 fille et 06  garçons. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits de consommation courante. Son activité consiste à l’achat en gros de savon par carton pour la revente au détail dans son village et dans le marché hebdomadaire.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle veut acheter cinq cartons de savon à 10 000 Frs CFA le carton et divers produits de consommation courante pour la revente au détail.

 Les bénéfices, elle compte accroître son épargne d’une part et d’autre part acheter un ou deux moutons.
texts.en:
[This group] was newly created at the installation of the 'banc villageois' to realize a wish of all the group members to have access to loans for running revenue-generating businesses centered on small-scale commerce.

Ms. Fatoumata (sitting in the first row at the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (a girl and six boys). She sells various typical consumer goods. Her business involves purchasing soap by the box wholesale to sell retail in her village and at the weekly market. 

With her new loan, she wants to purchase 5 boxes of soap at 10,000 francs CFA per box, plus a variety of other consumer products for retail sale. 

The profits will be used to increase her savings, as well as to purchase one or two head of sheep.

loans.use: to purchase soap and various typical consumer goods to resell

loans.name: Diarry's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 08 Mai 2009 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide dans le programme vu qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur neuvième cycle.   Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles  s’activent  dans le petit commerce et la culture sous pluie.

Madame Diarry  (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite tenue), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans, mariée  et mère de deux enfants l’un âgé de 06 ans et l’autre de 10 ans. C’est une femme très engagée dans le groupement et s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme et d’huile végétal qu’elle se procure au marché international de la sous région pour la revente au détail dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires aux alentours. 

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un fût d’huile végétal et 03 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme.

 Les bénéfices sont utilisés à  soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges sanitaires des enfants et de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 8, 2009 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The women of the group have been able to acquire solid experience in the program, since they just started their ninth loan cycle. The group members live in the same village and are inspired by a spirit of mutual assistance and support. They are active in small-scale commerce and farming during the rainy season.

Ms. Saïbatou (standing at the far right with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children, who are 6 and 10 years old. Ms. Saïbatou is a very dedicated woman in the group and is active in selling palm oil and vegetable oil, which she procures at the sub-regions' international market in order to resell them in her village and at the weekly markets in the area. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase a barrel of vegetable oil and three 20-liter containers of palm oil. 

The profits will be used to support her husband in managing the children's healthcare and schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is running a beauty parlor for more than ten years for a living. She offers haircuts, spa and other services, earning well for her family. She used her previous loan in her business accessories and has successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional cosmetics products in order to improve her services. Eva desires to improve her business to have a better income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics products.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
For the last 13 years Rebecca, who is 45 years old, has been running her business selling new clothes in Nakuru.

She makes a monthly income of KES 20,000 right now, and to enable her make even more money from this business she knows that she has to add to her stock of clothes; this will be facilitated by her first loan of KES 20,000 which she has applied for from KADET Ltd.

She intends to use the profits anticipated from her expanded business to buy more stock of clothes, to educate her child and to pay back her loan to KADET Ltd. She is married and they are blessed with one child aged 17 years old.

loans.use: To buy more stock of new clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a buy and sell business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Renalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from giving manicures/pedicures. Renalyn is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, fish, spices, etc., for her food vending business.

Renalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Yonisa

texts.en:
This is Yonisa, a 54-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a construction worker. She and Jose have children. They work hard to provide income for their family's living expenses and to manage their household.

To earn a living, Yonisa operates a sales business. Specifically, she sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. Her customers' orders are purchased with cash by the dealer and then given to customers along with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in catalogs. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the local community. She typically earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP. The loan proceeds would be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, shampoo, cologne, deodorants, perfumes, soaps, fabric softeners, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. With help from the loan, Yonisa hopes that her business will expand because she dreams of providing her family with a better life.

Every week she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. During their meetings, she also draws strength and inspiration from her co-members and from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her sales business by purchasing additional supplies and merchandise (e.g., clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics).

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Josefina is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josefina has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: A`ala 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called A`ala 2 and is made up of three women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Motra is 35 years old, married and has children. She started her business on a small scale selling clothes two years ago. Over time, her income has increased and she is able to cover the cost of her children's expenses. 

She has to expand her business activities so she requested a loan of 30,000 YER to buy dresses, pants and blouses, etc.. This would enable her to earn large profits by catering to a large number of clients. She hopes to bring up her children well and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ladies clothes like dresses, pants and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Irienne

texts.en:
Irienne is a Cameroonian age forty-one and married with five children. The oldest who is twenty is in high school while the youngest is three and in nursery school. 

She has been in this business for the past two years which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her turnover by sixty-five percent. Her standard of living will as well be improved.

loans.use: To buy spices to grind into powder for resale.

loans.name: M. Riaz

texts.en:
M. Riaz is a 51-year-old man who lives with his family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2003, M. Riaz has been running his own general store near his house, and it is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc. Due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, he has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for buying products for  his general store.

loans.name: Ana Argentina

texts.es: Ana Argentina mayor de edad soltera originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal. Es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa tanto para niño como adultos, zapatos, chinería, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, ella realiza sus compras en mercados de otros municipios del país sus compras son al contado y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales las realiza de forma ambulante la mayoría de sus clientes son fijos y asalariados, inicia su negocio como una forma de poder seguir estudiando y trabajando para salir adelante, uno de sus sueños es poder coronarse como toda una profesional, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en meraderia en general como: diversos estilos de ropa tanto para adultos como niños, cosméticos, zapatos entre otros
texts.en: Ana Argentina is a single woman from one of the towns in northern Chinandega, located in the western area of the country. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and very driven to improve herself. She is a micro-entrepreneur who works buying and selling merchandise in general, such as a variety of styles of clothing for children as well as for adults, shoes, nick-knacks, cosmetics, plastic products, and other items. She purchases these items from markets in other towns across the country. She purchases in cash and sells for cash, and makes her sales on the street. Most of her customers are regulars and earn a salary. She started her business as a way to be able to stay in school while working in order to get ahead. One of her dreams is being able to succeed as a professional. The purpose of this loan is to invest in merchandise in general, such as: different styles of clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, shoes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
LUISA AURORA, tiene 51 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "La Amistad", éste grupo va por su segundo crédito, ha sido un grupo puntual en sus pagos, han demostrado ser personas responsables con las ansias de hacer crecer sus negocios y así salir adelante mejorando su capacidad económica.
Desde hace diez años, Luisa Aurora se dedica a tejer, ella teje chompas, ajuar para bebes, colchitas, etc. Gracias a ésta actividad ella puede asumir los gastos de sus casa y los de ella propiamente.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de material de trabajo como lanas, hilos, agujas de tejer, etc.
texts.en: Luisa Aurora, 51, belongs to the communal bank La Amistad [Friendship], which is in its second loan cycle. The group has made it payments on time. The members have been responsible, and they wish to grow their businesses and improve their financial situation. For ten years, Luisa Aurora has been weaving sweaters, baby sets, quilts, and other items. She has been able to pay household expenses and her own costs through her work. She will use the loan to buy materials such as wool, thread, and sewing needles.

loans.use: to buy wool for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts and millet

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento 4 DE MAYO, está compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres  varones,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Anahí, tiene 28 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de  10 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, electrodomésticos  también celulares, cargadores, accesorios, etc. Ella vive en la zona de  Villa Nuevo Potosí, este préstamo este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios de celulares por mayor  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, la señora Anahí enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 4 DE MAYO communal bank is comprised of nine members.   There are six women and three men.  All of them work at different business activities.  Anahí is the president of the bank.  She is 28 years old, and has two children, ages ten and eight.  She sells various items, domestic appliances, cell phones, chargers, and accessories, etc.  She lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area.

This loan is the first cycle within the institution.  She is going to use the loan to buy accessories for cell phones wholesale.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she has orders from her customers.

Anahí faces the challenge in her business of not having capital.  She will use the profits for the growth of her business.  Her wish is for her business to have more revenue and to financially support her family.  This way she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old; he married recently and lives in Gaza with his wife. 

For the past three years, he has run his own grocery store, which helped him in gathering money and funds for his marriage; he sells different kinds of food stuffs, like soft drinks and kids’ stuff. He hopes that this youth loan will allow him to buy a refrigerator, glass door and shelves. He plans to open a supermarket in the future. 

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, glass door and shelves for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 30 years old and married with four children, two of whom attend the public primary school. The family live in their own house in Gaza City, a Palestinian city in the Gaza Strip. With a population of 515,556, it is the largest city in the Palestinian territories.

For 5 years, Mahmoud has worked at his cosmetics shop. He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy display boxes and air conditioning. Mahmoud has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him rather than any other shops in the area because he treats them nicely. He hopes that his business continues to grow so that he can increase his income and be able to give his children good living conditions and meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy display boxes and air conditioning

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married to Susan and they are blessed with six children, aged 12, 10,  eight, five, three and one years.

George is in the farming industry and owns a quarry, a business he has been running for the last four years. George would like to hire more quarry miners to work in his quarry for increased production, and this will be made possible by his second loan of KES. 40,000 for which he has applied from KADET LTD.

His monthly income right now is KES. 20,000 and he intends to use profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate his children and to back his loan to KADET LTD. He hopes for a brighter future in his business and family life.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in his quarry

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is 33 years old; she lives in Nablus at Askar camp, a Palestinian refugee camp. It is located on the outskirts of the West Bank city of Nablus and was established in 1950 on 209 dunums of land. In 1960 the camp was expanded onto a further 90 dumums.  She lives with her husband and her three children in the family house. She sells all kind of vegetables and fruits in her vegetable shop which she opened one year ago. This business helped the family income, because her husband works in a public institution which generally pays low salaries, and they are a big family and need to provide for their kids.

Haya asked Ryada for this loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits because she had shortage in her capital and needs to increase her stock. She is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve her goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Her dream is to be well-know in the city this is why she tries to give the best service for her clients. 

Haya is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits so she will be able to increase her stock.

loans.name: Maritza Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  8 y de 4 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Maritza para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana y cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende en esta época de Navidad y Año Nuevo que se avecina. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 7 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The credit group "Leónidas Proaño" meets every fifteen days in a neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta. Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round and also for being a city with an unparallelled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Maritza lives in this city. She is twenty-five years old. She is married and has two children, aged four and eight years old. The oldest child attends school and the youngest attends kindergarten. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

To help her husband with home expenses, she sells all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells at home, where only her better known customers come. She works three to four days a week and also when she is not busy. She extends credit to her customers and collects every fifteen days. She will buy her merchandise from Guayaquil as needed. She has been doing this activity for seven years and it's going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing, which are the highest sellers during the Christmas and New Year season that is approaching. She has been in this credit group for seven years and she likes it because she began her business with her first loan. Her dream is to own her own home since where she's living now is rented.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es:
Serafin tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la producción y comercialización de plátano, desde hace más de 5 años, distribuyéndolo por las comunidades aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su finca y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Serafin, age 34, live with his spouse in the Buenos Aires district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

He has been producing and selling bananas for over five years.  He distributes them to the outlying communities in his district.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy fertilizer in order to fertilize his farm.  This way he will have a better production to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su bodega está ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas, aguas mineral y fruta para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 48, lives in the Cayaltí district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells groceries, and her store is located in her house.

She has requested a loan for 4,000 soles in order to buy more merchandise.  She will buy rice, sugar, milk, candy, soft drinks, mineral water, and fruit in order to stock her business.  This way she will have greater income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Celedonio

texts.es:
José Celedonio tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica hace 4 años a la venta de sandias, comercializándolo en las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de sandías adicionales a lo que comúnmente compra y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: José Celedonio, 58, lives with his wife in Morropon, located two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru. The residents are farmers, merchants, and cattle ranchers. José has been selling watermelon in areas close to his district for four years. He has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos to buy more watermelons than he usually does so that he can grow his business and earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy watermelon to sell.

loans.name: Hatima

texts.en:
This is Hatima. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase food ingredients for her food-preparing business. 
 
She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000, to buy more stock of rice, beans, charcoal and cooking oil for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, beans, charcoal and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Moisés Alexander

texts.es:
Moisés, es un joven emprendedor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 22 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos; estudio noveno grado y tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, desde hace 9 años, ahí le da trabajo a su papa; y un hermano. Actualmente, tiene una buena clientela, ya que su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, para ello trabajan durante todo el día, para que las entregas sean bien rápido. 

 Para comprar los materiales para su trabajo, viaja hasta la ciudad, en autobús, durante unos 20 minutos, ahí compra en una ferretería, ya que le dan buen precio y materiales de buena calidad.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar tubos y lona, para fabricar un canopi  móvil, el cual servirá como una galera para trabajar mas cómodo, ya que su canopi, le servirá para protegerse del sol y podrá moverlo a cualquier parte para realizar su trabajo, en las horas que mas calienta el sol, y así también sus ingresos serán mayores, para dar una mejor vida a su familia.

Esta planificando ahorrar y trabajar muy duro, para comprarse un terreno y hacer su casa, ya que viven alquilando.
texts.en:
Moisés is a young entrepreneur with a strong desire to succeed.  He is 22 years old, and married with two children.  He has a ninth grade education and has had an auto body and painting workshop for nine years.  There, he provides work to his father and a brother.  Currently, he has a good clientele because his work is of very good quality and they work all day to ensure that deliveries are very fast.  In order to purchase materials for his work, he travels to the city, a 20 minute bus ride.  There, he makes purchases at a hardware store since they give him a good price and offer good quality materials. 

The loan he is requesting is to purchase tubes and canvas to make a mobile canopy, which will serve as a gallery so that he can work more comfortably.  The canopy will serve as protection from the sun, and he a will be able to move it anywhere to do his work during the hours when the sun is hottest.  So, his income will be higher and he will be able to provide a better life to his family.  He is planning to save and work very hard to purchase land and build his house since they live in a rented home.

loans.use: to purchase tubes and canvas to make a mobile canopy.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a tailor by training. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 36 years of age and he is married with two children. Both his children attend school. He runs a tailoring business in Mombasa and he also owns a motorbike that transports people in town for an extra income. His business has grown ever since he started it four years ago. He has also been able to employ four people in the business. 

He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join them so that they can make savings and be able to access funding for their businesses. He has ambitions of owning a uniform center in the future. He now seeks a loan to buy cloth materials and an additional singer machine. The major challenge in the business is late payment by the clients. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials and an addidtional singer machine.

loans.name: M Azhar

texts.en: M Azhar is a very hardworking and active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 2010, M Azhar has been running a crockery shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase crockery products for his shop, but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. M Azhar has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery products for his shop. He wishes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items.

loans.name: Mandzanoo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called ‘Mandzanoo’ and they are starting their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and their second with Kiva. The group is made up of four members and it is represented by George. Members engage in varied business activities which include product sales like fishing nets, fresh fish and smoked fish. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like George (standing first from left in the photo). Currently, he has a business selling fishing nets. This business was handed over to him by his father who is old now and he wants to build this business. He is requesting GHS 800 to buy fishing nets which he can resell to customers (fishermen). This type of work allows him to generate income to support his family since he is married with three children. 

When asked what he likes about ID-Ghana, he responded that he likes working with the group and the savings he makes with the organization. They need a total loan amount of 3,100 GHS to increase their stock.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets to resell to customers (fishermen).

loans.name: Las Activas Del Sector C Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ACTIVAS DEL SECTOR C” está iniciando el sexto ciclo, la alcancía está conformada por 06 socios dedicados al comercio. Rosa es la presidenta del grupo ella tiene 60 años es casada con 02 hijos independientes. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y perfumería, su trabajo lo dirige desde su casa lleva vendiendo 03 años y se siente feliz porque puede disponer de su tiempo, entre sus clientes están sus  amigos, familiares y vecinos. Por otro lado también prepara pasteles para vender generándole un ingreso adicional. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, jabones y bijouteria. Rosa desea  tener un lugar donde abrir su negocio para tener mejores ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Rosa esta sentada es la segunda de la izquierda viste casaca color ploma oscura.
texts.en:
Las Activas del Sector C communal bank is in its sixth loan cycle. The group's six members are merchants. Rosa, 60, is the president. She is married and has two grown children. Rosa has been selling beauty products and perfumes from her house for three years. She is pleased that she manages her own schedule, and she counts her friends, relatives, and neighbors among her customers. She also makes and sells baked goods to earn additional income.
