She will use this loan to buy beauty products like perfume and soap and costume jewelry. Rosa wants to have a shop so that she can increase sales and income. The group thanks Kiva for the loan. Rosa is pictured second from the left and is wearing a dark purple coat.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala, in western Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his piggery, which deals in rearing and selling pigs. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more piglets and expand their pens, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and increase his daily income. Emmanuel hopes that in the near future he will be able to to have a bigger farm. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more piglets and expand their pens.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the region of Kampala, in western Uganda. She is married and has five children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Eunice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, posho, rice, bread and other items. 

To help expand her business, Eunice has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sugar, rice, soda, bread, salt and extra items needed, and will help Eunice to generate greater profits and bridge the financial gap in her business. Eunice hopes that in the future she will be able to provide better quality products. 

Eunice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eunice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, rice, soda, bread, salt and extra items needed in her shop.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Señor Vicente tiene 46 años es casado con 1 hijo, el se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Ingenio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor como Harina y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, el Señor Vicente enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el que enfrenta la falta de capital para aumentar su mercadería ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha venta, el Señor Vicente va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  ampliar la venta poniendo un almacén donde pueda vender variedad de productos de primera necesidad y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente, age 46, is married and has one child.  He sells groceries at his store, which is in the Villa Ingenio area.  This loan is his first cycle within the institution.  He will use this loan to buy groceries like flour wholesale.  This way he will increase his working capital.

In his business Vincente faces the challenge of the lack of capital to increase his merchandise.  This is because he has a lot of sales during this end of the year season.  His wish for his business is to increase sales by setting up a grocery store where he is able to sell a variety of basic needs products.  This way he will improve his income, and, therefore, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
EL señor Ismael   es un Comerciante de 63 años de edad Micro Empresario, vive en la ciudad de Trojes en el Oriente de Honduras. 
Don Ismael tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación el vende todo tipo de ropa nueva y usada, está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio con la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc. y así poder  brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.
Don Ismael espera que esta inversión le genere buenos ingresos para poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar y aprovechar la temporada navideña que es cuando más se vende este tipo de mercadería. Su Sueño es comprar una Casa.   

   
Trojes,  Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Ismael is a 63 year old merchant and small businessman.  He lives in the city of Trojes in eastern Honduras.

Ismael has a business located in his home, where he sells all sorts of new and used clothing.  He is asking for a loan so he can stock his business with blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, shoes, etc. so he can better serve his customers.

Ismael hopes that this investment will generate a good income to be able to continue supporting his family.  He wants to take advantage of the Christmas season when his sales in this type of merchandise are highest.  His dream is to buy a house.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2013.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Jungie

texts.en: Jungie is operating a venture raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living. For sixteen years Jungie has earned well from the farm and was able to provide sufficiently for the needs of his family. His previous loan from GDMPC that he used to boost up the farm was successfully repaid. He borrowed a new loan recently to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and fertilization. He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding and fertilization.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She is married and has 6 children and has been doing agriculture for 30 years. Her primary income comes from producing and selling milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: the bonus she gets from tea farm. Her biggest challenge is limited funds for farming. 

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, in order to get funds to expand her poultry farm. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, what asset financing is all about.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Rose replied, she will purchase more poultry which will increase egg production and therefore the income base will increase.

Rose owns a cow, poultry, a mosquito net, a DVD player, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, an automobile, electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a TV.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that is always fresh and fertile for agriculture. She is married, has three children, and has been doing farming for eight years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs. She also runs a business.

She says that she enjoys milking her dairy cows, while her biggest challenge is plowing and digging her farm.

When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, she replied that it offers better services. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, she answered that MFIs give their loans at a low interest rate. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Jackline said, "it will help her purchase a water tank that will help as a water source for irrigation." Jackline owns cows, poultry, a mosquito net, electricity, a TV, and a DVD player but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Chepkemoi

texts.en:
Chepkemoi lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. She has one child and has been doing farming for three years. Her major income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. She also has a personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Milking her dairy cows." Her biggest challenge is "finding a ready market for the products." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Chebirir."

Chepkemoi was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "they offer their loans at a low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "they give loans to small scale farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Chepkemoi said that it will help them buy a chaff cutter that will provide more feed for her dairy cows and thus produce more milk, which will be sold and the income generated will help him educate his children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Chepkemoi owns the following: "a cow, poultry, a bicycle, a mosquito net, running water, a TV, and a DVD player" but does not own "a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, an automobile, electricity, solar power, or a sewing machine."

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Rosa Betzabeth

texts.es:
Rosa Betzabeth tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su menor hijo y su madre en el caserío Pan de Azúcar del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, vendiendo la leche en el mercado de la zona, en la parte posterior a su domicilio se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, animales de corral, es una madre emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y chivos y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Betzabeth is 34 years old and lives with her youngest son and her mother in the rural community Pan de Azúcar, in the Oyotún district. The local population works in agriculture, trade, and cattle raising, and is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising cattle and selling the milk in the local market. Behind her house, she also raises and sells goats and small farm animals. She is an enterprising mother who has requested a loan of 1500 PEN to buy pigs and young goats, so she can make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and young goats

loans.name: Edilbrando

texts.es:
Edilbrando tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito o de Oyotún, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda los servicios de albañilería en la zona y caseríos aledaños, es conocido por la labor que brinda desde hace 11 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de trabajo cemento y una segunda parte para arreglar su herramienta de trabajo una mescladora y de esta manera seguir trabajando y generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: He lives with his wife and son in the district of Oyotún, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru’s northern coast.  The people of Oyotún are engaged in farming, business, and raising cattle.  He provides bricklaying services in the area and surrounding villages.  He is known for the work that he has been providing for eleven years.  He is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase cement work materials and to repair his work tool, a cement mixer.  In this way, he will continue working and generating higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase work tools and repair a cement mixer.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de jornalería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos agrícolas abonos y compra de palanas, zapapico y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Raúl, 39, lives with his family in rural Oyotun, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise cattle. He is a day laborer and has applied for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy farming supplies, manure, levers, and picks so that he can keep earning money to support his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Rosadina

texts.es:
Rosadina tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en la zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación de tamales y los vende por las calles de Oyotún, es muy conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un carrito para distribuir sus productos y al mismo tiempo para ofrecer a la venta hamburguesas y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosadina is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in the rural area of Oyotún, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants farm, engage in commerce, and raise livestock.

She makes tamales and sells them on the streets of Oyotún. She is very well known in the area for the work she does and has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles in order to purchase a cart for distributing her product and at the same time to sell hamburgers. This way she will have greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cart for selling hamburgers.

loans.name: Luz Rocio

texts.es:
Luz Rocío tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de gas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que se realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar gas y así incrementar su negocio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Rocío is 20 years old, and lives with her two children and her husband in the district of Oyotún, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. Its inhabitants farm, engage in commerce, and raise livestock. 

She sells gas and her business is located in her home. They are a close-knit family that does its best in the work it does. She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy gas and this way expand her business, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy gas for expanding her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia, 55, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Bonifacio, a taxi driver, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Lucia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Lucia dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to have an abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married and has children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She operates a business selling coconuts at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is asking for a loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money from her cloth selling business. Besides the cloth selling business, she has a food stall.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil  for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil  for her business.

loans.name: Juan Anteportan

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona de 57 año de edad, sus estudios los realizo hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando; es por que sus padres no tenían el suficiente recurso para que el estudiara el bachillerato, desde entonces él comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre, luego con el tiempo emigro a los estados unidos a trabajar para poder mantener a los padres, quienes le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar y prepararse. 

El trabajo en diferente áreas, como la jardinería, construcciones de edificio o de casa; luego se regreso a El Salvador y se caso formando una familia que esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos . Ella se dedica al cuido de niños en los Estados Unidos, y también tiene dos hijos barones, los dos están acompañados.


Juan tiene un negocio de venta de cerdos, esto lo inicio desde que tenia 30 años de edad, lo aprendió de de un amigo que trabajaba con él. El no posee otra actividades, pero también se involucra el hijo que vive en su casa en la venta de cerdos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cancelar un adeuda que adquirió en otra institución; ya que el dinero que solicito fue para trabajar en la venta de cerdos. 


Juan menciona que en un futuro, seguirá trabajando con la fundación campo y que agradece la oportunidad que le brindo para optar al crédito.
texts.en:
Juan, age 57, went to school up until the ninth grade.  The reason he was not able to continue his studies is because his parents did not have enough resources for him to go to high school.  When he left school he started to work with his father in agriculture.  He later went to the United States to work in order to be able to support his parents, who gave him the opportunity to go to school and get prepared.

He worked in different areas like gardening and the construction of buildings and homes.  He then returned to El Salvador and got married.  He made a family, which is comprised of his wife and two children.  She takes care of children in the United States.  He also has two sons, who are both in relationships.

Juan has a business of selling pigs.  He started the business when he was 30 years old.  He learned from a friend, who worked with him.  He does not have other business activities.  However, the son who lives in his house is involved in the pig sales.

The loan that he is requesting is to pay off a debt that he has with another institution.  The money that he requested was to work in pig sales.

Juan says that in the future he will continue working with the Fundación Campo, and that he is grateful for the opportunity given to him to request a loan.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that he has with another institution.

loans.name: Juana Iveth

texts.es:
Juana de 28 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, al casarse dejo de estudiar y decidió dedicarse solamente actividades le  generaran ingresos a corto plazo. Por las necesidades, que se presentaban en el hogar y había que responder de manera inmediata.
Su esposo se dedica a la mecánica automotriz, trabajando en un taller  de la zona, días hay clientes y días que no hay trabajo. Su hijo mayor ya comenzó la educación básica y el menor se encuentra en parvularia.

Ella se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza  y joyería como enchapes,  los vende por catalogo, a través de pedidos,  ella vende todos los días  en los alrededores del cantón y otros lugares, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos alimenticios en una tienda. Decidió  dedicarse a la venta de estos productos, gracias a una amiga que le dejaba estos productos al crédito, para que ella los vendiera y obtuviera un margen de ganancia.

Necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio, con mercadería aprovechando la época navideña, siendo esta buena para el sector comercio. Ademas,  quiere diversificar sus productos, variar  un poco de lo que comúnmente ofrece  y que los clientes preguntan si los tiene. Ve otras oportunidades de negocio y así, tendrá mayores ganancias con su trabajo.

Desea retomar sus estudios, pero para esto tiene que tener una fuente de ingresos estables, que le permita aportar ingresos a su familia y llevar sus estudios, esto lo piensa realizar a distancia (sábados y domingos) y los días de semana trabajar .
texts.en:
Juana is 28 years old and completed the ninth grade.  When she got married, she stopped her schooling and decided to dedicate herself solely to activities that would generate income in the short-term.   There were needs in her household, and she had to respond to them immediately.

Her husband is an auto mechanic and works in a nearby shop.  Some days there are clients, and other days there is no work.  Their eldest son has already started grade school, and the younger one is in nursery school. 

Juan sells beauty products as well as jewelry.  She sells her goods on order through catalogs.  She works every day in neighboring areas and other places.  She has done this work for three years.  Previously, she sold food products in a shop.  She decided to start selling these particular products thanks to a friend who extended credit to her so that she could sell these goods and obtain a profit.

She needs a loan in order to stock her business with beauty products and jewelry, so she can take advantage of the Christmas shopping season, which is good for the commercial sector. Also, she wants to diversify her product offerings and to be able to provide things that her customers are requesting.  She sees other business opportunities which will lead to better earnings.

She also wishes to resume her studies, but for this she will need to have a stable source of income that will permit her to support her family and pay for her studies.  She plans to do her studying on weekends and work during the week.

loans.use: to stock her business with beauty products and jewelry, so she can take advantage of the Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: Lisandro Alberto

texts.es:
Lisandro de 45 años de edad,  posee un nivel académico de 9º grado, vive junto a su hija quien tiene 16 años (se encuentra estudiando 2º año de bachillerato) y junto a su esposa quien se dedica al comercio.


Lisandro es una persona que se dedica a trabajar como Albañil, desde hace 20 años y esa actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien ejerció esa labor. Él se independizo, desde aproximadamente 10 años.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mobiliario, tales como: mesa, sillas y una vitrina para mostrador de alimentos, ya que su esposa tiene un servicio de comedor desde hace 9 años  y pues en vista que su clientes han incrementado se ha visto en la necesidad de ampliarlo.

Él planea tener un negocio con su esposa, que le sea  rentable para la sostenibilidad de su  familia y que su hija concluya con su educación profesional,  para el desarrollo de su futuro laboral.
texts.en:
Lisandro is 45 years old and has a ninth-grade education.  He lives with his wife, who is an entrepreneur, and his 16-year-old daughter, who is in her second year of high school.

He works as a bricklayer and has done so for twenty years.  He learned the trade from his father, who did the same type for work.  Lisandro has worked independently for approximately ten years.

He is seeking this loan in order to buy furniture, such as a table and chairs, as well as a case to display food, since his wife has had a restaurant for nine years.  Her customer base has grown, so she needs to expand her business.

He plans to have a profitable business with his wife so that they can provide sustenance to their family and help their daughter complete her professional education for the development of her future career.

loans.use: to buy furniture, such as a table and chairs, as well as a display case, since his wife has a restaurant.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa de 55 años de edad,  no tiene un nivel académico, solo sabe firmar. Vive junto a sus 2 nietos que se encuentran estudiando 9º y 1º  año de Bachillerato. Ella además recibe remesas de su esposo, quien reside en los Estados Unidos.


Josefa se dedica al comercio de tienda y a los servicios domésticos,  desde hace varios años, dicho trabajo lo aprendió junto a su esposo. La decisión de tener una tienda, sucedió a raíz que solo su esposo trabajaba para la sostenibilidad de su familia,  por lo que decidió tener un negocio para apoyarle.

Josefa utilizara el dinero, para la compra de materiales como son: arena, bloque, cemento, hierro y piedra. Para la construcción  de un muro perimetral de su vivienda.

Ella planea tener una vivienda que reúna,  las condiciones para su familia y le genere seguridad como también un negocio que le sea rentable para su sostenibilidad económica y familiar.
texts.en:
Josefa is 55 years old and has little education; she only knows how to sign her name. She lives with her two grandchildren who are going to school and are in ninth and first year of high school. In addition she receives remittances from her husband, who lives in United States. 

Josefa works as a housekeeper and has had a store business for several years, work she learned with her husband. The decision to have a store resulted from the fact that only her husband was working to support the family so she decided to have a business in order to help him. 

Josefa will use the money to buy materials such as: sand, cement blocks, cement, rebar and gravel in order to build a perimeter wall for her home. She intends to have a home suitable for her family and which will provide security for her business which will be profitable for her and provide financial sustainability for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement blocks, cement, rebar and gravel for building a perimeter wall for her home.

loans.name: Genad

texts.en:
Genad, age 45, is from the village of Kvatia. He is married with two sons and lives with retired parents.

Genad runs an agricultural business and breeds two milk cows. During grazing season, when his cows milk well, the family makes cheese and sells at the neighboring town's open market. Besides this, Genad owns an old truck and seasonally works on harvest transportation. He works hard but his family still lives in poverty. 

In order to generate stable monthly income, Genad plans to start another business. With the loan amount, he will purchase a mini-bus which will be used by Genad on a mini-bus line [route]. He will transport passengers from his village to neighboring towns and earn daily income. Genad hopes this family initiative will be lucrative and he'll be able to increase his funds. Genad is a very enthusiastic man who wishes to ensure his family members with better living conditions. Genad and his family members are waiting for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus and start working on a bus line.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 41 years old, a taxi driver from the village of Urekhi. He is married with two grown children. Omar has a car and works from early morning till late at night as a taxi driver to earn living. In spite of his hard work, his earnings are still modest and hardly enough for family of four. 
 
In order to generate more funds and improve the standard of living for his family members, Omar plans to buy a mini-bus and work on line. If his loan is financed on the Kiva web-site, Omar will pay for a mini-bus and transport passengers from his district to the capital city. Omar has the appropriate driving license and rich experience in that field.  These are the reasons why he hopes his business initiative will be successful.

Omar awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus and transport passengers from his district to the capital city

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has  children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

 She operates a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and she cites seasonality as her major challenge, but she dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is married with two children who are still underage. They live at a rental house that has electricity and not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Prudence has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to receive financial support.

loans.use: to purchase  green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a mother and has children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Kebisone Bakyera Group

texts.en:
Norah is a 42-year-old woman, married with five children. She did not attend school during her childhood, which has prevented her from getting an  education and finding employment. She is a resident of Kiborogota cell, Rukungiri District. 

Norah has secured a loan of UGX 800,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) through her group (Kebisone Bakyera Group), and she plans to use this loan to buy more goats for trade. Norah got married at an early age and started her goat trading business to help pay school fees for her children. She is grateful to UGAFODE and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan francés desde hace 7 años en su casa de habitación, para luego venderlo por la colonia donde ella reside, la cliente solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: She lives with her husband and is a responsible, hardworking, honest woman.  She has her own bakery in her home, where she has been making sweet bread and French bread for the past seven years.  She sells it in her neighborhood.  She is asking for a loan to buy flour, lard, tinplate, and everything she needs to make more.  This plan to improve her bakery is very important to her, since this will improve her and her husband’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es: Nora tiene 58 años es casada tiene 03 hijos mayores de edad. Ella junto a 09 socios integran el  grupo “LA BUENA AMISTAD”  donde tiene el cargo de secretaria. Nora empezó su propio negocio motivada por sus amigas, hace 15 años tiene un puesto de golosinas en un mercado de su zona, gracias a su trabajo sus hijos han estudiado y salido adelante. El  préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y dulces para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. Nora se siente muy feliz por este préstamo y en representación de su grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA en la foto aparece sentada viste chompa verde y chaleco marrón.
texts.en:
Nora is 58 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. She and 9 other members make up the group "La Buena Amistad" [Good Friendship], for which she is the secretary. Nora started her own business with her friends' encouragement. She has had a sweets store in a local market for 15 years, and thanks to her work her children have studied and gotten ahead. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of sweets and candies for her business. Her greatest wish is to improve her business and to make a better income for her family. Nora is very happy about the loan, and on behalf of her group, thanks the Kiva lenders. In the photo she appears seated, wearing a green  sweater and brown vest.

loans.use: to buy sweets and candies

loans.name: Lugolobi

texts.en:
Lugolobi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the region of kampala south in Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Lugolobi has been working hard to manage his shop, which sells beer and soda wholesale. 

To help expand his business, Lugolobi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to Increase capital in the business and buy more beer and soda. Also, it will help Lugolobi to generate greater profits and boost the business by increasing inventory. Lugolobi hopes that in the future he will be able to develop his business further. 

Lugolobi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lugolobi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase capital in the business and buy more beer and soda.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 2 children aged 24 and 15 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.  In 2003, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to become self-employed and help in the smooth running of the home. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothes like jeans, shoes, ladies dresses, shirts, etc. for resale. In the future, Kadiatu plans to build her own house and a shop for business expansion and to educate her children up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy more clothes like jeans, shoes, ladies dresses, shirts, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isha.  She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 12 years old. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her as sales assistants.  

In 1998, Isha established her cotton textiles business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Isha requires a loan in order to purchase more cotton textiles for resale. In the future, Isha plans to build a dwelling house and educate her children to university level.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cotton textiles for resale.

loans.name: Brigido Hernan

texts.es:
Brigido es un señor casado de 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos de 2, 6, 8 y 11 años de edad, ambos aun se encuentran estudiando en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
El actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que eligió esta actividad porque es un negocio rentable y productivo, la cual le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han ayudado a aportar a la economía de su familia.
Ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia en esta labor, por lo que ha observado que en esta época del año las ventas incrementan por las diferentes actividades que realizan las personas. De manera que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario para poder ampliar la tienda y de esta manera mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Brigido is a married man, 30 years old, who lives with his 4 children, ages 2, 6, 8, and 11. The oldest two are still in school, in the Department of Suchitepequez. He currently has a grocery store which is located a few meters from his home. He says that he chose this business because it is profitable and productive, which has made him a good income and profits which have helped him to contribute to his family's finances. 

He now has several years of experience in this work, and from what he has observed, at this time of year sales increase due to different activities that people are doing. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ to buy everyday consumer goods, so that he can expand his store and improve service for his clients. His dream is to generate more profits to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Adalinda Rosa

texts.es:
Adalinda Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es un distrito de clima cálido, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde ofrece la venta de golosinas y bebidas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes y de eta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Adalinda Rosa is 51 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Buenos Aires. The majority of the local people work in farming and commerce. It is a district with a mild climate, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. She has a shop where she sells a variety of candies and beverages. She is seeking a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase groceries for her shop so that she can increase her income to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to supply her shop.

loans.name: Linda Claritza

texts.es:
Linda es una mujer muy trabajadora de 39 años de edad, casada, su grado de educación es  primaria completa, madre de 2 hijos menores de edad y ambos estudian la primaria. Ella vive en su hogar con sus 2 hijos, una sobrina y su esposo. Linda desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió de sus padres desde que estaba niña ellos se dedican a este rubro por lo que ella y su esposo tienen mucha experiencia en esta actividad. El terreno donde ellos cultivan fue donado por sus padres y otra parte comprada por su esposo con mucho esfuerzo el cual está ubicado a 3 km de su casa de habitación por lo que caminan por más de 10 minutos para llegar hasta él y en ocasiones en vestía que reduce más el tiempo de llegada para luego ellos comenzar su labor de abonar y limpiar sus cultivos. En esta actividad solo ellos 2 se involucran y se esfuerzan para no pagar mucho dinero en mano de obra ya que no cuentan con los recursos económicos para hacerlo. Linda espera obtener una excelente cosecha ya que de esto depende la economía de su hogar, su producción la venden a los intermediarios que llegan a la localidad.
Por lo que necesita financiamiento para la compra de abono, foliares, mano de obra y para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y poder cumplir con sus metas de apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, fortaleces el patrimonio para ellos y que el día de mañana tengan una tierra donde vivir y donde trabajar
texts.en:
Linda, 39, works hard and is married. She finished elementary school. She has two young children, who are in elementary school. She lives with her two children, a niece, and her husband. For 10 years, Linda has been farming, specifically growing coffee, a trade she learned from her parents when she was a child, and she has a lot of experience. Her parents gave her some of her land, and, after much labor, she and her husband bought the rest. The land is 3 kilometers from her house, and she walks more than 10 minutes to reach it. Sometimes, it takes less time. Then they fertilize and weed the plants themselves. They work hard so that they don't have to spend much money on labor, as they don't have the resources to do so. 

Linda hopes to have an excellent harvest because her household finances depend on it. She sells her output to intermediaries who come to the area. She needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay laborers to help with her coffee plantings so that she can reach her goals of paying for her children's education, building assets for them, and having land on which they can live and work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay laborers to help with her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad y tiene 67 años de edad, ella es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, panes, gaseosas, refrescos y otras cosas más, ella tambien vende celulares  y accesorios,  ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo audífonos y celulares, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives in the same city. She is 67 years old and a hard-working, enterprising person, helping her family get ahead in life through her work effort. 

She has a small grocery store where she sells various products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, bread, soft drinks, fruit drinks and other items. She also sells cell phones and accessories. 

She is a responsible person and for this reason was invited to participate in the "Señor de Coyllority" communal bank. On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise such as headphones and cell phones. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making her monthly payments.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as headphones and cell phones.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, patos, gallinas, su negocio lo distribuye en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: María Angélica, 37, lives with her family in Oyotun district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. María raises small animals like turkeys, ducks, and hens. She sells her products to local families. She has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy pigs and nutritious animal feed to grow her business and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and nutritious animal feed.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta lives in Changamwe near Mombasa Kenya. She is 38 years old, married and a mother of four. She operates a retail shop in her neighborhood. She has been in the business for seven years now and the business is the only income generator for her. She started the business from her savings over time. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy flour and sugar for the business. The challenge for her business is the competition from other traders and price changes. She hopes that in the next five years she will be operating a wholesale business. The income she will generate from the business will improve her standard of living and also improve the current business.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
The members of Rose's Group are located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. Rose is 43 years old, single, and she has one child. 

She has been selling ladies’ footwear for five years now. She is working so hard to be able to become a good mother and also to sustain her expenses currently. Things are going well for her business, and she gets her goods from the central market. 

Her dream is to expand her shop so she can sell more shoes, and is asking for a loan amount of 800 GHS to help reach this goal. 

The other member of the group is Juliet, who sells batiks. Together they need 1,500 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es: La alcancía “LAS AGUILAS” esta representada por 06 amigos y vecinos del mismo lugar. Maria es una de las socias tiene 43 años es casada con 02 hijos pequeños, motivada para darle a sus hijos una mejor educación hace 10 años empezó su propio negocio, una Bodega bazar donde vende diversidad de productos. Con el préstamo  solicitado podrá comprar productos de abarrotes como menestras, fideos, leche y bebidas, lo que mas desea para el futuro el surtir su negocio con toda clase de productos y poder ampliar el local donde funciona. El grupo quiere agradecer por este préstamo a todos los inversores de KIVA. Maria es la quinta de la izquierda esta sentada y viste pantalón color turquesa y casaca azul.
texts.en:
Las Aguilas Communal Bank is made up of six friends and neighbors from the same place.

María, 43, is one of the members.  She's married and has two small children.  María started her own business 10 years ago to give her children a better education.  She has a store where she sells a variety of products.

With the requested loan she'll be able to buy grocery products such as vegetable soup, noodles, milk, and beverages.  What she wants most for the future is to stock her business with all types of products and to be able to expand her space.

The group wants to thank all the Kiva lenders for this loan.  María's the fifth one from the left; she's seated and wearing turquoise pants and a blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Lizeth Gardenia

texts.es: La Señorita Lizeth tiene 22 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en economía en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Lizeth trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial,  la Señorita Lizeth va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de material de escritorio para sus estudios que durara el tiempo cinco años,  la Señorita Lizeth enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona Villa Fátima, su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría.
texts.en: Lizeth is twenty-two years old and single. She is pursuing a bachelor of economics at a well-known university in the city of La Paz. Lizeth works to pay for her education; she sells products from a very popular worldwide line of beauty supplies. Lizeth is going to use this loan to cover the various expenses that are involved in her education such as buying a desk for her studies, which will last for five years. Lizeth is confronted with challenges in her education, namely a lack of financial support from her parents and the need to work and study, which is very hard; however, she has a desire to succeed, excelling herself to complete her degree and be able to practice her profession. She lives in the Villa Fátima area. Her wish is to be able to complete her degree, find employment to practice her profession, and over time, to be able to pursue a master's degree.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Patococha  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Patococha está formado por 11 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene un clima frió, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosecha una gran variedad de hortalizas, al mismo tiempo que existen grades llanuras para la crianza de ganado. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son amables y luchan a diario para mejorar su economía y el futuro de sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Ana, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Patococha, grupo que le gusta por la solidaridad.
Doña Ana tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita del sector, la casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora. Ana labora desde hace 4 años como conserje de una escuelita y se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas los que los vende en su comunidad. También cultiva y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compre de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es de tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The loan group Patococha is made up of 11 women and one man, who live in the area of the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca. This parish has a cold climate and fertile land, where a great variety of fruits and vegetables are grown. There are also large plains for raising cattle. The people of the area, like the members of this group, are people who keep the culture and follow the traditions of their villages. They are kind and fight every day to improve their finances and the futures of their families.

One of the members of this group is Ana. She is requesting her first loan, with her friends at her side and as a member of the Patococha group, which she likes due to this solidarity. Ana is 33 years old, and a single mother to her nine-year-old son, who goes to a small school in the area. She owns the house she loves in. Ana has been working for four years as a caretaker at a small local school, and she raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens that she sells in her community. She also keeps a garden, which is for her family, but if there is extra produce, she sells it.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. Her goal is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with four children. 

She is engaged in running a sari-sari (variety) store to help augment the income of their household. She sells various items like eggs and cooking oil. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock like noodles, soap, bread, canned goods and toiletries.

In the future, Lucila would like to expand her business and increase her business’ profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock like noodles, soap, bread, canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, patos, cerdos y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yohana is 25 years old. She lives with her husband in the district of Cayaltí, a community which relies on agriculture, commerce and ranching, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú.

She raises and sells small animals such as turkeys, ducks, pigs and guinea pigs in the lot behind her home. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase feed for the animals, and the second part of the loan will go towards the purchase of pigs. In this manner her business will grow, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food pellets and pigs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 48 años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de ganado menor, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz, cerveza y alimentos para su ganado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina, 48, lives with her three children in the La Matanza district, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Agustina makes a living selling "chicha de jora" [corn beer] and beer and raising small livestock in back of her home.  She has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy corn, beer, and feed for her livestock so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beer, and animal feed

loans.name: Consuelo Del Milagro

texts.es:
Consuelo del Milagro tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, maíz y café, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y cerdos y así incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo del Milagro is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in the Oyotun district.  The people there work growing rice, corn, and coffee, in commerce, and raising livestock.  It is located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling small animals in the back part of her home.  She has more than eight years of experience with this business.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase animal feed and pigs to grow her business so that she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aracelly tiene 44 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es viuda y madre de dos hijos, de los cuales uno aún está a su cargo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería general (ropa, CD etc.).  Negocio que inicio hace siete años, dedicándose al estilismo. Después se dedicó a vender telas. Hoy en día cuenta con el negocio de venta en mercadería general. Su meta es seguir mejorando el nivel de ventas y captar nuevos clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: CD me músicas variadas, películas,  ropas al por mayor, entre otros, con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida. su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Aracelly is 44 years old and originally from the city of Managua.  She is a widow and has two children, of whom one is still in her care.  She works as a merchant selling general merchandise (clothing, CDs, etc.).  She started her business seven years ago focusing on fashion.  Later she sold fabrics.  Today she has a business selling general merchandise.  Her goal is to continue improving her level of sales and gaining new customers.

She is requesting this loan to purchase CDs of various types of music, movies, and clothing at wholesale, among other items.  She hopes to earn more income and improve her quality of life.  Her plan for the future is to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase CDs of various music types, movies, and clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Serious Women Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makonkorie village 45 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadiatu sells palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), charcoal, etc. and has been doing business for 5 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy palm-oil and charcoal in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and charcoal in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Pedro tem 43 anos de idade, casado  e pai de 07 ( sete)  filhos, todos frequentando o ensino primario e secundario, a sua base de sustento é a pesca, para além da pesca ele  transporta  material de construção para vender.
Ele vai usar o empréstimo para comprar redes  de pesca  para revitalizar a sua actividade de pesca.
Ele sonha comprar mais barcos  para expandir a sua pesca, mas tem como desafio pagar o empréstimo dentro do perίodo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and married. He has seven children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. His means of livelihood is fishing. Aside from fishing, he transports construction supplies for selling.
He'll use the loan to purchase fishnets so he can revitalize his fishing business.
His dream is to buy more boats so he can expand his fishing business. However, he faces the challenge of repaying the loan within the scheduled time frame.

loans.use: to purchase fishnets.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João  tem 59 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 07 (sete) filhos, a sua base de sustento é o negócio. Ele possue um estabelecimento em sua casa onde vende bebidas e diversos produtos alimentares.
 Ele vai usar o empréstimo para comprar cervejas , vinhos e refregerantes para revender.
 Seu  maior sonho é de abrir uma mercearia  porém,  tem o desafio de fazer poupanças de forma a preparar o contentor para a mercearia.
texts.en:
João is 59 years old. He's married and has seven children. His means of livelihood is his business. He runs a store in his house where he sells beverages and various foodstuffs.
He'll use the loan to purchase beer, wine and soft drinks for re-selling.
His biggest dream is to open a grocery store. However, he faces the challenge of saving money so he can set up the grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en:
The large town of Nahualá is located in the state of Sololá in Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Fatima, is located here. Seven enthusiastic women, whose average age is 42, formed the Fatima Trust Bank and live in this community. As is common in many indigenous rural areas in Guatemala, the ladies have been weavers since childhood. They sell their textiles in their own community as well as in surrounding areas. One of the women sells cosmetics and another sells snacks.

Agripina, a married 55-year-old woman, works in textile production, mostly crafting beautiful typical skirts called “cortes.” She delivers to her clients each week and has two full-time employees. At this time, Agripina is requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase a variety of good quality threads and yarn. Since the year-end holidays are quickly approaching, Agripina wants to fill existing orders as well as additional incoming orders.

One of her three children is starting college next year and this is motivating her to work diligently before the year ends so that she can have enough extra funds to help him with educational fees. A common goal among the women in Friendship Bridge Trust Banks is to have enough money so that their children can attend school, an opportunity that many of them missed. Agripina shares, “I could only study for three years, but I will encourage my children to reach college. I will do my best to help them because I know that it is so important. Because of my business and the income it provides, I think this is a real possibility.”

The seven women of the Fatima Trust Bank greatly appreciate the opportunity to receive this new financial capital for their businesses. Empowered with their funds and a little education on subjects like business management, family health and self-esteem, they are poised to realize a better life benefiting themselves, their families, and their community!

loans.use: to buy a variety of threads and yarn.

loans.name: Frank S.

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Frank.  He is married and has five children who are 34, 32, 29, 25 and 21 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him (his nephew).  In 1985, Frank established his patient drugs business. He began his business to enable him to support his children. His business is located at the heart of town and his main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Frank has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy boxes of Paracetamol, packets of blood tonic (pinoplex) and boxes of antibiotics (amoxicillin). He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level. Frank plans to complete the construction of his house, to educate his children and to seek more assistance from ARD. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drugs for patients.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 29 años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación del negocio y una segunda parte para el arreglo del local de su negocio y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable donde acoger a sus clientes, aumentando la demanda e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teodora, 29, lives in La Matanza with her three children. The people of this area earn their living from farming, livestock-rearing and other small businesses.

Teodora operates a business selling beer and a local brew called chicha de jora. She also sells farm animals that she raises in a yard behind her house. She is applying for a 2,000 new soles loan, part of which she will use to buy supplies to make chicha and the rest to open a corner grocery. The investment will allow her to carve out a pleasant space where she can serve her customers and grow her business. The extra income she expects will help to better support her family.

loans.use: to stock her food business and set up a corner grocery.

loans.name: Dante Dan

texts.es:
Dante Dan tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, Dante es un padre emprendedor,que se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia, ocasionalmente trabaja como vigilante en una empresa de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de de 1 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y así seguir brindando este servicio, generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Dante Dan, 24, lives with his wife and two children in the Oyotún district, an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there make a living in commerce, ranching, and agriculture.

Dante offers public transportation service in his own motorcycle taxi taking his customers to the areas near his district.  Dante's an enterprising father who makes the effort to give his family the best.  Occasionally  he works as a guard in an area business.

He has requested a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to perform maintenance on his vehicle so he can continue offering this service and generating additional income for his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo porvenir está formado por 9 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de un clima frió, se encuentra rodeada por montañas las que les regala hermosos paisajes, sus terrenos son fértiles. Su gente es amable y gentil y aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Dolores, se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Nuevo Porvenir desde hace un año, tiempo en el que establecido una relación de mistad con todas las socias y los créditos le han beneficiado para la economía de su hogar.
Doña María Dolores tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están en una escuelita de la localidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
La Señora. María Dolores se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos quienes aún son pequeños, pero para tener sus propios ingresos se dedica a la agricultura, su cosecha la vende y es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría cuyes y cerdos y se dedica a hacer manualidades con cabuya.
 El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de  cerdos y en alimento de animales. Su sueño es de viajar  hacia los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Nuevo Porvenir loan group is made up of nine women who live in the area of Cumbe Parish in Cuenca.  This parish has a cold climate and is surrounded by mountains that grant it beautiful landscapes and fertile land.  The people there are friendly and kind, and they still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is María Dolores, 31, who has been with Nuevo Porvenir for a year.  During this time she has established friendships with all the members and the loans have helped her with the household budget.

María Dolores is the single mother of three children, ages 10, 7, and 3.  Her oldest two children attend school in the town.  María Dolores devotes herself to taking care of her children, who are still young, but she works in agriculture to have her own income.  She sells her harvest and also uses it for family consumption.  She also raises guinea pigs and pigs, and makes crafts out of agave.

With the money from the loan she's going to buy pigs and animal feed.

María Dolores's dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Victor S.

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Victor.  He is married and has five children ages 17, 14, 11, 8 and 6. He has four additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  In 2000, Victor established his provisions business. He began his business just to engage himself in an economy activity. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Victor requires a loan in order to buy a carton of Ovaltine, a carton of sardine and a carton of black mint. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level and hence his profit. In the future, Victor plans to own a house, to educate his children and to expand his shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es: Abel tiene 29 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Teustepe; es soltero y padre de un hijo. Es de oficio agricultor y comerciante, se dedica al cuido de ganado y al cultivo de maíz. Inicio en este negocio hace 16 años sembrando maíz, el cual fue generándole ingresos, y que hoy en día cuenta con sus propias vacas. Su meta próxima es mejorar su potrero para que la vegetación alrededor sea abundante para sus vacas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: maiz al por mayor, abono, fertilizantes entre otros.  Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos. Estima que el crédito le será beneficioso porque le generará buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es ahorrar dinero para construir su casa.
texts.en: Abel is 29 years old. He is a native of the city of Teustepe. He is single and the father of a son. He is a farmer and a businessman. He cares for livestock and grows corn. He began this business 16 years ago, planting corn, which generated income for him, and now he has his own cows. His next goal is to improve his pasture so that the surrounding vegetation will be abundant for his cows. He is applying for the loan to buy bulk corn seed, and fertilizers, among other items, with the goal of increasing his income. He feels that the loan will be beneficial to him because it will generate good earnings for him. His future plan is to save money to construct his house.

loans.use: para comprar: maiz al por mayor, abono, fertilizantes entre otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a toilet and a bathtub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Eni

texts.pt:
A sra Eni  tem  42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de três filhos, dos quais dois vão à escola e um menor. A sua base de sustento é o negócio.
Com o empréstimo  pretende comprar bebidas como Savana, Amarula, Hunters Dry, Windoeck para revender por entregas, ou seja, por encomendas.
A sua esperança é de concluir a sua casa, comprar uma viatura para facilitar no seu deslocamento do dia-a-dia e no transporte de mercadoria.
texts.en:
Emi is ???? years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one of whom is still too young for school. She makes a living from her business.
She will use this loan to buy alcoholic beverages such as Savanna and Hunters Dry ciders, Amarula (a liqueur made from a South African fruit), and Windhoek beer, and resell them and deliver them to customers.
She hopes to finish building her house and buy a vehicle to make transporting her products every day easier.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages such as Savanna and Hunters Dry, Amarula, and Windhoek.

loans.name: Talanesu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Talanesu Group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Field Partner of Kiva to apply for a total loan of 2,300,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adamsay is the featured leader of this group. She is 30 years old and married to a businessman. They have 3 children. Adamsay has been a businesswoman for the past 7 years and sells fried food.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large amount of condiments in order to fry a larger quantity of food for sale.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of condiments in order to fry a larger quantity of food for sale

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De La Alborada Group

texts.es: Dilcia de 46 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte público. Dilcia es socia de la alcancía “LOS EMPRENDEDORES DE LA ALBORADA” grupo conformado por 07 socios todos trabajadores en diferentes areas. Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comidas, empezó este trabajo gracias a una amiga que vio en ella cualidades para el negocio. En la actualidad tiene un puesto en un mercado donde sus clientes acuden diariamente a consumir los alimentos que prepara, con el préstamo solicitado podrá mejorar su negocio y comprar los insumos que necesita. En el futuro le gustaría abrir otra sucursal de su negocio. El grupo agradece por este préstamo a los inversionistas KIVA.  Dilcia aparece en la primera parte de la foto esta de pie con chompa color lila y pantalon negro, en la foto adjunta aparecen 2 socios Anibal y luis.
texts.en: Dilcia, 46, is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a bus driver.  She is a member of the LOS EMPRENDEDORES DE LA ALBORADA community bank.  The group has 7 members who live in various parts of town.  Dilcia operates a food sales business.  A friend encouraged her to start the business because she thought that Dilcia would be well-suited to the work.  Dilcia has a stall in a local market now and her customers meet her there to buy the foods she makes.  She will use this loan to buy the supplies she needs to continue the business.  For the future, she would like to open a second location.  The group is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders have extended to them.  Dilcia is in the first of the two photos.  She is standing on the right in a lilac-colored sweater and black pants.  Members Anibal and Luis are pictured in the second photo.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Manuela Ramos” está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables, dicho grupo pasan a su 7 ciclo.   Marcelina es casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado cerca a su localidad. Marcelina es una mujer empeñosa que con mucho  esfuerzo ha logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  A sus 59 años Marcelina se siente con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de verduras como papas, zapallo, zanahorias, limones y cebollas. El grupo “Manuela Ramos” agradece la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcelina es la tercera del lado izquierdo,  viste chompa a rayas y chaleco rosado.
texts.en: The 6 women of the Manuela Ramos community bank are enterprising and responsible.  This will be the group's 7th round of funding.  Our member, Marcelina, is married and has 5 grown children.  She operates a vegetables sales business in a local market.  Marcelina is a tenacious woman who has worked hard to make a better life for her family and she wants to go on working just as hard, no matter that she's now 59 years old.  She is applying for a loan that she use to stock her business with potatoes, squash, carrots, lemons and onions.  The Manuela Ramos group is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.  In the photo, Marcelina is third from the left in a striped sweater and pink vest.

loans.use: to stock her vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Isata Confort

texts.en:
This is 31 year old Isata. She is married, and has no children. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because of their schooling. In 2007, Isata established her drinks (hard and soft) business. She began her business because she wanted to assist herself in taking care of the home. 
Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Sierra Leonean leone (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks for resale. In the future, Isata plans to extend her business and to open another outlet. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, una bebida preparada a base de maíz, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para arreglar el local donde ofrece su producto y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para acoger sus clientes y una segunda parte para comprar envases e insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora.
texts.en:
Nélida is 34 years old, and lives with her husband in the district of La Matanza, which is located two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  The population of La Matanza works in agriculture, trade and cattle raising.

She works selling chicha de jora, a drink made from corn.  Her business is located in her house.  She is requesting a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to fix the area where she offers her product, which will allow her to have a nicer place to welcome her customers.  The loan will also be used to purchase containers and supplies to make the chicha de jora.

loans.use: purchase supplies and containers to make her products, and repair her business.

loans.name: Las Guerreras De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es: Milagros tiene 33 años es casada y 02 hijos pequeños. Milagros es miembro de la alcancía “LAS GUERRERAS DE VENTANILLA ALTA”  el grupo esta integrado por 07 socios todas trabajadoras en diferentes negocios.
