Milagros empezó el suyo hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y se siente contenta porque su negocio ha prosperado mucho generándole mejores ingresos. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá implementar su negocio adquiriendo ropa para el verano así podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas. Milagros está muy entusiasmada por  recibir este préstamo y a nombre de su grupo quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA que permiten que muchas personas sigan progresando.En la foto es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polera y pantalon color plomo.
texts.en:
Milagros, 33, is married and has two young children.  She's a member of Las Guerreras de Ventanilla Alta Communal Bank, which is made up of seven members who work in different businesses.  Milagros started hers five years ago.  She sells clothing and is happy because her business has prospered, earning more income for her.

With the requested loan she'll be able to set up her business by acquiring summer clothing so she can fill her customers' orders.

Milagros is very excited about receiving this loan.  On behalf of her group she wants to thank the Kiva lenders, who allow a lot of people to keep on moving forward.

In the photo Milagros' the third person from the left; she's wearing a sweatshirt and gray pants.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 39 years old and married to Caroline.  Together they have five children, ages between 16 and 8 years.

He has been in business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 1,200. He has requested the loan to buy more cereals for sale, such as groundnuts, millet, and dry maize
 
The anticipated profits he gets will be used to pay school fees and provide for his family's basic needs. This is his third loan; he repaid the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for sale, like groundnuts, millet, and dry maize.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is 48 years old from Jui, eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 4 children. In 2000, Fatmata established her green vegetable business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a grocery business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari for resale.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto es originario de la ciudad de Granada, de 34 años de edad. Casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace diez años; su madre también era comerciante, desde entonces, le surgió la idea de tener su propia pulpería. Actualmente cuenta con su negocio el cual le ha generado buenas entradas de dinero. Su meta es mantener surtido sus productos y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, jabón, sodas, shampoo entre otros, con el fin de ofertar mercadería variada. Estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá un mejor nivel de ventas y mejores ganancias. Su plan es extender su negocio llegando a una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 34 years old, is a a native of the city of Granada.  He is a married father of two.  He is a businessman and has a small grocery store.  He started this business 10 years ago.  His mother was also a businesswoman and because of that he has the idea to open his own store.  Currently, his business helps him generate a good income.  His goal is to keep his products in stock and keep up with the demand of his customers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, soap, soda and shampoo among other things in order to offer an assortment of products.  He believes that this loan will be very helpful because it will allow him to make a greater amount of sales and greater revenue.  His plan is to expand his business into a bigger, general store.

loans.use: purchase rice, beans, soap, soda, shampoo, etc...

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah lives in Nanyuki area, and she has been practicing farming for more than 10 years. 

She has a tea tree planted in her farm, and right now she seeks a loan to buy a sharp cutter and a water tank. 

She is a full-time farmer.  The major challenges that she faces in her business include weather and transportation costs. She is happy that Milango is there to lend to her for business.

loans.use: to buy a sharp cutter and a water tank.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Because Muna is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Muna was born in 1972. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa, with her husband and seven children.  Her husband has been selling shisha flavors for four years. (Shisha is tobacco smoked in waterpipes.)  His business is their only source of income. 

Her husband is planning to open his own shisha store in the future. Now she is planning to help her husband in expanding his project by buying a larger quantity of shisha flavors in addition to adding coal and shisha to his business to raise their profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy coal and "shisha" flavors for her husband's business

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Tem 50 anos de idade, esta a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, vive maritalmente num lar em que são duas esposas do mesmo marido, é professora em exercício ha mais de 20 anos, tem 3 filhos todos maiores de idade 2 dois quais já independentes e apenas 1 ainda na sua responsabilidade, para alem de trabalhar tem um estabelecimento comercial onde faz negocio em sua casa.
Com o crédito  , são por enquanto, 3 quartos e todos já com inquilinos.
O seu maior sonho é ampliar mais a construção de casas para aluguer e desenvolver um pouco mais o seu negócio.
Diz não ter grandes desafios, os poucos que tem conseguem geri-los
texts.en:
Laura is 50 years old and this is her second loan. She lives with her partner in a home where she is one of two wives to the same husband, she has been a teacher for more than 20 years and has 3 children of age - 2 who are already independent and only 1 who is still her responsibility. As well as her job she also has a commercial establishment in her home from which she runs her business.

With this loan she plans to buy cement and pay for the electricity at the houses she has built for rent - currently 3 rooms all with tenants.

Her biggest dream is to expand her construction of houses for rent and develop her business a little more.
She says she doesn't have big challenges and the few she does have, she is able to manage.

loans.use: buy cement and pay for the electricity at the houses she has built for rent

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Filadelfia Group

texts.es: El grupo “Filadelfia” está conformado por 08 socias entusiastas y trabajadoras. Margot de 48 años es casada con 03 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 03  de ellos. Hace más de 17 años que cuenta con una imprenta, la cual realiza almanaques, recordatorios,  afiches y calendarios.  Se siente feliz pues dicho negocio le permite seguir colaborando con los gastos del hogar. Su último  crédito lo destinará  para la compra de papel, siliconas, tintas y almanaques  ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. El grupo “Filadelfia” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada, pues hace posible su progreso. Margot  se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo lleva una cartera color negro  y viste blusa floreada.
texts.en:
The "Filadelfia" group is comprised of 8 enthusiastic and hardworking women.

Margot is 48 years old and married with 3 children who she currently supports.  For the past 17 years, she has had a printing press which she uses to make almanacs, keepsakes, posters and calendars.  She is very happy because this business allows her to continue to afford her household expenses.  

She will use this loan to purchase paper, silicones, ink and almanacs because she has orders to fulfill.  

The "Filadelfia" group is very grateful for the help that the Kiva Lenders have provided because they make their progress possible. 

In the picture, Margot is seated.  She is the first one on the left and has a black purse and is wearing a floral print blouse.

loans.use: purchase paper, silicones, ink and almanacs.

loans.name: Guiliana Aracely

texts.es:
Guiliana Aracely tiene 29 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi trasladando a sus clientes a las comunidades aledañas a su distrito, también realiza movilidad escolar, son una familia unida su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas.

Guiliana ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera poder seguir brindando el servicio.
texts.en:
Guiliana Aracely, 29, lives with her husband and children in Cayaltí, a rural area about two hours from the city of Chiclayo in north-coastal Peru.

Guiliana operates a moto-taxi business. Her customers are local people and she carries them to and from the nearby towns. She also carries students to and from school. Her husband does farm work and their combined income is enough to support their family.

Guiliana is applying for a 1,000 new soles loan that she will use to pay for maintenance for her moto-taxi. The investment will allow her to provide her customers with a better service.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for her moto-taxi.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, maíz , arroz, comercio y ganadería a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados papitas, cebiche y gaseosas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios para servir alimentos y así tener mayor comodidad para atender al público, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, 50, lives in Cayalti with her husband and children. Cayalti is a rural district about forty-five minutes from Chiclayo, a city in north-coastal Peru. Local people depend on farming--sugar cane, maize, rice--animal-rearing and other small businesses.

Juana operates a business making and selling papitas, ceviche and soft drinks. She is applying for a 500 new soles loan that she will use to buy kitchen utensils for her business. The investment will allow her to better serve her customers and, in turn, increase the income she can make to support her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for her foods business.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Niepos, ubicado en la Provincia de San Miguel, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al tejido en hilo confecciona chompas, chales, polos es conocida en la zona por la experiencia en el negocio, también dicta clases a niños en el PRONOEI de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales lana y una maquina de tejer y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Domitila is 42 years old. She lives in the district of Niepos, located in San Miguel Province in Peru's northern mountain range, two hours from the city of Cajamarca. The population there works in agriculture and livestock.

Domitila earns her living knitting sweaters, shawls, and tops. She is known in her area for her business experience, and she also teaches classes to children in the community-based pre-school in her area.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to purchase wool materials and a knitting machine so that she can increase her business and generate a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wool for knitting and a knitting machine

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
This is Lewelyn. She previously obtained a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lewelyn dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer who mainly deals in coffee growing. He does local coffee brewing as an additional source of income. He picks around 900 kilograms of coffee in a season. With income from coffee, he has managed to construct a house for his family and also provide them with the basic needs of life. 

Emmanuel is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy more coffee so as to increase income in addition to his coffee farming. His major challenge is inadequate land to extend his coffee plantation.  Income from more coffee will help him buy enough land for his project. His dream is to own a coffee processing plant in his region. He is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy coffe to trade

loans.name: Josefina

texts.pt:
Tem 28 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos todos menores de idade, 2 com idade escolar e que tem acesso a escola, vive maritalmente a base de negocio e conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador do Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique.
Com o credito pretende comprar: bacias plásticas, baldes plásticos, milho, roupa usada, etc, para reforçar o seu negocio que faz como ambulante dentro fora da  vila de Moamba. 
A sua maior esperança é desenvolver mais o seu negocio e construir uma residência condigna para sua família, actualmente esta numa de material local.
O seu maior desafio é o facto de ter muitos filhos e mesmo com ajuda do esposo não tem sido fácil criar este e construir.
texts.en:
Josefina is 28 years old and the mother of 4 children who are all underage, 2 who are of school age and attend. She lives with her partner and lives off her business as well as counting on the support of her partner who works for the Mozambican Railway company.

With this loan she plans to buy: plastic basins, plastic buckets, used clothes, etc. to reinforce her traveling business in and around the village of Moamba.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business and build a decent home for her family as they are currently living in one made out of local materials.
Her biggest challenge is the fact that she has so many children as even with her husband's help it hasn't been easy to raise them and build a house.

loans.use: used clothes and other domestic utensils for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
Solteira de 38 anos de idade, sem filhos, já teve 1 e perdeu, vive sozinha na casa própria, tem seus pais como seus dependentes mas que não vivem junto, tem nível médio técnico e trabalha como locutora no instituto de comunicação social.
Com o empréstimo pretende pagar 2 contratos de agua para si e para seus pais.
Ela tem o sonho de poder continuar com os estudos de maneira a melhorar a sua carreira profissional, terminar a construção de sua casa e mobilar.
Seu maior desafio é a falta de fundos, seu salário é muito baixo para tantos sonhos.
texts.en:
Laurinda is single, 38 years old and has no children - she had one but she lost him. She lives in her own house, her parents are dependent on her but live in another home, she has reached a medium technician level and works as an announcer at the Institute of Social Communication.

With this loan she plans to pay for 2 water contracts - one for her and one for her parents.

She dreams of being able to continue her studies so as to improve her career, of completing the construction of her home and of furnishing it.
Her biggest challenge is her lack of funds as her salary is very small for so many dreams.

loans.use: pay for 2 water contracts - one for her and one for her parents.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hija en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, y frutales, comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio ubicado en su domicilio de crianza y venta de patos, cuyes y otras aves de corral, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados a si tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Melchora is 50 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Cayalti district.  Here the people make a living growing sugar cane, rice, and fruits.  Two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast, everybody here works in business and in farming.

Melchora has a small business which she runs out of her home.  She raises and sells ducks, guinea pigs, and poultry.  Melchora is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy animal feed.  This will give her better production to offer to her customers.  In turn Melchora will have a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for young animals.

loans.name: Elmer Fernando

texts.es:
Elmer Fernando tiene 41años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería siendo la principal actividad siendo muy rentable en la zona, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 6 meses en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer Fernando is 41 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires district.  This area's population works in agriculture and in raising livestock.  It is located two hours from the city of Piura, a coastal town in the north of Peru.

For the past 6 months he has been selling fruits and vegetables from his home.  He is seeking a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to stock his business with groceries and other staples so that he can make a higher income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock his business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería siendo su principal actividad d económica, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de abarrotes arroz, menestras, leche, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole al mismo tiempo mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 35 years old and lives with her husband in the region of Buenos Aires.  Most people in the area work in agriculture, commerce, and in raising livestock.  It is located two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

Along with her husband, she sells groceries, rice, beans, milk, and other things like this. Her business is located in her home.  She is seeking a loan of 1000 nuevos soles so that she can buy supplies to stock her business.  By doing this, she will be able to offer her customers a better variety of products which will increase her income and help her support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her business.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Niepos, ubicado en San Miguel, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad e Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas res y cerdo, en el interior del mercado del distrito, es conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado y poder invertir en su negocio, generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Moises, 56, lives with his spouse and children in the district of Niepos, located in San Miguel, two hours away from the city of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain chain of Peru. The population in Niepos works in farming and commerce. 
Moises sells red meat and pork inside the district market and he is well known in the area for the work he does. He is asking for a 2,000 PEN loan to purchase cattle to invest in his business. This will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle

loans.name: Sara Lisenia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Sara, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 14, 11, 6 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela y jardín de infantes. El marido es ganadero. 
Doña Sara es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido con los muchos gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella tiene a cargos el bar de un jardín de infantes de la localidad, lugar donde vende solo alimentos naturales y nutritivos a la vez, ella mismo prepara los bocaditos y jugaos naturales que vende en su local, lleva 5 meses con este negocio el cual lo comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar frutas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque le ayudaron a empezar con su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Santa Lucía de Quiroga communal bank meets in the Quiroga section of the city of Calceta, a place where most people earn their livings in farming and livestock production and the sale their products.

Sara lives in this area. She is 37 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children, ages 14, 11, 6, and 4. The two older children are in secondary school, and the younger ones are in primary school and preschool. Her husband raises livestock.

Sara is a woman who likes to work; with her efforts, she helps her husband with many of the household and educational expenses. She runs the snack-bar of a preschool in her area, where she only sells foods that are both natural and nutritious. She herself prepares the snacks and natural juices that she sells there. She has had this business for five months; she started it with one of the loans that she received from the group.

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and ingredients to prepare the foods. She has been in this communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because they helped her to start her business. Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy fruit and ingredients.

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
This is Jessamin. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and with their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jessamin dreams that his business will be more successful and hopes that his family will always be in good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with three children who attend school.  She lives at her own house that has no piped water nor electricity.  She cites school fees as her high cost of monthly expense.

Mesalimu has operated a beauty salon business for the past ten years.  Her customers are women, and she cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with one child who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has operated a business selling food stuff like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of transportation as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años de edad, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres le pudieron dar para que estudiara hasta una primaria; luego dejo de estudiar para dedicarse a ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y ayudar a su padre en la agricultura,  4 de su 5  hijos  ya están fuera del hogar, con su propia familia y solo vive una hija la de menor edad.

Ella  se a dedicado a trabajar toda su vida en la agricultura, desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su padre y madre en el trabajo del hogar y en campo. Actualmente, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, se encarga pagar empleados. De esta manera trabaja, también se dedica al cuido de animales de granja pollos y cerdos. Los que le apoyan en la agricultura es su hijo, ya que hace varios años la abandono su compañero de vida y tubo que hacerle frente ella sola para cuidar a sus hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar animales de granja como: cerdos y para la compra de concentrados para el mantenimiento de los mismos.

Su deseo, es  sacar adelante a su ultima hija para que termine los estudios hasta la universidad y con el préstamo comprara mas animales de granja, para tener mejores ingresos  para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and thanks to her parents' efforts, she was able to attend primary school.  After primary school, she left education in order to help with the household chores and to support her parents with their farming work.  Four of Rosa's five children have now left home and have their own families; the only child still at home is Rosa's youngest daughter.

All her life Rosa has made a living in farming.  As a young girl she helped her mother and father with the chores at home and with the work in the field.  Rosa still makes a living in farming and now has paid employees.  With this help, she is also able to work looking after farm animals, such as chickens and pigs.  Rosa's son helps with the farming work. Some years ago Rosa's husband left her and she had to cope on her own as she looked after the children.

Rosa is applying for this loan in order to buy farm animals, such as pigs, and to buy feed for these animals.

Rosa's wish is to get ahead with her youngest daughter so that she can go to and finish university.  Rosa will use this loan to buy animals, so that she has a higher income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm animals, such as pigs, and to buy feed for these animals.

loans.name: Misael De Jesús

texts.es:
Misael es un joven de 27 años de edad, que gracias al esfuerzo su madre logro darle el estudio hasta un primer año de bachillerato; luego por las condiciones económicas ya no pudo estudiar y se dedico a trabajar. Su compañera de vida se dedica al trabajo domestico y vive con su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad.

Él  se dedica a trabajar en un agroservicio, un amigo que es de la misma zona donde él vive, le menciono de este trabajo hace 3 años y lo emplearon y empezó a trabajar como vendedor, trabaja de lunes a sábado, tiene que madrugar tiene que; ya que esta a 35  kilómetros de sus casa y regresa por las noches, esta rutina la hace todos los días, los fines de semana o días de descanso y en las épocas de invierno trabaja la agricultura, en ocasiones tiene que pagar mano de obra, para el cultivo y su compañera se encarga cuando él no esta, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino


el préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera. Su deseo es,  seguir trabajando y comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda y adquirir otra vaca.
texts.en:
Misael is 27 years old and thanks to the support of his mother, she was able to provide him with an education through the first year of his baccalaureate. Then, due to economic conditions, he was unable to continue his studies and he decided to work.  His wife works in the home.  He lives with his wife and their 2-year-old son.

He works in agricultural services.  His friend was doing this type of work in the region in which he lives and introduced him to the business.  Misael says that after 3 years working for his employer, he eventually got work as a salesman.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  He gets up early in the mornings because he works 35 kilometers (21 miles) from home and he returns each night.  He does this routine every day.  On weekends or on his days off in the winter, he works in agriculture.  Sometimes he needs to pay for workers to help him harvest the crops.  Additionally, he raises cattle.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a dairy cow.  His dream is to continue working and to buy land on which to build a home.  He also dreams to buy another cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nkondo Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother who lost her husband in 2002. She has four children whom she takes care of in addition to some of her brother’s sons who stay her with because they need a location nearby their school.
She operates a business selling second hand clothes and earns capital of 500,000 which she uses to look after the family.  As part of the Nkondo Tukwatanise Group's total loan, Annet applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to add more stock of second hand clothes to her inventory which she plans to sell during the festive season. She is confident she will make big sales since the clients will be buying many Christmas clothes. Her customers are people surrounding Rubindi and other neighboring towns and villages.
She is a very hardworking lady but faces challenges including insufficient capital to expand her business.  In addition, it is a challenge when her children fall sick and she cannot work, which affects her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell second hand.

loans.name: Arunee

texts.en:
Arunee grew up in a Hmong village in Chiang Rai, but moved to the Huay Hom village when she married. Her husband’s family had once lived in the village where she grew up, but had migrated south in search of new opportunities when the land became too crowded.

Arunee is trying to make a new home in Huay Hom. Life for new couples is often hard, especially because land is precious and a home and fields can be difficult to obtain. Most families in Huay Hom work in subsistence farming and use dangerous pesticides to try to eke out crops on their small plots of land. 

When Arunee came to Huay Hom, she was curious about the hammocks she saw other women weaving.  She naturally jumped in and sought training as a weaver -- especially because hammock weaving is far better compensated, safer, and more flexible than field labor. 

No longer newlyweds, she and her husband are eager to build their own home and establish their own family security. With this loan, they will be able to move closer to their dreams as they work, plan and save.

loans.use: to get her own hammock production going and become an independent producer.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
Bai was born in Laos and immigrated to Thailand many years ago. She grew up in a small Hmong village on the border, but land was scarce and the population was becoming crowded. When she married, she moved with her husband to a new settlement further south, called Huay Hom village. Here, there was enough land for the Hmong to build a life and scrape by, although the lack of tourism or economic opportunity meant most families worked in toxic slash and burn agriculture and were trapped in a cycle of subsistence farming.

Bai grew up without an opportunity to earn an education, so her prospects were very limited. She speaks barely any Thai, so it is difficult for her to navigate transactions outside her community. When the opportunity to weave hammocks arose, Bai was very excited. She is able to work from home, make her own schedule and earn a far larger income doing work she enjoys. Bai is a skilled weaver and now that she knows that hammock weaving is a long-term opportunity, she is ready to stake her future on her abilities. This loan will help her family break the cycle of poverty and have a secure future, especially because her participation in Kiva comes in conjunction with financial training!

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Pisit

texts.en:
Pisit is one of the few men who have learned the art of hammock weaving as a part of the Yellow Leaf Hammocks initiative in rural Phrae, Thailand. 

Pisit was born in Huay Hom village in the Mae Lai Valley area of Thailand. He is a part of the first generation to grow up in this village, which was founded by his parents’ generation. The village founders had been driven out of their former home because there was not enough land to support a growing population. Life in Huay Hom village is hard- without the economic activity brought by tourism, almost everyone is forced to work in toxic slash and burn agriculture and subsistence farming. Although Pisit attended a public Thai boarding school and achieved a 9th grade level of education, he was also working in the fields. 

Hammock weaving was first a path that Pisit’s wife followed. A weaver can earn more than 6 times what a family of farmers can earn! Pisit often found himself helping his wife with her weaving and took it upon himself to attend training and become a skilled weaver. His education finally came in handy as he learned to weave- he is able to read hammock design instructions and give guidance to older weavers. His dream is to become an independent hammock producer and manage several weavers on his team! This loan is a first step toward true financial independence for his family- he will also be receiving financial education as part of his Kiva participation.

loans.use: to get his hammock business off the ground.

loans.name: Nooch

texts.en:
Nooch was born in Chiang Rai in northern Thailand and moved south to Huay Om Village when she married. She was able to earn an elementary education in her childhood, but was not able to pursue her education further. Throughout most of her life, she has worked in field labor. From childhood, she has not seen any opportunities to improve her situation beyond a lifetime of toiling in toxic slash and burn agriculture. 

Nooch was intrigued by the idea of weaving hammocks when she first heard about it. Although most weavers in her village are older women who can’t comfortably work in the fields, Nooch realized that her ability to read could be a big asset for the weaving team in Huay Oy. She is able to help others read their design sheets in addition to becoming a skilled weaver herself. 

Nooch is excited about the prospect of becoming one of the youngest weavers to run her own business and is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan that will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to get her own hammock production going and become an independent producer.

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Pang grew up as part of the first generation in the Huay Om settlement in the uplands of Phrae Province.  Life in the settlement was tough- the whole family worked in difficult field labor together for many years. She married a man from Chiang Rai (about 5 hours away) and she and her husband have traveled back and forth between the two families to help with farming. 

Their future still feels unsettled to Pang, but she is excited about the opportunity to take control of her own opportunities through hammock weaving. Her mother is also a weaver, so they are excited about working together as a team to build a better future for their family. 

Pang is overjoyed to become a borrower, both because she is excited to build a strong foundation for her young family and because she feels empowered by the financial training she is going through.

loans.use: to invest in her hammock weaving and contribute to her family’s income.

loans.name: Yua

texts.en:
Yua grew up in a transitional time- although she was born in northern Thailand, her family was part of the first generation to travel south and build a new settlement in the uplands of Phrae Province, called Huay Om Village. The unsettled nature of her childhood left her without an education.

Traditionally, women like Yua would leave their family to move to their husband’s village when they married. In Yua’s case, her husband left the north to move to Huay Om near her family. The unusual couple hoped for better prospects near Huay Om and settled into corn farming. The life of a farmer in the uplands is difficult- when Yua learned from her daughters and daughter-in-law about the chance to weave hammocks, she was excited by the opportunity to earn more money and escape the field labor. 

With no education she has to rely on her daughters to help read the design patterns, but through her skill she was able to secure herself a place among the core weavers.  After her daughter and daughter-in-laws mastered hammock weaving they were able to work as a team! Through this loan, Yua is hoping to gain independence and secure her family’s long-term income to ensure she does not have to return to the fields as she gets older.

loans.use: to invest in her hammock weaving and contribute to her family’s income.

loans.name: Shong

texts.en:
Shong has lived a long and difficult life. Born near the border in northern Thailand, she was one of the elders of a group that voyaged south to form a new settlement in the hills of Phrae Province. Although the new Huay Oy village offered new opportunities, life there was still hard. Shong and several generations of her family worked side-by-side in back-breaking field labor for many years.

Traditionally, older women would leave the fields to work in the home, making meals and clothing. With the advent of prepared foods and store-bought clothing, grandmothers feel the need to make themselves useful and end up continuing to work in the fields.

At the remarkable age of 74, Shong learned to weave hammocks and has felt a renewed energy and excitement! She is overjoyed to find a new financial opportunity after worrying about her family contributions. She says that this loan will help her achieve financial stability in her old age, and more importantly help her save for a head start for her grandkids.

loans.use: to get her hammock business off the ground.

loans.name: Judith Marisol

texts.es:
Judith Marisol tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica al cultivo de café, caña, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicios de costura, su taller está ubicado en su domicilio, donde también ofrece a la venta marcianos y helados que ella misma prepara, es conocida en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una máquina de coser y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Judith Marisol is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the Pomahuaca district, two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru. The population there works in the cultivation of coffee and cane and the sale of livestock.

She provides sewing services. Her workshop is located in her residence, where she also sells frozen fruit pops and ice cream that she makes herself. She is well known in her area. 

Judith Marisol has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] for the purchase of a sewing machine so that she can continue providing her services, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Santa Noris

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  14 y 7 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es operador de una gabarra.
Doña Santa con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudara con los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la cría de chanchos, tiene un corral donde alimenta sus animalitos hasta que los pueda vender ya sea a comerciantes o también de vez en cuando los faena y vende la carne a vecinos y familiares de la zona, para ella esta es una forma de ganar sus propios recursos sin salir de casa.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area of Quiroga in the city of Calceta, the people work mostly in agriculture.  They grow animals and sell their products.  Every 15 days the group called El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga gets together.

This is the region in which Santa lives.  She is 34 years old, she is married, and she has two children that are 14 and 17 years old.  They both study - one in college and the other in school.  Her husband operates a barge.

Santa needed to earn money to be able to help with the household expenses, which include the cost of education for her children, and so she began raising pigs. She has a corral where she feeds them until she can sell them to merchants or sometimes she sells them to her neighbors and families in the region.  For her, this is a way to earn her own money without leaving home.

This loan is to buy food and medicine for the pigs. She has been part of the group since it began and she likes the group because the loans always go to helping people get by. She dreams to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Yrma Dolores

texts.es:
Yrma Dolores tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Mocupe Lagunas, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio y ganadería a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican al pilado de arroz, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, donde también se dedican a la crianza y venta de aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 600 para la compra de un equipo de zaranda para pilado de arroz y a si incrementar su servicio, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yrma Dolores is 62 years old and lives with her husband in the region of Mocupe Lagunas. The people in this area work in agriculture.  They grow sugar cane, rice, and also raise livestock.  It is located one hour and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works with her husband and they sell milled rice. He store is located in her home where she also raises and sells poultry.

She is seeking a loan of 3600 nuevos soles so that she can buy equipment to mill the rice. By doing this, she will increase her production and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for milling rice.

loans.name: Jojit

texts.en:
Jojit is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used her previous loan to buy merchandise products for her direct selling business and it also helped in the education of her child. The income from her business is supporting their everyday expenses at home. Aside from her direct selling business, she also has a piggery business which she is more focused on. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy feed and additional hogs for her business. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jojit dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and purchase additional hogs for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma hopes to grow her business and have other sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children, both of who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, Caroline wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans and to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chalotte

texts.en: Chalotte is 22 years old and lives in the community surrounding Airport of Margibi County, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancee have four children, who are in school and between one to nine years old. Her fiancee works as a driver. She completed the 8th grade before starting her business eight years ago. She describes herself as a hard working woman. She received a little money from her mother to establish her business, which she enjoys because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sells for ten hours, six days per week. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter-ball, etc. for her business. She plans to increase her business even more and would like to say thanks for the support from BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter-ball, etc for her business,

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba county, which is rich in natural resources.  The living conditions in Sanniquellie are much better than the capital city (Monrovia), and is the second largest populate county in Liberia.  

Yei did not attend school before establishing her business, and she has lived her entire life in a rural area.  Yei is married, her husband is a farmer, and they have 4 children together between the ages of 22 and 25.  Only two of her children are in school and they all live at home.  

For seven years now she has been running a table where she sells palm oil, Vita (a Coca Cola product), pepper, and salt in the local market.  She spends 9 hours each day running her business.  Problems she faces include a small income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, Vita, pepper, and salt for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, Vita (a Coca Cola product), pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en: Marthaline lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions in Nimba are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populous county in Liberia. She is 33 years old. She stopped her education in the 5th grade, and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 13. She started this business with a little money from her fiancée. She sells rice and soup from a cook shop and spends 8 hours each day at her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is having a small amount of goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, cassava, meat, fish, and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cassava, meat, fish, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: 31-year-old Theresa lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and Nimba is the second most populous county in Liberia. She attended school and stopped in 10th grade. She is good at managing her business since it is her major source of income. She is single and has a two-year-old kid living at home. She managed to establish her business with a little money from her mother. For four years now, she has been running this table business where she sells rice and oil in the local market. She spends nine hours on her business. A problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her child out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Dorathy

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Dorathy from Liberia. She lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions here are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Dorathy grew up in the rural areas of Sanniquelle where she did not have the opportunity to attend school. Traditionally she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They both have four children whose ages are not mentioned but who live in the same house with their parents. Over the past six years she has been selling rice and soup at a local restaurant in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending nine hours at her business. She is going to buy more rice, meat, fish, pepper, oil, rice, salt etc for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, meat, fish, pepper, oil, rice, salt etc for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort grew up in the rural environs of Sanniquellie where she did not have the opportunity to attend school. She is single and has a two year old child. With sales from her boyfriend's farm produce, she managed to establish her business. Over the past 3 years she has been selling slippers.  She spends 8 hours each day at her business from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is low income. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 33 years old and lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources, has much better living conditions than the capital city, and is the second most populace county in Liberia. She did not attend school, and she has lived all of her life in a rural area. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They both have five children. Her children are between 12 to 16 years old. With a little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business. For twelve years, she has been running a cook shop (local restaurant), where she sells rice and soup. She spends 9 hours on her business, and faces no other problems except for a shortage of goods in stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, meat, fish, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day move from a cook shop business to a modern restaurant business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, meat, fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Baby-Girl

texts.en:
Baby-girl is 25 years old and lives in Kakata town.  She and her boyfriend have two children, ages 4 and 8; both are in school and live at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling dry fish in the local market.  One of her main problems is the price of fish is too high.  

Babygirl is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business.  She plans to build her house and educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Klimeta

texts.en:
Klimeta is married and has two children, an 18-year-old and a 9-year-old. She has been in the livestock industry for nearly ten years. The sales of raw milk have given her a steady income throughout the past years.

“Sometimes more and sometimes less, however, there was always an income. Now, I want to increase the income, and I want to add more to the herd,” says Klimeta. She and her family live in a village where there is not a large enough field for planting so they could plant and sell fresh produce; yet, there is enough area for grazing the animals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chue

texts.en:
Chue has lived through upheaval, destruction and marginalization. In her early life, she was moved to a “resettled” Hmong village near the main city in Nan Province. The village she had lived in before was located in an area disrupted battles over the communist insurgency. As a member of the Hmong hill tribe, she did not have the same freedoms or opportunities of a Thai citizen and was unable to attend school.

Eventually Chue and her husband made a life for themselves in Huay Om. For nearly two decades, they have scraped by laboring in the fields with their family. Now Chue is hoping to move into a less physically-demanding role as a hammock weaver. She is excited about the chance to earn far more than she could through farming and work with a more flexible schedule. 

To Chue, this loan represents the only chance she has to build a “retirement fund” as an independent hammock weaver and to live comfortably into her old age.

loans.use: to get her own hammock production going and become an independent producer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Tem 55 anos de idade, pai de 7 filhos dos quais 6 maiores de idade e apenas 1 ainda na sua responsabilidade, é antigo combatente, vive na casa própria, maritalmente e a base de negocio e machamba de regadio.
Com o credito pretende comprar:  açúcar, amendoim, óleo, farinha, massas, fósforo, velas, rebuçados, arroz, feijão, bebidas, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que faz numa pequeno estabelecimento comercial que acabou de construir em sua casa.
O seu maior sonho, é melhorar o seu negocio e crescer para loja e poder começar a construção de sua casa pois, já tem uma parte do material acumulado.
A sua maior dificuldade é o fraco negocio, dado que na zona onde vive maior parte da população vive de machamba  o que faz com que os seus produtos demorem a ser comprados.
texts.en:
Pedro is 55 years old. He has seven children, six of whom are adults and only one is still under his responsibility. He's a former soldier and lives in a house that he owns. He's married and his means of livelihood is a plot of irrigated land.
With the loan he intends to purchase sugar, peanuts, cooking oil, flour, noodles, matches, candles, candy, rice, beans, beverages, etc., so that he can expand his business. He runs a small store that he recently built in his house.
His biggest dream is to improve his business and enlarge his store. He also dreams of being able to start building his house, since he already has part of the supplies piled up.
His biggest difficulty is the slow business, because in the area where he lives most of the people are farmers and as a result, it takes longer for his merchandise to be bought.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, peanuts, cooking oil, flour, noodles, matches, candles, candy, rice, beans, beverages, etc., so that he can expand his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
Meet Lamrana. She is 45 years old from Masuba Makeni in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years. For the past 13 years, Lamrana established her retail and wholesale trading business. She began her business because she thought being a housewife was boring so she wanted to contribute in the home. Lamrana works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are storage facilities and high cost of transportation.

Lamrana requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, gari, and bags of groundnuts for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Lamrana plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, gari, and bags of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila is a widowed mother of eleven kids and she lives in the northern part of the country.  Kindly note that individuals with such a marital status in her region are not supposed to show their face in photographs and also keep their head covered with a scarf and dress in black color.  That is the reason that she isn’t very visible in the photo. 
For the past ten years, she has been selling the raw milk of her cows to a neighboring dairy farm.  She reports that this has been her only source of income. Now Dila wants to add another milk cow to the herd and she is asking for your help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eat

texts.en:
Eat is 54 years old, and she is residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambong province. She is blessed with seven children. Nowadays, she needs to support only two children; one is in school and the other is helping the family’s business. 

To deal with her family hardship, she grows rice as the main source of income and also does corn trading, buying and reselling for profit. She has been  involved in this business for 10 years. 

This is the second microloan for Eat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to improve her living conditions better than before. 

For this cycle, she has decided to request an education loan to cover the school fee for son, who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree majoring in law. She hopes that her son can get a decent job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover school fees for her son

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny is a villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 49 years old, and she is a mother of four children. The main sources of her family income are from her husband's occupation as a motor-taxi driver and her pig-raising business. Nowadays, she can save about US$4 per day after the necessary expenses in her household. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Ny is a fourth time borrower (including this new loan). The past loan, which she has paid back, has enabled her to stabilize her business and to improve her living in good pace. Now, she wants to focus on her daughter’s education instead. Hence, she will use this entire loan portion to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter graduates with her bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kuthy

texts.en:
Kuthy is the 47-year-old mother of three children.  She is a villager from the Kien Svay district in Kandal province.  She strives for a living via rice farming as the primary source of income. 

Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four cycles, she feels confident that she can improve her living condition better than before. Now, she is seeking an education loan to cover the school fee for her daughter, who is studying at a local university specializing in law. 

She hopes that this financial support will help her daughter in time so as her daughter can pay more attention to her studies.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her daughter at a local university

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of south Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, two of which are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells posho, beans, rice, and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy stock like sugar, beans, and rice, and will help Betty to generate greater profits which will be used to pay school fees. Betty hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy stock like sugar, beans, and rice to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Katerere Abamwe Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 32-year-old single mother with one child.  She is a resident of Butagatsi, western Division – Rukungiri District. She dropped out of school because she could not pay her school fees.  After some time, she got married but later separated from her husband when she was six months pregnant. She then started a small retail shop in order to look after herself and her child.  She has now grown her business to a capital of over 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in a group called Katerere Abamwe to get a loan to add in her business. She secured a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to add to her business and the total loan for the whole group is 3,300,000 Ugandan shillings.  They are scheduled to pay it back in under nine months.
Emily's dream is to grow her business into a wholesale shop, pay school fees for her son and be able to provide all of the basic needs for her family.  She is grateful to UGAFODE for the assistance rendered to her.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a  mother and has children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.
She has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kulah

texts.en: Kulah is 25 years old and lives in Gardnerville, Liberia, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married with two children aged five and eight, who are in school and live at home. For three years now she has been selling cassava in the community market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old and married with two children. Robert is a farmer who majorly deals in cattle fattening and milking. He owns over 30 cows for fattening and 10 for milk. He has managed to provide for his family through income from cattle sales and from milk.

Robert is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings for buying more cows for fattening, and drugs for his animals. 

His major challenge is the seasonal changes, most especially the dry season, which dries up the grass for his cows and leads to the death of his cows. His dream is to be the largest supplier of milk in his region. He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows for fattening

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Mãe de 3 filhos todos com idade escolar e com acesso a escola, tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente na casa própria á base de negocio e conta com ajuda do seu esposo também negociante e que trabalha por conta própria.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: fardos de roupa usada, capulanas, etc para ampliar o seu negocio que faz como ambulante dentro e fora da vila de Moamba.
Ela tem a esperança de poder continuar bem com os créditos da Hluvuku, e com os próximos créditos iniciar a construção de sua casa, actualmente vive numa de material local. 
Ela diz não ter grandes dificuldades, apesar de ainda não ter condições de construir pelo facto do nível de seu negocio ser baixo.
texts.en:
Rosa has three school-age children who attend school. She's 42 years old and married. She lives in a house that she owns. Her means of livelihood is her business. She gets help from her husban who's also a trader and self-employed.
With the loan she intends to purchase bundles of used clothing, traditional skirts, etc., so that she can expand her business. She does business as a street vendor both within and outside Moamba. 
Her hope is to continue doing well with loans from Huluvuku and to use the next loans to start building her house. She currently lives in a house made of local materials.
She states that she doesn't face major hardships, although she can't afford to do construction work yet due to the fact that her turnover is low.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing, traditional skirts, etc., so that she can expand her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sofía Esperanza tiene 55 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, patos, cuyes y gallinas, Sofía nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares son una familia unida que se esfuerza en s labor, El se dedica al cultivo de yucas, maíz, frejol y los ofrece en el mercado de la zona.

Doña Shofi como la conocen ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofía Esperanza is 55 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Cayaltí district. Her town, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru, relies on the cultivation of cane and rice, business and ranching for a living.

Sofía raises and sells small animals: turkeys, ducks, chickens and guinea pigs. She explains that she does this work to help her husband with household expenses. He works growing yuca, corn and beans and sells them at the local market. They are a united family that works hard.

"Shofi", as she is known, has requested a loan of 1,500 New Soles to purchase animal feed and in this way have a better product to offer her clients.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Lucrecia Bercelia

texts.es:
Lucrecia Bercelia tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, cacao, café, frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pan en el mercado de abastos del distrito, hace tres meses también se dedica a la venta de adoquines, yogurt, galletas, cereales en las afueras de los colegios de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de golosinas y así tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Bercelia is 28 years old. She lives with her daughter in the district of Pucará, where the people grow rice, cacao, coffee, and fruits and commercialize them, and also work in raising livestock. It is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells bread at the supply market in the district. For three months she has also been selling hard candies, yogurt, crackers, and cereals outside the schools in the area. She has applied for a loan of 800 PEN to stock her business by buying candies and thus to have better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy candies to stock her business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
This is Mary Joy, 34, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Dandy, a worker abroad and is mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Mary Joy maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php40, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed for her business.
Mary Joy dreams to become rich and hopes to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics which are needed for her business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with seven children, two of which are in school the rest of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo operates a food-making business making beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. She prepares her food from a cafe.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase food items including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize flour and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize, flour and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mary from Liberia; precisely, she lives in Gardnerville of Liberia, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, along with her husband and five children between the ages of 18 and 33. Only two children are in school, and they all live in the same house of their parents. 

Over the past 10 years, she has been selling fufu (starch made out of cassava) and soup in the community market. She started this business with a little money given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, meat, pepper, fufu, etc., for her business. She hopes to build a house and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, pepper, fufu, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik is an experienced farmer from Norakert village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife and two school age sons eight and seven years old. To take care of his family, Rafik is engaged in the breeding of livestock; a cow, pigs, and hens, and in the cultivation of wheat, alfalfa, and several fruits (peaches, apricots, quinces and pears). He takes the agricultural products to the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Rafik's wife assists him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Rafik needs to expand his agribusiness to be able to effectively cover the needs of his family. A loan of USD 2,000 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase a cow, calf, and barley seeds. Rafik and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, calf, and barley seeds

loans.name: Manya

texts.en:
Manya is from the Dalarik region of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son and daughter. Manya works as an accountant at the village local school. Her husband is employed in the private sector as a driver. Manya's daughter is a university student, and her son in engaged in farming. All the family works hard struggling for everyday living. 

With the help of her son, Manya is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock of pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of tomato, watermelon, alfalfa, apricot and grapes. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way Manya needs a loan of USD 1500 in order to purchase four steers. Manya and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase four steers.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tienen un hijo, quien es la mayor inspiración de ellos. Comenta que se inició hace más de 10 años en la venta de carbón, comenzó con un camioncito ahora ya tiene 2, en época de zafra se dedica a transportar caña de azúcar a las fabricas, tiene un local equipado con una gomería y un local de venta de carbones que alquila, su esposa lo apoya en todo, ella es docente, y ambos trabajan y se esfuerzan bastante.
