Carlos pide de este crédito para la compra de sandias, ya que quiere incursionar en la venta de estas y asa poder tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos is 40 years old. He is married, and they have a son, who is their greatest inspiration. He comments that he began selling charcoal ten years ago. He began with a little truck, and now he has two. In the harvest season, he transports sugar cane to the processing plants. He has one store set up as a tire shop and one for selling charcoal, which he rents. His wife helps him in everything. She is a teacher, and they both work and make quite an effort.

Carlos is asking for this loan to buy watermelons, since he wants to expand into their sale and thus have better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy watermelons to sell

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es:
Reyner tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 10 años, junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, son muy conocidos en la zona por la labor que realizan.

El ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener un mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyner is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the District of Oyotun, a community that is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

For the past 10 years, Reyner and his family have been raising and selling small animals. They are well-known in their area for the work that they perform. Reyner is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed. This will result in better production so that he can offer animals to his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en su casa propia, el es soltero, y cometa que es oriundo de Caapucú una ciudad del interior , había venido hace como 12 años atrás, en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, primeramente empezó a estudiar y hoy día ya está en la facultad cursando  el 4to año de Administración de Empresas.
Entró a trabajar en una empresa dedicada a la venta de muebles, estuvo allí por más de 6 años, luego viendo la posibilidad de independizarse  pudo montar su propio negocio de venta de muebles, donde hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Hoy pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de muebles varios, con  los que podrá surtirse y seguir dando todo de sí para crecer.
texts.en: Pedro is 22 years old, lives in his own home, and is single.   He says that he comes from Caapucú, an interior city. He came twelve years ago, looking to improve his quality of life. First, he began to study and today he is in college in his fourth year of study in Business Administration. He went to work at a furniture sales company and was there for over six years.  Then, he saw the possibility of becoming independent, and was able to start his own furniture sales business where today he has a very good clientele.  Today, he is requesting this loan to purchase various furniture pieces, with which he will be able to stock up and continue giving his all in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for sale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the region of Kampala East in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, in which she sells home use products like posho, sugar, juice, rice, beans and curry powder.

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase on the capital stock and buy more beans, milk, posho, sugar, juice, rice, and curry powder, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and open up a bigger retail shop. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a mini supermarket. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase on the capital stock and buy more posho, sugar, juice, rice, beans, and curry powder.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 25 years old and a very hardworking gentleman who supports his two siblings. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the past four years, with a monthly income of about 30,000 KES. He learned about KADET from some of his colleagues who are funded by KADET LTD.

Paul has acquired his first loan of 87,880 KES, which will help him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more income, due to increased flexibility and an already-established customer base.

Paul plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan, as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the region of Kampala East in Uganda. She is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 11 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her clinic, which deals in medical care and the sale of medicines. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to boost her clinic and buy more medicines.  It will help Gorret to generate greater profits and improve her family's income. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to have a new wing. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve her clinic and buy more medicines

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive don Juan, tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos de  22, 20, 17, 16 y 13 años, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Juan es un hombre muy trabajador que día a día busca la forma de que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir, es así como que con mucho esfuerzo les está dando educación a su hijos a pesar de que los gastos son muchos, él como muchas personas de su localidad se dedica a la agricultura con ayuda de sus hijos siembran arroz, papayas y maíz,  siembran en toda época del año ya que cuentan con bombas de agua para el riego.  También cría chanchos con lo cual también se gana algo extra para el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar semillas y abono para tener una buena cosecha. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a  sacar adelante a su familia. Sus sueños es tener un carro para llevar sus productos s a los mercados.
texts.en:
Santa Lucía de Quiroga Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, where the people mainly work in agriculture, raise animals, and sell their products.

This is where Juan lives.  He's 42 years old and married, and has five children, ages 22, 20, 17, 16, and 13.  The two oldest are in college and the younger ones are in high school.  His wife is a homemaker.

Juan's a very hardworking man who every day looks for ways for his family to have everything they need to live.  This way he puts his effort into giving his children an education even though there are a lot of expenses.

Juan works in agriculture as do many people in his town.  With the help of his children he grows rice, papayas, and corn.  They plant year round because they have water pumps for irrigation.  He also raises pigs to earn a little extra for his family's well-being.

Juan's going to use this loan to buy seeds and soil amendments so he get a good harvest.

He has been in the communal bank since the beginning and he likes it because the loans help him get his family ahead.  He dreams of having a car to take his crops to the markets.

loans.use: to buy seeds and soil amendments

loans.name: Vache

texts.en:
Vache is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri city of Shirak region. He lives with his mother. To take care of the family's needs, Vache runs a local wedding salon, where he rents wedding dresses and different accessories. Besides this, he organizes wedding ceremonies. He also sells different toys, flowers and gifts in that salon. 

Vache is the only breadwinner of the family, and works hard to be able to earn a living for the family. The assortment of goods he sells and rents in the salon is not that big and needs to be expanded as well as updated periodically in order for his small business to function in a productive way and be compatible. A loan of USD $3,000 will be a great support to this hardworking man and will enable him to purchase new wedding dresses, gifts and accessories to rent and sell in the salon. 

Vache and his mother highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase new wedding dresses, gifts and accessories to rent and sell in the salon.

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en:
John is 26 years and unmarried but with three dependents who are his brothers and mother respectively. John is a welder making doors and windows which are metallic. From income earned he has managed to look after his siblings by paying their tuition and also look after his aged mother.

John is applying for a loan of UGX.1, 500,000= in order to buy more metal to make more doors for his business.
 
His major challenge is inadequate income to inject in his business which requires much capital.

His dream is to see his workshop the biggest around his town area. He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a farmer from Tsiatsan village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and four-year-old granddaughter. Yelena's husband works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the needs of the family. With the help of her family members, Yelena is engaged in breeding a livestock of piglets, and in plant cultivation; they cultivate beans, potato, cucumber, greens and flowers. 

Yelena realizes the agricultural products at the local market, which is the most important source of family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yelena needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase flower seeds, fertilizers, and cellophane for the greenhouse. Yelena and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase flower seeds, fertilizers, and cellophane for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is an experienced agronomist from Aknashen village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and school age son (14 years old). To take care of her family, Anahit is extensively engaged in agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she is engaged in plant cultivation in greenhouses, and in cultivation of alfalfa and greens. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Their agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 1,500 will support this hard-working woman and her family greatly, enabling them to purchase cellophane, cable and pipes for building a greenhouse, and to buy some fertilizers. Anahit and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer plus cellophane, cable and pipes to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en: Hovik is an experienced farmer from Qarakert village in Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 16 year-old daughter, 6-year-old daughter, 14-year-old son, his brother, his brother’s wife, and his mother. Hovik’s wife and his brother’s wife work in the village's local self governance body, and his brother works in the private sector. All of them work really hard, struggling to make a living. Hovik is extensively involved in agribusiness; he breeds livestock, such as cows and hens, and cultivates watermelons, alfalfa, and apricots, then sells the agricultural products in the local market. The agribusiness is an important source of the family’s income. As life is getting more expensive with time, and the family’s needs are increasing as well, Hovik needs to expand his agribusiness a little bit to be able to make ends meet. To reach that goal, Hovik needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase three heifers and four steers. The loan will help him maintain and develop his agribusiness. Hovik and his family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers and four steers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives in Kilifi, Kenya. She is 20 years old and she has just married. She has operated a food cafe in town for one year now. She started the business from a loan that she received from another institution. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy a motorbike to help her transport the food from the market to her business location. When she is not using motorbike for work, it will be carrying people from one point to another to earn income for her and her family. Her long term ambition is to transform her food cafe into a restaurant in the coming years. The challenges that she faces in the business are price changes and fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike in order to transport food from the market to her business location.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband is working as a laborer, but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Ruqia is the mother of eight children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of detergents and some grocery items, such as grains, flour and sugar in large quantities, to meet increasing demand in her store. She is in her fifth loan cycle, with good credit history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and some grocery items, such as grains, flour and sugar in large quantities.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. One of her sons is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this reason, Khursheed has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. Khursheed is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is 30 years and married, the mother of two children.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Senabulya

texts.en:
Senabulya is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the region of Kampala East in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Senabulya has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair dressing and the sale of cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Senabulya has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a central dryer and finish her commercial building. It will enable Senabulya to generate greater profits and generate a family income for her children's upkeep and school fees. Senabulya hopes that in the future, she will be able to boost her business. 

Senabulya is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Senabulya who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy a central dryer and finish her commercial building

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en:
Zaria is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the region of Kampala East in Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Zaria has been working hard to manage her clothing sales business, in which she sells clothing and jewelry. 

To help expand her business, Zaria has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new stock of clothes, earrings, necklaces and bangles, and will help Zaria to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Zaria hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop selling baby items. 

Zaria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zaria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy new stock of clothes, earrings, necklaces and bangles.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the  region of Kampala east in Uganda. He is married and has seven children, with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Moses has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beer, water, spirits, and wine. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to fill the capital gap and buy more beers, water, spirits and wine, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and improve the bar. Moses hopes that in the future, he will be able to make the bar a bigger joint. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beers, water, spirits, and wine.

loans.name: Amparo Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Amparo, tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 8 y 7 años,  la mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Amparo tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que le piden que les confeccione alguna prenda o les realice algún arreglo en las mismas. Ella también realiza parte del crédito para el esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de frutas negocio que también tienen en su hogar, ellos Trabajan todos los días en todas sus actividades.  es así como ellos salen adelante y tratan de darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales de costura y  frutas. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se le hace más fácil seguir con su negocio. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Lucia De Quiroga" meets every fifteen days in the parish of Quiroga of the city of Calceta, a place where people make a living through agriculture, animal husbandry, and the sale of their resulting products. 

Amparo lives in this parish. She is forty-two years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children, aged seven, eight, and twenty years old, from this relationship. The oldest child attends high school, and the younger children attend primary school. Her spouse works in agriculture.

Amparo runs a small sewing workshop out of her home where she makes all types of clothing. She takes orders from private individuals who request her to sew articles of clothing or mend them. She will also direct part of this loan to her spouse who works in agriculture and the buying and selling of fruit, a business that they run from their home. They work every day in all of their activities. This is how they get ahead and try to provide their children with the best education.

She will use this new loan to buy sewing materials and fruits. This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans make it easier for her to continue working. Her dream is provide your children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and fruit.

loans.name: Tatiana Fabiola

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven de 19 años, la cual trabaja  en una pequeña institución en la atención a clientes; con los ingresos de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que ella actualmente estudia la carrera de administración en una universidad de su ciudad.

Tatiana agradece el apoyo que le están bridando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a este apoyo podrá comprar una computadora, ya que le es necesaria para poder realizar sus trabajos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y pode tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Tatiana is a young 19 year old.  She works for a small institution in customer service.  With the income from her job, she can pay her tuition expenses as she is currently studying for a degree in administration at a university in her city.  Tatiana is thankful for the support of Kiva lenders because thanks to this support, she will be able to purchase a computer.  She needs a computer to be able to perform her work and continue striving to make her great dream a reality: “To finish her degree and be able to have her own home”.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Rikina

texts.en:
Rikina is 34 years old and supports a family of five, with his children being between the ages of four and eight years old. He is a livestock trader in Nkareta Area of Narok County, Kenya. Rikina has been running the business for the past two years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has borrowed a fourth loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD., which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profits will be reinvested to boost the business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for resale.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is a 50-year-old widowed mother of seven children. In the civil war in 1997, two of her children vanished without a trace; no one ever found what happened to them, unfortunately. This tragedy caused a deadly heart attack to her husband, who passed away a year later.
 
“I grieve even nowadays; there are times that I cry out loud and I can’t stop it. I miss my children and I miss my husband. I have kept my children’s items in a keepsake box and I keep going to it every day and touch their belongings, and I get lost in pain afterwards. I don’t know how to explain all the pain I have been experiencing since that November 13, 1997,” said Marte, looking away and wiping her tears with the sleeves of the sweater.

She wants to build renting rooms for the summer since she lives in a beautiful coastal village.

loans.use: to build renting rooms for summer tourism

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak is from Aygeshat village in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents. Artak is employed in the government sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary alone, however, is not enough to cover the daily needs of the family. Artak is also engaged in cultivation of alfalfa, peach, apricot, cherries, and in viniculture. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. As the family's needs are growing on a day-to-day basis, Artak needs to expand his agribusiness to be able to meet the needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling his to purchase two cows, to buy some forage for them, and to make previous credit repayments. With the help of the loan Artak will sustain his agribusiness. He and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for the support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, to buy some forage for them, and to make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Merushe

texts.en:
Merushe and her husband Sami have been photographed here with their five-year-old son who was born with autism. They have two other older children. The regular treatment that their son gets is very expensive in Albania, since there is a scarcity of such services or centers in the country, even though autism is spreading rapidly in the country.

Merushe and Sami want to add a dairy cow to their existing herd. They have been selling fresh dairy and agricultural produce for the past three years. In addition, Merushe makes wool rugs and sells them. By helping Merushe, you have already helped her little son to get the proper services for his disease.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en: Sirvard is a farmer from Lernagog village in the Armavir region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, school age granddaughter (7 years old), and newborn granddaughter. Sirvard's son is a construction worker in the private sector and her daughter-in-law is an instructor at the village local kindergarten. To assist her family members to earn a living, Sirvard is engaged in breeding cows and pigs and cultivating alfalfa. All the family works hard to be able to meet the ends. Sirvard realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Sirvard wants to expand her agribusiness a little to more effectively meet the family's needs. A loan of USD 2,500 will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase three pigs and to make previous credit repayments. Sirvard and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is 37 years old and married with a child. She lives in Haja, Yemen. She is a friendly, hard working, and honorable person. She is a teacher who has a low monthly income. She has been spending her savings income for household expenses and now she does not have any savings.

She has a small house and intends to complete building her house. This is of great importance to her family as they will be able to live in better conditions. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from AMB to buy construction supplies to finish building her house. She is grateful to the people who help with credit and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
Mehboob is 37 years old and married with four children. She has been operating a business selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Therefore, Mehboob started her own business to contribute to the family's income. 

Mehboob has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 31 years old and married. 

She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her eighth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 48-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching bed sheets and pillows’ covers for the past two years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from the Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces and needles. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces and needles.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena, villager from the north, wants to build a stable immediately because the cold weather and severe storms have already kicked in.  The one you see in the photograph is the existing one and out of shape completely, according to her. She is being photographed scattering corn to her chickens.

Prena is the married mother of four children, who are still going to school. 

For the past almost four years, she’s been taking care of her animals and selling dairy to the local farmers market.  This loan will be her third one with the previous ones being repaid in full.

loans.use: to build a stable

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 32 years old and married.  She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past 10 years. 

She sells milk to the people of her locality and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also sells butter and yogurt to generate an extra amount of income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. 

This will allow her to purchase anothe cow. Parveen is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ganchos, colas y diadema para el cabello,etc.  desde hace  varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con a la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunas gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su pequeño negocio y asi obtener mas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She works selling cosmetics, hairpins, pony tails, and headbands, etc. For many years, her business has been located in the market that is close to her home. That is how she makes her sales. With the help of her husband, she has been able to pay for some of their home expenses. Ana is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her small business so she can earn more and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hairpins, pony tails and headbands, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 58 años de edad desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta y elaboración de crema, queso, requesón, cuajada, etc. posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad de los productos, con lo que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus 7 nietos y su esposo, Doña Concepción está solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la comprar de leche por mayor para seguir elaborando sus productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Concepción is 58 years old. For the past 12 years, she has worked making and selling cream, cheese, cheese curds, cottage cheese, etc. She has many clients because of her good prices and the quality of her products. With her sales, she has been able to cover some of her home expenses. She lives in her own house with her 7 grandchildren and her husband. Concepción is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL to buy milk wholesale to keep making her products. This will allow her to earn more and give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy milk wholesale

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Gardnersville. She is 29 years old and married to a local businessman; they have 6-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past five years, she has been fixing and selling iron soap (a local soap made from caustic and palm oil) in the market. Oretha says the main challenge she faces is the transporting cost. She learned this way of selling from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business. She wants to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling milk for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the picture. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has four children who are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 25,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Greda's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five members, namely Gifty, Adama, Elizabeth, Rose and Naomi. They sell liquid soap, provisions, charcoal, beans and gari (cassava flour) in the Accra community. They have been together as a group since February 2013. 

Naomi is a 42-year-old provisions and liquid soap seller who is married to Geofrey, a 42-year-old civil servant. They have two children. She has been selling provisions and liquid soap for the past 13 years. She hawks from Monday to Sunday from her home to her customers. This is her fourth loan and she needs 1,300 GHS [Ghana cedis] to buy more provisions and liquid soap to sell to her customers. 

The group needs a total amount of 5,200 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and liquid soap to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ghaitha Group

texts.en:
Ghaitha group consists of four women from AL-Hodeida, Yemen. 

Halima, who is 56 years old, is the leader of the group. She is illiterate. She is the mother of seven children and the breadwinner of the family. 

Ten years ago, she started up her business in selling ice cream to assist her husband in covering household expenses. She had no choice but to work and provide her family with food and clothing. 

Al-Hodeidah Governorate is one of the warmest cities in Yemen, and therefore most of the residents buy ice cream daily. 

Halima has applied for a loan of YER 30,000 to buy a new fridge to keep her ice cream cold .  She wants to start selling ice creams in new quarters and places in her city. 

Halima looks forward to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge to keep ice cream cold .

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en:
Kaingu lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married, with six children whom he takes care of alongside his wife. 

He knew Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale in his business. The major challenge that he faces in the business is the weather and the price changes. He has long-term ambitions to operate his business in his own vehicle. 

The income that he will raise from the business will improve his living standards as well as educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Edigio

texts.es:
Edigio es una persona que sabe que para el estudio no hay límites, es por eso que sigue estudiando. Está haciendo el masterado de evaluación ambiental, que le permitirá estar más actualizado y lo cual le abrirá más puertas.
Quiere ser un gran profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas, y que por medio de sus conocimientos sirva a la sociedad.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchos los gastos que tiene que cubrir. También agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Edigio is a person who knows that education has no limits. For this reason, he is continuing his studies. Edigio is working on his Masters in Environmental Assessment. This will help him be more up-to-date and will open more doors.

Edigio wants to be a successful professional so that he can help other people. Through his knowledge, he will be able to serve society. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree expenses, since there are many to cover. Edigio is also grateful for the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: El Grupo Activo Group

texts.es: “EL GRUPO ACTIVO” está conformado por 10 socios todos dedicados a diferentes comercios. Una de ellas es María de 28 años, ella tiene 02 hijos pequeños y vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pareja. María se dedica a la venta de comidas, diariamente recorre diferentes calles de su zona ofreciendo las comidas que prepara  sus mejores clientes son trabajadores y vecinos del lugar, gracias a su trabajo ayuda con el sustento de su familia sobretodo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener un restaurante propio. María agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo que es un gran apoyo para su grupo, María es la segunda de la izquierda viste buzo color turquesa y en la foto adjunta se encuentra Yessenia.
texts.en: The communal bank "EL GRUPO ACTIVO" is made up of ten members, all dedicated to different businesses. One of these members is María who is twenty-eight years old. She has two small children, and she and her partner live with her parents. María sells food; every day she covers several streets throughout the area, selling the food that she prepares. Her best customers are local workers and residents. Thanks to her work, she helps to support her family, above all, with the costs of her children's education.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for food preparation. Her greatest dream in life is to have her own restaurant. María is grateful for Kiva lenders for this loan which is a great support for her group. María is the second from the left and is wearing a blue sweatsuit. Another member of the group, Yessenia, appears in the attached photo.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 4 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene logar solventar los gastos de si hogar, Esther esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y asi poder continuar con su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Esther lives with her two children and her husband in the house that they own. She has earned her living raising chickens for four years, selling her products in different markets that are located near her house. She has a large customer base because of her good prices, so she manages to cover her household expenses. 

Esther is requesting a loan so that she can buy concentrated feed and vitamins for her chickens. Then she will be able to continue with her work in order to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa de 52 años de edad, manifestó que con mucho esfuerzo sus padres le pudieron dar para que cursara hasta un segundo grado, ya que tenia que trabajar con sus padres en la agricultura, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y están con su propia familia solo vive con su esposo.

Ella se a dedicado a trabajar desde muy pequeña en el campo y en el hogar, los que le enseñaron fueron sus padres con mucho esfuerzo; ya que era una familia bastante numerosa. Cuando se caso, empezó a trabajar con su esposo en la agricultura hace un par de años su esposo tuvo un accidente y quedo invalido y ella tomo la responsabilidad por su cuenta, cuidando a su esposo y ademas trabajando para mantenerse. Trabaja la agricultura, paga empleados que le ayuden y en ocasiones lo desempeña por su cuenta, ademas trabaja sirviendo en una casa como empleada domestica, esto lo hace todos los días, desde la mañana; ya que tiene que estar a las 6 de la mañana y de su casa al trabajo esta a 3 kilómetros de distancia y regresa hasta por la tarde, ademas cuida a su esposo que no le falte nada en el transcurso del día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar la instalación de la energía eléctrica, ya que en su casa no hay. Ella espera, logra con mucho esfuerzo que su esposo se recupere y lograr mejorar su casa para un futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, said that her parents made the effort so she could study up to second grade, because she had to work with her parents in agriculture.  Her children are grown and live with their own families.  She only lives with her husband.

Rosa has worked in the fields and in the home since she was very young.  Her parents taught her with a lot of effort because there were a lot of people in her family.  When she got married she started working in agriculture with her husband.  A few years ago her husband became disabled in an accident, so she assumed responsibility for caring for him as well as for working to support herself.

Rosa works in agriculture and pays the employees who help her; sometimes she does the work herself.  She also works every day as a housekeeper in a private home.  She has to be there at 6 in the morning and her house is three kilometers away; she returns home in the afternoon.  She also takes care of her husband so he has everything he needs during the day.

The loan she's requesting is to pay to have electricity installed because her house doesn't have it.

She hopes her husband recovers and she manages to improve her house in the future.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home

loans.name: Willian Evidel

texts.es:
Willian de 33 años de edad, es una persona acompañada que estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos que dependen de las actividades que él realiza

él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 2 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposa durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde trabaja  en otras parcelas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera, que le venden para producir leche y así obtener un ingreso adicional  para el sustento de su familia.


En un  futuro, desea comprar un terreno para sembrar, ya que alquilar para sembrar le sale mas caro.
texts.en:
Willian is 33 years old. He is a busy person who studied up to the ninth grade. He wakes up at 5:00 am. He lives with his wife and their two children who depend on the work that he does. 

Willian works in agriculture, a job that he learned from his parents. He walks 2 km to get to the plots of land where he and his wife work together during the morning. Later in the course of the afternoon Willian works on other plots of land.

The loan Willian is requesting is to buy a milk cow to produce milk and be able to make some additional income to sustain his family. 


In the future, Willian hopes to buy a plot of land to plant on, since renting the land is more expensive for him.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma tiene 35 años, es soltera, tiene tres hijos dependientes los cuales se encuentran estudiando en un colegio fiscal, vive en la zona norte de Cochabamba. Estudio hasta el nivel de bachillerato pero no logro estudiar ninguna carrera por falta de recursos económicos. Hace aproximadamente tres años se dedica al servicio de gastronomía pero recientemente abrió su propio bar-restaurante. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio con el fin de otorgar mayor comodidad a los clientes y obtener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Señora Vilma is 35 years old. She is single and has three dependent children who study in a public school. She lives in the northern part of Cochabamba. 
She completed high school, but was not able to earn a degree for lack of economic resources. 

For about three years, Vilma has worked in food service, but she recently opened her own bar and restaurant. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of tables and chairs for her business with the objectives of providing her customers with greater comfort and earning better profits.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Carmen Yanira

texts.es:
Carmen de 42 años de edad, es una persona divorciada, es madre de un hijo de 14 años, ella estudio hasta educación media. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su hijo,  a quien enviá a la escuela, mientras ella se dedica actividades comerciales, como la venta de productos de telefonía celular (venta a domicilio); oficio que aprendió de su primer esposo que falleció; estos productos los comercializa en su residencia y alrededores y en otros municipios 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para surtir su negocio con mas mercadería;  ya que actualmente no logra cubrir la demanda que pose con el inventario que posee.

 Carmen planea en un futuro, poder mandar a su hijo a la universidad y que sea profesional y  persona de bien.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, is divorced and the mother of a son, age 14.  She studied up to middle school.  She gets up at 5 a.m. with her son, who goes to school while she works in commercial activities such as selling mobile phone products at home.  She learned this work from her first husband, who died.  She sells these products at home as well as in the area and in other towns.

The loan Carmen's requesting is to stock her business with more merchandise because she can't meet the current demand with her inventory.

Carmen hopes she'll be able to send her son to college in the future so he can be a professional and an honorable person.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Laureana esta contenta por el prestamo y agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo, ella continua viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y con el negocio de venta de refrescos y ropa, ella continua siendo parte del banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo frutas, colorantes artificiales y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laureana is pleased with the loan and appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their support. She continues to live in the city of Salvación and manage her business of selling soft drinks and clothes. Laureana also continues to participate in the Communal Bank "Tesoritos del Manu”.

For this opportunity, she is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as fruit, artificial coloring, and other items. She is grateful and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit, artificial coloring, and other supplies.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es: Erika de 36 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de productos de uso personal como perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, etc.  posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios que ofrece en sus productos, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, Erika está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Erika is 36 years old. For the past 6 years, she has worked selling personal products, such as perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions, etc. She has many clients because of the good prices that she offers on her products. Erika lives in her own house with her husband and their 4 children. Erika is requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale to continue her business since this is her only source of work. In this way, she can give her family what they need without limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es: Jessica de 29 años edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres  hijos. Ella posee una tortillería desde hace tres años la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; Jessica es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, siempre se mantiene delante de  la competencia, quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Jessica tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old and lives with her life partner and their three children. She has had a tortilla-making business for three years; it is well-known in the area where she lives. She has many customers because she sells the best warm tortillas with the fastest service at very affordable prices. 

Jessica is an enterprising woman with a desire to do well; she always stays ahead of the competition. She wants to make her business grow, so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy corn at wholesale. Jessica hopes that this will allow her to bring economic security to her home and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, José quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. José  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He has a store where he sells beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other basic necessities.  He has had his business for many years and it has given him experience in sales, which allows him to get the best profits.

The store's located in José's home in a very busy area.  He has acquired a lot of customers because he has the best-stocked store.  People prefer him and keep him ahead of the competition because he always has what they need with quality products at affordable prices and with incomparable customer service.

José wants to grow his business and make a new investment.  He needs capital, though, so he's asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, beverages, and so forth.

He has a good payment record and is certain he'll pay back the debt.  He also trusts he'll give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak has worked as a taxi driver for a year, using his own car. He lives in Ararat town of Ararat region with his wife and two children. Artak's wife doesn’t work as she needs to take care of the children and the household. So Artak is the only breadwinner in the family and works hard to cover their basic costs. With the income earned from the taxi driving business, Artak manages to cover their daily costs and give his family appropriate living conditions. Now, the car that Artak drives as a taxi is damaged and he can't continue his work. By applying for this loan Artak asks for financial support to be able to repair it and purchase 4 tires for the winter. Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artak and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his car and purchase 4 tires for the winter

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Mariama from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children. She started the business to take care of her family. 

Mariama runs a fish business at home; she sells fish within her community. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more fish and cooking season for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking season for resale.

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Hassanatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. She began her business because she wants to be self-dependent and educate her children. In 2008, Hassanatu established her general store business.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Hassanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like mayonnaise, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and develop her family. In the future, Hassanatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like mayonnaise, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, she is 30-years-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child who is five-years-old. In 2003, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more different kinds of clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Gwikonge Group

texts.en:
This is a group of eight farmers called Gwikonge. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Michael, who is raising up his hand, is 48 years old. He is married with nine children. He depends solely on farming to earn a living and is therefore keen on practicing better farming methods. During the 2014 long rains, Michael will plant a one acre farm with maize on ½ acre and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each.

He is therefore requesting a loan to enable him to purchase farm inputs. With the farm inputs, he is hopeful that the harvest will be good and he will ensure food security for his large family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Ana Arely

texts.es:
Ana de 26 años de edad, es casada estudio hasta bachillerato, por el momento no tiene hijos, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto esposo para prepararse e ir a trabajar.

 Ana es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a trabajar, como empleada domestica durante la mañana y luego en el resto del día se dedica a elaborar comida típica, actividad que ha desarrollado durante varios años y oficio que aprendió de sus  madre.  Compra la materia prima, para la elaboración de comida típica  en el mercado de la ciudad, donde le sale mas barato.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales para la construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillo, etc) para  su vivienda; ya que actualmente reside en una de adobe que ya no es habitable.

Su propósito, es en un futuro seguir estudiando, para llegar hacer una profesional y poder conseguir un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and married. She studied through high school. For now, she has no children. Ana gets up at 5:00 am with her husband to get ready and go to work.

Ana is a person who has worked for  many years. She works as a domestic employee during the morning. The rest of the day she makes traditional food, an activity which developed over many years and is a trade she learned from her mother. Ana buys the raw materials to make the food in the city market where it is cheaper.

The loan Ana is requesting is to buy construction materials (sand, cement, brick, etc.) for her home since she currently lives in an adobe house that is no longer inhabitable.

Ana’s goal for the future is to continue studying to become a professional and be able to get a better job.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, brick, etc.) for her home, since she currently lives in an adobe house that is no longer inhabitable.

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA HERMANDAD” está conformado por 7 socios. Ana es una de ellas, casada con 02 hijos pequeños. Ana es docente en una escuela de su sector, hace 02 años empezó su propio negocio la venta de productos de belleza, este trabajo lo realiza en sus horas libres y le permiten un ingreso adicional para solventar los gastos familiares. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de perfumería y artículos de belleza, debido a la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas las ventas aumentan, por eso quiere invertir en su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias. Ana sueña con tener un lugar donde establecer su negocio para dedicarse solo al negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo. Ana es la cuarta de la izquierda esta sentada y viste buzo color azulino.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Hermandad" is made up of seven members. Ana is one of these members. She is married and has two small children. Ana is a teacher at a school in the area. Two years ago, she started her own business of selling beauty products. She does this work in her free time and it affords her an additional income to cover home expenses. She will use this loan to buy perfume and beauty products. Because Christmas time is approaching, sales increase; this is why she wants to invest in her business to earn more income. Ana dreams of a having a place where she could establish her business and focus solely on business. The group is grateful for Kiva lenders for this loan. Ana is the fourth one from the left; she's seated and wearing a bluish tracksuit.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the  region of Kampala north in Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, in which she deals in the sale and rearing of birds. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks and feed and will help Betty to generate greater profits and growth in business thereby allowing her to pay school fees for her children. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big poultry farm. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Yliane

texts.es:
Yliane tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural, su población se dedica ala cultivo de manzanas, ciruelas, comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta ganado caprino chivos y cerdos, los cría en un terreno cerca a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para terminar de cercar los corrales donde cría sus animales.
texts.en:
Yliane is 46 years old and lives in the District of Nueva Arica. This rural area is known for the cultivation of apples and plums, as well as for trade and livestock breeding. The community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Yliane raises and sells goats and pigs on a plot of land near her home. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed. Part of the money will also be used to complete the enclosure of the pens where her animals are kept.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and to finish the enclosure of her animal pens.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Aminata from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  After she left school, Aminata established her rubber slippers business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week, moving around the community to establish her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is slow sales during the rainy season.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more rubber slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  Isatu established her clothing business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run it.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more men's and women's pants, bras and vests to expand her clothing business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her children's welfare. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more men's and women's pants, bras and vests to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, es una persona que solo estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona casada, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de tres hijos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa  e hijos quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

José  se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 2 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposa durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde ordeña sus vacas para producir queso, crema. Etc. Que su esposa sale a vender

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cambiarle el techo a su vivienda; ya que actualmente no sirve y en invierno se filtra demasiado el agua lo que le daña su bienes y la familia se enferma por la humedad que se filtra. Él desea adquirir,  un terreno para tener sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and the father of three children. He only studied until sixth grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of their home. José gets up at 5:00 a.m. along with his wife and his children, who depend on the work that he does. 

José earns his living in agriculture and livestock, a trade that he learned from his parents. To reach his land, he walks two kilometers and works with his wife during the morning. Later, in the course of the afternoon, he milks his cows to make cheese, cream, etc., which his wife sells. 

The loan that he is requesting will be used to replace the roof of his house, since it is no longer good and leaks excessively in the winter. The moisture that comes in damages his possessions and makes his family ill. 

His desire is to acquire a plot of land for his animals, since he currently rents one.

loans.use: to replace the roof of his house; his current roof is no longer good and leaks too much during the winter.

loans.name: Missebo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSEBO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Joséphine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Joséphine est mariée à un cultivateur nommée Joël. Le couple a huit enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Joséphine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Joséphine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Joséphine achète des noix de palme, qu'elle transforme en huile de palme, qu'elle revend par la technique de distribution depuis quinze ans. Joséphine vend également du vin de palme et divers articles. Joséphine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Joséphine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe MISSEBO pour solliciter un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Missebo group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Joséphine (raising her hand in the photo) is 37 years old. Joséphine is married to a farmer named Joël. The couple has eight children, some of whom are going to school, though the couple does not pay for their schooling. Joséphine lives with her husband and their children. 

Josephine and her husband take care of household expenses. To do this, Joséphine buys palm kernels to process into palm oil, which she then resells through distribution, and has been doing so for fifteen years. Joséphine also sells palm wine and a variety of other items. Joséphine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

In hopes of strengthening her business, Joséphine has joined forces with the other members of the Missebo group to seek their fifth loan through Alidé. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy palm kernels, palm wine and other various items.

loans.name: Komoko Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Komoko Group based in the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Michael (raising his hand in the photo) has been a member of this group for three years. He is 26 years old and married with three children. With this loan from Kiva, Michael plans to buy farm inputs to grow maize, sorghum and millet on a one acre farm. The harvest, which he hopes will be very good, will provide food security for his household. He plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Kengate Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Kengate B Group based in Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Solomon is a first-time member and believes that joining this group will change his life and that of his family positively. Being someone who has depended on subsistence agriculture, Solomon believes that this will change when he uses hybrid seeds and fertilizers. He is married with three children who go to school.

Solomon hopes to obtain a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the use of the farm inputs, he believes he will get enough harvest for food in his household and will sell the surplus to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: K. B.  Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of four farmers called K.B. Group from the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge in improved farming methods. They need loans through Nuru International in order to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

John has been farming with Nuru for three years with this group. He is 34 years old and married with four children. He is asking for a loan from Kiva to enable him to obtain farm inputs. He hopes to get a good harvest which will not only provide food for his family, but will also provide him with money after the sale of the surplus. He plans to use the surplus money to invest in livestock. He will later sell the livestock to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is 24 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She started work from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 5 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. She requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani Rupee from the Kashf Foundation. She will use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La Señora Santusa continua con la venta de golosinas como por ejemplo chicles, galletas, gaseosas, chocolates y otras cosas, ella sigue tieniendo su pequeño local en su domicilio donde continua expendiendo sus productos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo refrescos, chicles, dulces y galletas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Sra. Santusa continues to sell sweets such as gum, cookies, sodas, chocolates, and other items. She continues to manage a small store in her home where she is constantly expanding her product line.

Santusa is part of the Communal Bank "Tesoritos del Manu” and is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, gum, candy, and cookies. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, gum, candy, and cookies.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
Mburucuya se encuentra en su quinto ciclo del programa de comités, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que con arduo esfuerzo y trabajo están dando a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones como las que ellas pasaron.
Además de eso forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les ayudará a poder ver en que puntos deben trabajar más. Maria es integrante de este grupo, y ella comenta que se dedica a la costura, trabajo mediante el cual ella puede tener los medios para ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, y demás productos para poder seguir trabajando y mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
"Mburucuya" is in their fifth loan cycle. They are women who are the heads of their families. With arduous effort and work, they are providing their families with all that they need for a life without hardships as they themselves had endured. 

In addition, they are also a part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program, which will help them to be able to see what areas they have to work at more. Maria is a member of this group. She says that she works in sewing, a job through which she can have the means to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other products to continue working and improving her finances.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other products for sewing.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman and lives with her husband and only child. Her husband is the main income source for the family and he works in the Lebanese army. As for Darine, she has worked on a freelance basis as a beautician for the past five years. In order to improve her work and expand it, she decided to start hair removal services. To make that possible, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed machinery. Darine has requested that her face be blurred in the photo for cultural and/or religious reasons.  She always hopes for the best and she puts forth her greatest efforts to develop her work and earn a good income.

loans.use: purchase hair removal machinery.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 44 years old, is a mother of two, who are in school.  Her husband maintains their farm and sometimes when available, he works as a farm laborer.  They live a quiet and simple life in the village of Antagan. 

She is requesting for a loan of PHP 8,000 as added capital in her general store business which has been operating for almost a year.  She earns around PHP 400 in the business daily.  She reinvests some of it in the business and some of it goes to the daily school allowances of her children. She hopes that of all her children may able to graduate in their desired degree courses someday.

loans.use: as added capital in her general store business which has been operating for almost a year.

loans.name: Ledi

texts.en:
Ledi is 43 years old, married to Rikon, and supports a family of seven members. She is a mixed farmer and she has been in the business for the last eight years. Her monthly income is KES. 36,000.
 
She is currently servicing her first loan from KADET of KES. 30,000 that will facilitate her to prepare the land and get planting seedlings. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old, married to Daniel, and a mother of four children aged between three and seven years of age. For the last four years, she has farmed her own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in the area due to good climatic conditions.She learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be her fourth loan after successfully paying off the previous ones. She plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to re-invest in the farm and acquire a poshomill.
