Her dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy her own farm machinery, and educate her children. She is a hardworking lady who is focused on her set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and a poshomill

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, es acompañado;  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Una de sus 3 hijas asiste a la escuela a tercer grado.

José se dedica a la agricultura y a cuidar unos terrenos de unos señores que le han tomado confianza y cuida esos terrenos;  pero también es  albañil y hace todo tipo de casas cuando lo buscan tiene esa fuente de ingreso. La distancia de su casa al terreno que cuida hay una distancia de 20 minutos,  él viaja en bicicleta, el horario de trabajo es de las 6 a las 12 y de una a las cinco de la tarde.  

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  láminas y alguna madera que le falta a la casa. Tiene la idea de ponerle lamina a la parte de debajo de las tejas,  porque se han quebrado y es por ahí donde se le mojan algunas cosas.  La necesidad que satisfará, es que ya no se mojaran cuando venga la época de la lluvia.  

Uno de sus grandes sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijas, quiero que se preparen para que sean unas buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old. He is married and went to school through ninth grade. His wife takes care of their home. One of his three daughters attends school and is in third grade.

José earns his living in agriculture and by taking care of some property belonging to some gentlemen who trust him to care for their land. He is also a construction worker and builds all kinds of houses, so he also has that source of income when people hire him. The distance from his house to the land that he takes care of is about 20 minutes by bicycle. His work schedule is form 6:00 to noon, and from 1:00 to 5:00 in the afternoon.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy sheet metal and some wood that he needs for his house. His plan is to put the sheet metal beneath his roof tiles, because they have broken and are letting in water. This will satisfy their need to stay dry when the rainy season comes.

One of his greatest dreams is to provide the best for his daughters. He wants to prepare them to have good professional careers.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and some wood that he needs for his house. His plan is to put the metal under his roof tiles, which have broken and are letting water in.

loans.name: Jeovanny Alberto

texts.es:
Jeovanny de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato general, es soltero, trabaja en la carpintería, vive con la mamá solamente  ella depende de él.

Jeovanny,  es un joven  que trabaja en la casa de carpintero desde ya hace 15 años, este negocio lo ha aprendido del papá ya que el papá también ejerce este oficio y vio las ganancias en que se obtiene haciendo este trabajo de la carpintería,  el  horario de trabajo es de 7 a 4 de la tarde.

Con el crédito solicitado en fundación campo,  es para comprar más madera para surtir lo de la carpintería, ya que en este tiempo incrementan las ventas y la gente lo prefiere a él por su buen trabajo y la experiencia que tiene. El préstamo mejorara los ingresos y mejorara también en qué cuando los clientes vengan a buscar  lo encuentren.

Los sueños para su  negocio es tener buena carpintería y poder exportar todos los muebles a otros países y de las ganancias obtenidas poder invertirlos más en la carpintería.
texts.en:
Jeovanny, who is 28 years old, went to school through the general baccalaureate degree.  He is single and works in carpentry. He lives with his mother; she is the only one who depends on him.

Jeovanny is a young man who has already worked in carpentry for 15 years. He learned this business from his father, since his father also practiced this trade, and he saw the earnings that were obtained doing this carpentry work. His work schedule is from 7 until 4 in the afternoon.

With the loan that he has applied for from Fundación Campo, he will buy more wood to stock his carpentry supplies, since at this time his sales are increasing, and people prefer him for his good work and the experience that he has. The loan will improve his income, and in addition, when clients come to look for something, they will find it.

His dreams for his business are to have a good carpentry shop and be able to export all his furniture to other countries, and from the earnings obtained be able to invest more in the carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy more wood to stock his carpentry supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48-years-old and lives in Kakata Town.  She is single and has four children between 26- and 32-years-old.  Only one child is in school and lives at home. She attended school and stopped in the 8th grade. For the past five years, she has been selling dried meat from a table in the market. She focuses on bush meat.  She established the business with a loan from her mother. Some problems she faces is the distance to buy dry meat wholesale. She enjoys the independence her income gives her. Her dream is to have a provision shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy dry meat wholesale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  She started business to earn her daily survival for her family.
 
Ramatu runs a cookery business. She sells cooked food within her area and she has been running this business since 2002. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy foods like cooking seasoning, oil and rice to prepare for her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her family's standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foods like cooking seasoning, oil and rice to prepare for her cookery business.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Umu from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2004, Umu established her used bag business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Umu requires a loan in order to buy more bags and clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Umu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua lives in Kilifi, Kenya. He is 35 years old and he is married with one child. He is a motorcycle operator in Kilifi and he has been doing this business for one year now. He started the business from the savings he made over the years. The challenge he faces in this business is the high cost of fuel, which sometimes cuts into his income. He seeks a loan to buy another motorcycle. He learned of Milango Financial Services through friends who asked him to join them so that they could save and be able to access funding for their businesses. He hopes that his business will grow and that he will be able to open a restaurant in the future.  The income that he raises from the business will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Kunguku Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of two farmers called Kunguku based in Kuria West District. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Johnson has been the leader of this group for two years now. He is 39 years old and is married with five children who all go to school. Johnson will grow sorghum, millet and maize on a one acre farm during the 2014 long rains. He is therefore requesting a loan from Kiva. He will buy farm inputs with the loan given. This will enable him to have a bountiful harvest. He will secure food for his family and sell the surplus. He will spend that money not only on paying back the loan but also to pay school fees for his two children going to school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Tumaini Getongoroma Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Tumaini Getongoroma based in Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

John is a first time member. He believes that joining this group will change his life and that of his family positively. Being someone who has depended on subsistence agriculture, John believes that this will change when he uses hybrid seeds and fertilizers. He is married with five children who go to school. John hopes to obtain a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the use of the farm inputs, he believes he will get enough harvest for food in his household and will sell the surplus to pay school fees for his children who go to school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health services. She wants to grow her business so she has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani Rupee to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and sugar, along with cleaning products such as soaps and detergents to meet the increasing demand in her shop. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar, and cleaning products such as soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab, age 49, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en: Kaniz is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has gained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to be able to offer more to her customers. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. So she applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en: Maseiga is a 47 year old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Maseiga has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, crowbar, pickaxe, bush-knives, and tarpaulin for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Maseiga hopes to support her family and help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crowbar, pickaxe, bush-knives, and tarpaulin.

loans.name: Vidaldina

texts.es: Vidaldina mayor de edad madera soltera con tres hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país,  es un propietaria de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece al publico productos de consumo como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, papel higiénicos, entre otros, los cuales realiza sus compras al contado en mercados de la localidad, sus ventas son al contado, también es propietaria de un molino donde vende sus  servicio a la comunidad ella empieza a trabajar su molino desde las cuatro de la mañana cerrando algo tarde, donde muchos clientes son fijos y otros eventuales, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en sus negocios en la compra de productos de consumo para el hogar y para darle mantenimiento a su molino. Vidaldina agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Vidaldina is a mature, single woman with three children that she still cares for. She is from a municipality in the north of Chinandega, which is located on the west side of the country. She owns a small grocery store that is located in her home, where she sells merchandise to the public such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, snacks, detergent, and toilet paper, among other products. The goods will be bought with cash in local markets. The sales are in cash. She also owns a grinder and she sells grinding services to the community. She begins work at the grinder at four in the morning, closing late. She has many regular clients and other occasional clients. 
This credit will be used to invest in her business with the purchase of household goods and to get maintenance done on her grinder.
Vidaldina is very thankful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources.

loans.use: to buy household goods, such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, frozen foods, and to have maintenance work done on her grinder.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: Verónica, es una señora que labora como empleada domestica, que busca como progresar junto a su esposo, quien trabaja por cuenta propia como mecánico, ambos unen sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su hija con sus estudios universitarios. Doña Verónica tiene la urgencia de hacer el muro perimetral de la parte norte de su vivienda, ya que el barrio donde habita no es muy seguro, existe presencia delincuencial a todas horas, con el apoyo de crédito que solicita comprara bloques, hierro, cemento, arena para empezar la obra.
texts.en: Verónica is a woman who works as a domestic employee. She seeks to get ahead with her husband who is a self-employed mechanic. Both of them unite forces to help their daughter get ahead with her university studies. Verónica needs to build a perimeter wall on the north part of her home, since the neighborhood where they live is not very safe. There is delinquent activity at all hours. With the loan she is requesting, Verónica  will buy blocks, iron, and sand to start the work.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, and sand to start the work on a perimeter wall.

loans.name: 06-08-01 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 49 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 06-08-01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Thuy has a retail business selling incense and ghost money, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Her main challenge is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase incense and ghost money (offerings to the deceased) to resell.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her profits, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase incense and ghost money (offerings to the deceased) to resell

loans.name: 02130605_Thôn Hiệp Thành, Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vần has a retail business selling general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase general things such as candy, sugar, milk, towels, and other food products to resell. Vần has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Vần faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Vần is 58 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 02130605_Thôn Hiệp Thành, xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group. 

Vần supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Vần's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Vần hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase candy, sugar, milk, towels, and other food products to resell.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for his tricycle, which he has had for six years now. His loan was also helpful in the education of his children. As a widower, he is working hard to provide for everyday expenses.
 
He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the tricycle unit as well as to buy some equipment for the repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Redentor dreams of being more successful in his business, and hopes to give a good life to his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of a tricycle unit.

loans.name: Medardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Medardo de 23 años de edad, termino el Bachillerato técnico contador,  es soltero, él trabaja como de vendedor de aceite de cocina desde hace dos años,  vive con los papás y 3 hermanos  por el momento solo la mamá depende de él.

El trabajo lo consiguió, por medio de un primo, que le dijo que ahí necesitaban a un vendedor.  De la casa al trabajo le queda a 30 minutos, el horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana a alas 4de la tarde.

Medardo con el préstamo que ha solicitado en la Fundación Campo, comprara una motocicleta para el traslado a su trabajo esto mejorara el tiempo de llegada y poder movilizarme de mejor manera a mas lugares a ofrecer el producto y obtener muchas comisiones al cumplir las metas.

En el futuro desea, aprender bien el oficio y poder tener su propia empresa,  estudiar para prepararse, adquirir sus bienes, casarse,  para darle una buena vida a su familia y manifiesta que lo lograra con todo el sacrificio y empeño que le ponga al trabajo.
texts.en:
Medardo is 23 years old. He completed a technical diploma in accounting. He is single and has worked as a cooking oil salesman for two years. He lives with his parents and three siblings. At the moment, only his mother depends on him. 

He got his job through a cousin who told him that they needed a salesman there. It takes him 30 minutes to get from his house to his work, and his work schedule is from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. 

With the loan that he has requested from Fundación Campo, Medardo will buy a motorcycle for transportation to his job. This will improve his commute time and enable him to travel to more places to sell his product so that he can earn more commissions upon meeting his sales targets.

In the future, he would like to learn the trade well and have his own business, go back to school to prepare himself, buy his own property, get married, and give his family a good life. He would like to prove that he can achieve this with all the sacrifice and effort that he puts into his work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Munzoran

texts.en:
Munzoran is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years. She is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, good health, and clothing. 

Munzoran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Munzoran is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She is involved in business doing hand-embroidery. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. However, business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is doing work in a factory but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Razia's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street.  She is the best earning resource in her household, and she wants to grow her business. Razia requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani Rupees to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.  She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and she is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has 5 years of experience in this field.  Her son also assists her by purchasing stock goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani Rupees from the Kashf Foundation to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp with limited access to various working sectors. Houssam is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into developing his business and living. He has specialized in repairing electronic items and games since 2005. It is his only source of income, which is why he has to work hard on developing his business and widening his working sector.

Today, Houssam is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy spare parts for various electronics. His previous loan was invested for the same use and it had a positive impact on his business development.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for various electronics.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk is a 57-year-old married man and loving father of seven children; four of whom are married, and the other three still live with him in a small home in Pursat province. Ouk has a position at a local market, selling mixed grocery products. Having been in this for over 30 years, he is able to earn an income of $10 per day.

Since he doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, he is unable to help his family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, he has requested a loan of 1,000 US Dollars to build a household latrine and buy its necessities. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, he is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of his family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessities

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeniffer Tatiana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Santa Lucia De Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Jeniffer, tiene 22  años de edad, es madre soltera de 2  hijos de 5 y 4 años que están en un jardín de infantes de la localidad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Jeniffer con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo negocio que lo realiza puerta a puerta y cuando está desocupada ya que ella también todos los días prepara deliciosas empanadas de verde las mismas que vende en su casa. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a sus hijos, lo que para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y víveres para preparar las deliciosas empanadas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Santa Lucía de Quiroga communal bank meets in the Quiroga section of the city of Calceta, a place where the majority of people earn their livings farming, raising animals, and selling what they produce.

Señora Jeniffer lives in this area. She is 22 years old and the single mother of two children who are 5 and 4 years old and go to a local preschool. She lives in her parents' house.

With the intention of earning money on her own in order to be able to get ahead and provide for her children, Jeniffer works in sales. She sells all types of clothing door-to-door when she has free time, as she also makes delicious "empanadas de verde" [plantain-filled fried pastries] every day that she sells at her house. She has been doing this for four years, and it has allowed her to provide for her children, which for her is the most important thing.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing as well as ingredients for preparing the delicious empanadas that she sells. She has been in the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because the loans always help her to make progress. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and ingredients.

loans.name: Chemutai

texts.en:
Chemutai is 38 years old, windowed, and a mother of six children between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. She is  a mixed farmer and she has been in this business for the last six years. Her monthly income is about KES 38,000
 
Chemutai is currently servicing her fourth loan from KADET LTD of KES 90,000, which will help her to prepare the land and get seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Chemutai's dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol, 49, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the village of the Storng district of Kampong Thom province. She and her husband have been making Khmer Noodles for selling. She has been in rice farming business for 15 years, earning about $12 per day to feed her family.
 
Sol is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is now asking for an education loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee to study Accounting. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after the graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos de 36 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, es casado; la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado una hija de 4 años de edad.

Carlos trabaja con su camioncito propio, transportando gente del municipio a un cantón del municipio; ya tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a este negocio. Antes estaba fuera del país y fue de ese fondo que compro el camión y se vino para no estar lejos de la familia, entonces compro el carro para ponerlo a trabajar y tener una fuente de ingreso para la familia. Este trabajo le queda a 15 minutos de su casa, de las 7 de la mañana a las 4 de la tarde en el día hace 5 viajes al cantón.

El crédito solicitado en Fundación Campo, es para comprar el motor de arranque del camión que se le ha arruinado, el préstamo mejorara el buen estado del camión; ya que es su fuente de ingreso y ya no lo anduviera empujando para que le funcione.  

Uno de sus sueños es tener un microbús, para que la gente vaya bien cómoda y favorable  y así la gente preferirá su servicios y tendrá más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old. He studied through the ninth grade. He is married, and his spouse dedicates herself to household tasks. They have a 4 year old daughter.

Carlos works with his own truck, transporting people from town to a canton of the town. He has been doing this work for four years. Before that he worked out of the country. He bought the truck with that money and moved back to be with his family. His job is 15 minutes from his house. He works from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon, making 5 trips to the canton.

The loan Carlos is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a starter to replace the ruined one in his truck. The loan will improve the condition of the truck, which is his source of income, so he will no longer have to push it to get it started.

One of his dreams is to have a microbus so the people can travel more comfortably, and they will prefer his services. That way, he will have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a starter to replace the ruined one in his truck,

loans.name: Evelyn Coralia

texts.es:
Evelyn de 35 años de edad, estudio octavo grado,  esta acompañada;  el esposo trabaja en seguridad pública,  los dos hijos van a la escuela.


Ella solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también administra una finca de unos familiares desde 5 años  y es ahí donde tiene una fuente de ingreso, la finca le queda a una distancia de 20 kilómetros de donde vive ella, viaja en un carro y viaja con los hijos para irles enseñando como es lo del negocio.

Con el préstamo que Fundación Campo le dará,  comprara la bomba de frenos del vehículo que le ayuda a transportarse a la finca,  el préstamo mejora en  estar viajando seguido a ver la finca  y también con lo sobrante poder invertirle más  a la finca contratar más personal para que la limpien y le den el mantenimiento adecuado.  La necesidad que satisfará en su vida, es que tendrá en buenas condiciones el vehículo para salir con su familia.

Sus sueños en el futuro, es tener una finca muy reconocida en la zona y poder exportar el café a otros países y surtir también aquí en el país, lo que espera para sus hijos es que se preparen en sus estudios y que aprendan muy bien el negocio y las ganancias las ocupara para poder invertir más y darle trabajo a los habitantes de la zona,  lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old. She studied through the eighth grade. She is married. Her husband works in public security, and her two children go to school.

Evelyn only works in her home, but she has also managed a property of some relatives for 5 years. That is her source of income. The property is 20 kilometers from where she lives. She travels there in a car and takes her children to teach them the business. 

With the loan that Fundación Campo will give her, Evelyn will buy a brake pump for the vehicle that helps her get to the property. The loan will allow her to continue going to see the property. With the extra money, she will be able to invest more in the property to hire more employees to clean it and keep it adequately maintained.  The need that will satisfy her in her life is to have a vehicle in good condition to go out with her family. 

Evelyn’s dreams for the future are to have a property that is well known in the area, to be able to export coffee to other countries, and also to supply coffee in her country. She hopes that her children will be prepared in their studies and will learn the business well. She also hopes that her earnings will be able to be invested more and give work to the people who live in the area. With a lot of effort, she will be able to achieve her goals and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a brake pump for the vehicle that she uses to get to the property.

loans.name: Evgemia

texts.en:
Evgemia is 47 years old, married, and lives in Gardnersville, in Montserrado County, which is a commercial city in Liberia.  She has five children, who are between 13 and 32 years old and only three are in school. Evgemia finished 12th grade before starting this business. 

Presently, Evgemia is selling bitter-ball, pepper, salt, onion, palm oil, and other things in the local market. For over five years now she has been doing business.  She started this business from her husband. She likes the ways her costumers buy from her and the profits she generates every day. Evgemia is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter-ball, pepper, salt, onion, palm oil, etc. for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter-ball, pepper, salt, onion, palm oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes and his family live in Vostan village which is in the Ararat region of Armenia. He lives with his wife and 12-year-old daughter. The only source of family income comes from the taxi driving that he has been engaged in for the last four years. Hovhannes works hard to be able to gather enough income and cover his family's daily needs.
Unfortunately, the car that Hovhannes drives as a taxi is damaged and needs to be renovated. He is requesting this loan so he will be able to renovate it and continue his taxi driving business. Hovhannes has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Hovhannes and he hopes for lenders' good will and support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his taxi.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan has worked as a taxi driver for seven years. He lives together with his daughter and is the only breadwinner for his small family. His hard and tireless work is valued among his clients, who prefer to travel with Vardan far distances, since he is a very attentive and qualified driver.

Vardan is asking for this loan because he needs financial support to renovate his car and purchase new tires. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this hard-working man to continue his work and gather more income for his beloved daughter. Vardan's daughter is 18-years-old and studies at a local school.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car and new tires

loans.name: Wilbur

texts.en:
Wilber is a very hardworking and responsible man. He deals in the goat trade so as to earn enough income for his family. He has six children and also looks after his aging mother. The main purpose of this loan is to expand his business by buying more goats. His main customers are butchers and hotel operators. Besides the goat trade, Wilber also trades in produce, mainly coffee.

Wilber hopes to become the main supplier of goats within Rukungiri Town. He hopes that with the high profits from his expanded business, he will be able to provide for his family's needs as well as pay the school fees for his children.

In the photograph is Wilbur with his wife and mother.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is married and is 47 years old. She completed the six years of primary education. She has three children and all are attending school. Victoria works by selling smoked fish. She started her business with a family loan and has eight years of experience to date. She relies on her husband’s support; he is a spare parts dealer. 

Victoria is requesting her second loan from Kiva in the amount of GHS 700 to buy enough fish to sell to customers. In the future, she’d like to have a prestigious foodstuff store where people can find everything.

The other group members sell coca-cola, fish, and electrical accessories. They will need a total amount of GHS 2550 to strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy enough fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Amenouveve Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "AMENOUVEVE" est composé de 10 femmes qui mènent de différentes activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier de Sanguéra localité située au nord ouest de Lomé. Ce groupe est représenté par Edzenunye. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle a démarré la vente des produits d'alimentation générale depuis plus de 16 ans dans son quartier. Son stock est composé de l'huile végétale, des légumes, des tubercules, des céréales, des boites de conserve, ...
Edzenunye sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner et bien préparer la période des fêtes de fin d'année.
Les autres membres du groupe font des prestation de service et de petits commerces. Les revenus dégagés sur leurs activités leurs permettront d'aider leur mari dans les dépenses de leur famille respective.
texts.en:
The Amenouveve group is composed of 10 women engaged in different types of work in the Sanguera district, in the northwest of Lome. Edzenunye is the group's representative. She is married and has four children. She has been selling basic food items in her neighborhood for over 16 years. Her stock includes vegetable oil, tubers, yams, cereals, canned [tinned] food etc.

Edzenunye is seeking this loan in order to replenish her stock in preparation for the end-of-the-year holidays. The other group members provide various services or work as vendors. Their revenues will allow them to help their respective husbands with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two jugs of vegetable oil, two bags of rice and 35 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba, Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom goes to school. For the past 10 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her restaurant where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food and other items for the restaurant and will help Betty to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to offer better services to her customers. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of more food and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in Uganda. She is married and has three children with none of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sales home items. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more home items and food to sell and will help Margret to generate greater profits and take care of her medical bills and her family's basic needs. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire more stock for her shop. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more home items and food to sell

loans.name: Jesuvivi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUVIVI est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Marie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans. Marie est mariée à un horloger du nom de David. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Marie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Marie achète des noix de palme, qu'elle transforme en huile de palme, et qu'elle revend par la suite. Marie vend également du gari (farine de manioc) dans sa région depuis trente ans. Marie s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe JESUVIVI pour solliciter un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Jesuvivi group is composed of three individuals who are friends and form a "tontine" [a community savings group] together. The group's representative, Marie (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 46 years old. Marie is married to David, a watchmaker. They have six children, some of whom are in school. Marie lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs. In order to support her family, Marie buys palm nuts and  processes them to make palm oil for resale. She also has been selling "gari" (manioc/cassava flour) in her region for 30 years. Marie stocks up locally. In order to strengthen her business, Marie, jointly with the other members of the Jesuvivi group, is applying for her fifth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy manioc flour and palm nuts.

loans.name: Enagnon 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 3 est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Flaure Mahoutin (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Flaure Mahoutin a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Flaure Mahoutin est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Désiré. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Flaure Mahoutin vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Flaure Mahoutin et son mari. C’est pour cette raison Flaure Mahoutin vend des tissus de façon ambulante depuis treize ans. De façon secondaire, Flaure Mahoutin vend des ustensiles de cuisine. Flaure Mahoutin s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Flaure Mahoutin s’associe aux autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 3 pour solliciter un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Enagnon 3 group is composed of four individuals who are friends and form a "tontine" [a community savings group] together. The group's representative,  Flaure Mahoutin (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 38 years old. Flaure Mahoutin finished primary school. She  is married to Desiré, a mechanic. They have three dependent children, some of whom are in school.  Flaure Mahoutin lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs.  In order to do so, Flaure Mahoutin has been selling fabric for over 13 years. In addition, she also sells kitchen utensils. Flaure Mahoutin stocks up at a market in Benin.   In order to strengthen her business, Flaure Mahoutin, jointly with the other members of the Enagnon 3 group, is applying for her sixth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and plates.

loans.name: 07.03.03 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan has a manufacturing business making incense. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make incense to sell.  Loan is 45 years old and she is married.  She has two children.  Loan is the group leader of the 07.03.03 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of three members. Loan lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Loan has been involved in this business for six years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase material to make incense to sell

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita, a 47-year-old woman is from Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is married with five children. 

In order to survive and sustain the family, Abita and her husband are engaged in corn production to earn a living. Her family has been in this business activity for ten years as their main source of income. They also operate a retail store selling eggs for added income.

She became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Tabita deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Now she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of Php 14,900.This loan is to purchase farm inputs and pay labor costs in land cultivation for corn production. 

She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy & healthy life with her family, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay labor costs in cultivating their land.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 63 years old, married, and a resident of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, Mindanao, in the Philippines.  

Starting with capitalization of PHP 2,500, she engaged in a buy-and-sell of rice and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in good standing and has taken out several loans. 

Now, Candelaria is applying for PHP 12,000 to restock inventories of rice for her buy and sell business.  In the future, she wants to own a space near public market someday where she could display her stocks with convenience.  She will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories for her rice business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 45, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, an employee and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells burgers for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Letecia dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school and the rest of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, Umazi has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this KES 50,000 loan, Umazi wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn, 30, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them manage their household. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Katlyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Katlyn earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Katlyn hopes that her store will flourish and dreams of making a better living.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a cover stitch machine, and a serger.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha  is 39 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have three children, aged 13 to 24, all three of whom live at home and two of whom are attending school. 

Oretha has been selling charcoal for the past 20 years.  She was taught how to run the business by her friends.  Her main challenges are the increases in prices.  She is happy when she sells and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase and resell more charcoal. She would like to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more charcoal.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a single mother of ten children, four of whom are in school the rest of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaka has operated a kiosk business at the market for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business. With this KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of bread, sugar, beans, rice, and soft drinks. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bread, sugar, beans, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman with no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Eunice operates a food-making business, making items like, beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. 

With this KES 30,000 loan, Eunice wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat, 50, is married with one daughter. His family lives in a house with a thatched roof in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. The main sources of his family’s income are from growing cassava and raising pigs. The current business earns him about 20,000 Cambodian riel per day to meet his family’s need. 

Sophat is just with VisionFund for this cycle and he is leading his group in asking for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy pig feed and more piglets for raising. 

He hopes to fatten his pigs to sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more piglets for raising

loans.name: Group 1 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en: Ms. Dung, 29, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about 700,000 VND. She is married with two small children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2007. Ms. Dung is fully aware that an unhygienic latrine will contaminate the environment and adversely affect the health of her family members and her community in general. Due to a lack of money, her family currently does not have a septic tank latrine. With a portion of this loan, Ms. Dung will build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve her family's living conditions, in addition to providing personal safety, convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members while contributing to environmental protection. In this picture, she is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Babi Rahayu group receives their new loan. The group expected an increased amount for the loan, but after an evaluation from MUK’s staff, the group still received the same loan amount.

Ni Ketut is the head of the group. She already has two sows and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase only super quality feed. She must protect the health of her sows. Ni Ketut is a piglet seller in her village. One sow can bear 8 – 12 piglets. She hopes the sows can birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She sells the piglets for fattening or pig rolls. She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

In the meeting, one of the members couldn’t attend because they had a religious ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 30-year-old married man. He has run his small bakery for the past four years ago to make his living and to provide the other two members of his family with a good standard of living.

Husein is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for transportation for his business (e.g. oil, flour, cheese, and thyme) and also for his family. He is very anxious about this loan because he believes that it will make his business easier and more productive.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for transportation for his business and also for his family

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin operates a motorcycle service by providing transportation in his community. He has done this for more than five years, earning well to support his family. 

He joined GDMPC in 2011. Edwin has been using his previous loans in his transportation business and has successfully repaid. Recently, Edwin borrowed a new loan to buy a new set of tires and accessories to improve the services. He wants to send his children to finish a course to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy new a set of tires and accessories

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is married with three children. Ellen is 39 years old and lives in Taguima, Tudela, Philippines.

To earn a living, Ellen has a computer play station business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 7,000 PHP [Philippines pesos]. Ellen has been a member of PMPC for a month. She has reached PMPC for a loan to buy additional units of computers.

In the future, Ellen hopes to expand her business more and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy additional units of computers

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married with seven children; she is 49 years old, and lives in the Philippines. Vigilia is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living; she has been doing this for 30 years. Virgilia has been a member for five years.

Virgilia has requested a loan to pay for a seedbed (seedling bed) and land preparation.  

In the future, Virgilia hopes to give financial needs everyday to her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed (seedling bed) and land preparation.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 4 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Marie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie est mariée à un plombier nommé Yves. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Marie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marie vend des glacières dans un marché de sa région depuis quinze ans. De façon secondaire, Marie vend des assiettes et de l’igname. Marie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 4 pour solliciter un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Wangninagbe 4 group is composed of three individuals who are friends and form a "tontine" [a community savings group] together. The group's representative,  Marie (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 38 years old.  Marie did not attend school. She  is married to  Yves, a plumber. They have  two dependent children, one of whom is in school.  Marie lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs.  In order to so,  Marie has been selling  coolers at a regional market for   15 years. In addition, she also sells  plates and yams. Marie stocks up at a market in Benin.   In order to strengthen her business,  Marie, jointly with the other members of the Wangninangbe 4 group, is applying for her sixth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid

loans.use: to buy coolers, plates and yams.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEMAHUTON 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Hounsi Appoline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Hounsi Appoline a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Hounsi Appoline est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Franck. Le couple a cinq  enfants, dont certains scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Hounsi Appoline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison que Hounsi Appoline vend des fournitures scolaires, des liqueurs et du riz à son domicile depuis seize ans. Hounsi Appoline vend de façon secondaire du gasoil. Hounsi Appoline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Hounsi Appoline s’associe aux autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON 2 pour solliciter un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The  Kpemahuton 2 group is composed of three individuals who are friends and form a "tontine" [a community savings group] together. The group's representative,   Hounsi Appoline (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 35 years old.   Hounsi Appoline completed primary school. She  is married to  Franck, a driver. They have   five dependent children, some of whom is in school.  Marie lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs.  In order to so,  Hounsi Appoline  has been selling   school supplies, liquors and rice out of her home for 16 years. In addition, she also sells  diesel fuel.  Hounsi Appoline stocks up at a market in Benin.   In order to strengthen her business,  Hounsi Appoline, jointly with the other members of the  Kpemahuton 2 group, is applying for her sixth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy liquors and rice.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia, 77, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eugenia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Eugenia hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams to have a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her business which has now been running for eight years. Her loan also helped in her children's education and her income supported their household income.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will continue to operate and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Joesa

texts.en:
This is Joesa. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a new 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joesa hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-production business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from pig fattening. Rosita is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Teodocia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dry goods (e.g., clothing) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns income from a general store.

Teodocia is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell in her dry goods business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Hershey

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Hershey works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure service in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food. Hershey is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nippers (cuticle cutters), nail cutters, nail polish, etc. for her manicure business.

Hershey has been sustaining her business activities through her former loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nippers (cuticle cutters), nail cutters, nail polish, etc. for her manicure service.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, Kwekwe has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She has mentioned that price fluctuation is her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, Kwekwe wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a rural village of the Sa Ang district. Rice farming is the main source of his family’s income and he also supplements the income by catching fish and planting various kinds of vegetables. The current business earns his family a daily income of about 60,000 KHR but he is able to save only 25,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Moern’s Group of three members who live in the same village. He is now leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to build a proper latrine his family to use. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a clean latrine for his family so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for his family to use.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is a 29-year-old single man who strives for a living by working as a blacksmith. He is able to earn about US$10 per day from the occupation that he has had since 2011. This is a first-time loan for Phorn with VisionFund. He is seeking this loan to pay for the cost of his bachelor's degree.  He is majoring in Finance and Banking. He hopes that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn, 34, lives in a rural village of the Dongkor District. She is a married mother of three children. She is a wholesaler who sells SIM cards in her village. She has been in this business for four years to make a living. 

Savorn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Chnang province’s Chol Kiri district, Sambath is aged 44 years and married with one daughter, who is still in school. For the last 19 years, she has been farming rice and raising pigs to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about US$3 per day and can save about US$1.50 each day for future needs.

She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. Now, she is asking for a loan to pay for daughter’s university tuition to study banking. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s university tuition to study banking

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Mi

texts.en:
A 39-year-old mother of four children, Mi resides in a rural village of the Kampong Chnang province’s Chol Kiri district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been farming rice and raising fish for 20 years, and supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. Together, she and her husband can earn about US$4 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Mi with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for tuition for her daughter in university, in the faculty of accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for her daughter in university

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Gardnersville. She is 25 years old and single with two children, ages 2 and 7, both of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past two years Elizabeth has been operating a table where she sells milk, matches, soap, candles, and other goods. She learned this way of selling from her mother and started her business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys the flow of customers and profit she receives each day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, matches, soap, candles, and other goods for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Al-Shaja`a Group

texts.en:
The members of the "Al-Shaja`a" group are four women who all live in traditional extended families in Hodeidah, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties. Ghazal is the leader of the group and is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She has been selling clothes, incense, and perfumes for four years. 

Ghazal started her business with a small amount provided by her husband and says that she is doing well with the business. She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business. She hopes the business will continue growing as it has done to date, and hopes to open a clothing store. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena lives in Gardnerville in Montserrado County, which is the commercial city of Liberia. She is 27 years old and single. She is a high school graduate. 

For the past three years, Helena has been selling cosmetics in the local market. Presently she faces no problems. She started this business from her daily saving with Susu [a traditional form of banking in Liberia]. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. 

Her plans are to build a house and attend a university in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is married with four children. He is 53 years old and lives in Molave, Philippines. Wilfredo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. Wilfredo has requested a loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation. Wilfredo has been a member to PMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to provide financial needs to his family every day and to expand his farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Lillain

texts.en:
Lillain is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in Uganda. She is a widow and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Lillain has been working hard to manage her hardware business which sells hardware building items. 

To help expand her business, Lillain has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware building items. This will help Lillain to generate greater profits and boost the socio-economic status of the family. Lillain hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

Lillain is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lillain who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware building items

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Genalyn is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 32 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old, very hardworking gentleman who supports his parents. He has been running a phone accessories shop for the last two years with a monthly income of about 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES).
