She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a 26-year-old married man. He has two children, ages two and five. He describes himself as honest. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the tendency of meat prices to go up. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has six children, ranging in age from 12 to 26 years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a tea farm where he sells tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are on a small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be heavy rainfall, which affects tea production. He will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. His business goal is to excel within five years, and he hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children, who are 20 and 25 years old. She describes herself as a serious business lady. She operates a shoe stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an appropriate area. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock of shoes for resale. Her business goal is to open a shoe shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a big shoe shop.

loans.use: add to her stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Itá  Son 7 jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es Hector, quien tiene 21 años, cuenta que está trabajando en un depósito, y a la vez  está queriendo emprender con la venta de productos para el hogar. Él es un joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosos de él. 
Pide de este crédito para la compra de artículos para el hogar, como aceite, jabón de lavar, detergentes, arroz, etc.  lo que le ayudará a poder seguir trabajando. En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas ya que aparte de los jóvenes están los codeudores.
texts.en:
This group, from Itá, is made up of seven young adults who joined together with the aim of starting work to get along and be able to help their families.  They are very keen as they will be able to contribute to the household expenses, making them feel useful.

One of these members is Hector, 21, who works in a store and wants to set up his own business selling household products.  He comes from a very good, hard-working family, and he wants to follow his parents’ example and help them and make them feel proud of him.

He is asking for a loan to buy household goods such as oil, soap, detergent, rice, etc.  This will help him continue working.  In the photo there are more people because it includes the borrowers as well as their fellow members who are also co-signers.

loans.use: to buy household goods such as oil, soap, detergent, rice, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos ya mayores, ella empezó trabajando desde muy joven como empleada de una fábrica, después de mucho sacrificio pudo comprar un vehículo y alquilar como transporte escolar, luego de unos años entrego como parte de pago y adquirió un colectivo de transporte que actualmente  también alquila y vive de la renta de su colectivo.
Gracias a este trabajo pudo construir su vivienda, mantenerse y  darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Herminia  es una persona muy dedicada, sacrificada, responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de cubiertas para su transporte y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Herminia is 64 years old and has three grown-up children.  She began working in a factory when she was very young, and after a lot of sacrifice was able to buy a vehicle and rent it as a school bus.  After a few years she traded in her vehicle as a partial payment and acquired a bus, and now she lives on the income from renting out her bus.  Thanks to this job she was able to build her house, support herself, and provide her children with a good education.  Herminia is a very dedicated, demanding, responsible person who is honest in her commitments.  She requests this loan to buy tires for her vehicle so she can continue working as she has been.  She is thankful for this opportunity, which will be very helpful in allowing her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Deicy Yakeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Deicy, tiene 36 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  18 y 11 años que estudian en universidad  y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Deicy es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que el gana muy poco se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día sobretodo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante y más cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank ‘Amigas de Tosagua’ get together every 15 days.  This place is known as being a dynamic city.  Most of the population work in agriculture and the farming of livestock as it is an area which has a lot of vegetation.

This is where Deicy, 36, lives.  She is married and has two children, aged 18 and 11.  The eldest is studying at university and the other is at school.  Her husband is a builder.

Deicy is a housewife but she also sells clothes by catalogue along with products by Yanbal and Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and womens’ accessories).  She does this in order to have her own income and help her husband, who earns very little, with the household expenses.  She works three days a week, between two and three hours, mostly in the mornings.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days.  She has been doing this for ten years, which helps them to get along, even more when her husband is out of work.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  She has been with this credit group for six years and she likes it because the loans help her move her business and family forward.  She hopes that her children will be good workers, too.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Araceli Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Araceli, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 19, 16 y 7 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo realiza trabajos para una empresa constructora.
Doña Araceli tiene un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que conocen de la calidad de sus obras, aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 16 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual paga los estudios de sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en: In the city of Tosagua, the Amigas de Tosagua Communal Bank meets every two weeks.  This area is known for being very dynamic.  The majority of the inhabitants farm and raise animals, since the area has a lot of vegetation.  Araceli, who is 40 years old and is married, lives here.  She and her husband have four children, aged 22, 19, 16, and 7, all of whom still live with her.  The older two are in college and the younger two are in grade school.  Araceli's husband works for a construction company.  She has a small sewing workshop where she makes all sorts of women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She likes making women's clothing the most.  She works filling orders from individuals who are familiar with the quality of her work, although at times she also makes uniforms for institutions and schools in her area.  She works every day from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM, and sometimes even later when she has orders to finish.  She has been in this line of work for over 16 years, and it allows her to pay for her children's education.  She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other materials for sewing.  She is a founder of the credit group and she likes it because the loans she receives help her to get ahead.  Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for sewing

loans.name: Ana Genith

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun vive en su casa. Su  esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ana es una muy buena madre y esposa que para lograr sus propios recursos por el bien de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y a la cría de pollos y chanchos ya que sus actividades no le quitan mucho tiempo y le dejan muy buenos ingresos, la ropa la distribuye puerta a puerta y también en su casa y los pollos y chanchos los entrega en su domicilio a comerciantes.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa  y alimento para pollos y chanchos. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante los estudios de sus hijos. Sus sueños son seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank ‘Amigas de Tosagua’ get together every 15 days.  This place is known for being a dynamic city.  Most of the population work in agriculture and the farming of livestock as it is an area which has a lot of vegetation.

This is where Ana, 44, lives.  She is married and has five adult children.  Two of them still live in her house.  Her husband is a sales rep.
Ana is a very good mother and wife who, to have her own income to help her family, sells clothes by catalogue and raises chickens and pigs.  These activities do not take up a lot of her time and they provide her with a steady income.  She sells the clothes from her home, but also offers a delivery service.  She sells the chickens and pigs to customers from her home.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and food for the chickens and pigs.  She has been with the credit group for seven years and she likes it because the loans help her to provide her children with a good education.  Her goal is to keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Digna, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  fruto de la misma ha tenido 2 hijos,  todos sus hijos son  mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa, su marido es agricultor.
Doña Digna con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta ya que su esposo no gana mucho y en ocasiones no le alcanza se dedica al comercio, ella compra queso al por mayor y luego lo distribuye al menudeo, todos los días instala un pequeño mesón en su casa en el cual vende este delicioso alimento. También vende ropa de todo tipo porque ella trata de tener más ingresos por el bienestar de su familia, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a estas actividades.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y quesos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank ‘Amigas de Tosagua’ get together every 15 days.  This place is known for being a dynamic city.  Most of the population work in agriculture and the farming of livestock as it is an area which has a lot of vegetation.

This is where Digna, 51, lives.  She and her partner have two children.  They are now young adults but they still live in the family home.  Her husband is a farmer.

Digna works in retail to be able to earn her own income as her husband does not earn a lot of money and at times it is not enough to get by.  She buys cheese wholesale and then she sells them.  Every day she sets up a small stall in her house where she sells this delicious food.  She also sells clothes of all types as she tries to get an income to help her family.  She has been doing these activities for 15 years.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and cheese.  She has been with this credit group since its foundation and she likes it because the loans always help her get along.  Her aim is to continue moving forward and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cheese.

loans.name: Norma Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tiene 2 hijas de 19 y 15 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. El esposo es mecánico. 
Doña Noma es una mujer que a pesar de la edad le gusta cada día ser mejor y es por eso que está por terminar una carrera universitaria, esta por licenciarse en Educación Básica. Ella además de estudiar y ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal, Avon y Belcorp  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días, sale a recorrer por la localidad y también vende en la universidad donde estudia su hija, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ha logrado tener sus propios recursos para así ser una profesional.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De crédito  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos pudo seguir sus estudios. Sus sueños son ser profesional y mejorar su visa.
texts.en:
The Amigas De Tosagua [Friends of Tosagua] communal bank meets up every fortnight in the city of Tosagua. This is a place known for being very dynamic, where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, as it is an area with a great deal of vegetation.

Norma, aged 42, lives here. She is married and and from this marriage she has two children aged 19 and 15, who study at university and school respectively. Her husband is a mechanic.

Noma is a woman who, in spite of her age, like to improve every single day, and this is why she is just finishing her university course. She is about to graduate in Basic Education. As well as studying and being a good mother and wife, she is involved in commerce. She sells Yanbal, Acon and Belcorp products, that is, beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women. She works every day and goes out to travel around the area and she also sells at the university where her daughter studies. She leaves items on credit and returns to collect the money a week later. She has been doing this work for 7 years, and in this way she has managed to earn her own income and thus become a professional.

She is asking for this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewellery. She's been in the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to carry on her studies. Her dream is to be a professional and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewellery.

loans.name: La Colina Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LA COLINA, está compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora  Yolanda en la foto es la que está agarrando el libro de actas de todo el grupo  ella se dedica a  vender comida y salteñas es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene 30 años y es casada con tres hijos de las edades de 7, 10 y 12, la venta de comida la realiza en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de la Colorada de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora  Yolanda va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su comida como Aceite, fideo, arroz y papa por mayor,  la señora  Yolanda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: La Colina (The Hill) is a Communal Bank composed of ten members, eight women and two men, all of them engaging in different activities. Yolanda is the president of the Communal Bank: in the picture she is the one holding the group’s records book. She is a very hardworking woman and she engages in selling meals and meat pies. She is 30 years old, she is married and she has three children aged 7, 10 and 12. She sells meals from a stall in her own house, located in La Colorada, a neighborhood of the town of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with the institution, and Yolanda will use it to buy ingredients to prepare her meals such as oil, noodles, rice and potatoes at a wholesale price. There are challenges Yolanda has to face with her job, notably competition, as there are many inns in her area that sell meals. She will use the profits to keep on buying ingredients to prepare her really tasty dishes, and she feels happy and grateful for the chance she has been given.

loans.use: To buy oil, noodles, rice and potatoes to prepare her meals.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Victoria está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité, ellas forman parte también del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una está.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rita, quien comenta que entre el trabajo que ella realiza se encuentra venta de carbón, y comenta también que además desea implementar la venta de ropas como un negocio nuevo, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas variadas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, “La Victoria”, is in its seventh cycle of the Committee Program. They all make part of the Poverty Elimination Program and take the Poverty Elimination Survey, which assesses their current situation.

One of the members is Rita, who says that among other things, she sells coal. She also says that she would like to start selling clothes. She wants to highlight the work done by the consultants, who check and do follow-ups on the training activities. This is demanding but also inspires women to fight in order to leave poverty.

Rita is requesting a loan to buy assorted clothes. This will help her to realize her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes to sell.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Damas Unidas   está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Justina es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de postres, comidas saladas, entre otra variedades, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares sus comidas. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda que está recibiendo, vaya mejorando cada día y pueda ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos, etc. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is called “Damas Unidas” [United Ladies] and is in its second cycle of the Women’s Committee Program. The group is located in the city of Concepción, which is a bit far from the central region, and continues to grow. It is a remote region, so the group’s members want to continue improving in order to help their region to have a better environment and to support its growth.

Justina is one of the members. She sells desserts, food and other preparations, both at home and in other places. She wishes that with time and the help she is receiving, she can improve more every day and continue to help her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make food: different types of meat, vegetables, spices, etc. She appreciates the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Shalton

texts.en: Shalton is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest and God fearing. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. His primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be an unavailability of customers. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy garage tools to help in repairing motor vehicles. He hopes that in the future, his business will improve. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy garage tools to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a single woman and has 1 child. She describes herself to be strong and determined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs of clothes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes to her inventory. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be rich. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes to her inventory.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a Kiva borrower and he has 1 child. He describes himself to be self-motivated. He operates butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase meat for his business. His business goal is to have a bigger butchery within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Yuma

texts.en: Yuma is a  Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail store where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of beauty products for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of beauty products for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 3 children who range in age from 14 to 20 years. She describes herself to be determined and loyal to customers. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years.
Her business is located in a market place with a lot of customers and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenges to be finances and a poor market. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables and pay county council fees. Her business goal is to have a profitable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a well-established business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables and pay county council fees.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 27-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 12 years old. She describes herself to be determined and honest. She operates a boutique where she sells both male and female clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a safe and secure area for running the business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to have a profitable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her stock. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a clothes store where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 46,000 loan to buy threads, cloth sheets and other materials for making clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy threads, cloth sheets and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta is a 21-year-old woman and she has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a shoe selling business. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good market and her primary customers are ordinary people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of shoes to her inventory. Her business goal is to attain all her objectives within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes to her inventory.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a 40-year-old woman. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, sweets, juices and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment for a shop and her primary customers are ordinary people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items she sells.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has 5 children ranging in age from 2 to 8 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a bicycle transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are all kinds of people.
He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather especially during the rainy season which affects his business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more bicycles that can be hired by clients. His business goal is to have a fleet of bicycles within 5 years. He also sells charcoal to earn additional income. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow economically and socially. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy additional bicycles.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 9 years to 27 years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for four years. She now wants to expand her farming area. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more tea seedlings to plant. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea seedlings to plant

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man and has 1 child. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a clothes store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes to his store. His business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a happy life. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes to his store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 50-year-old man. He has six children with ages ranging from 13 years to 24 years. He describes himself as focused. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an urban area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber to construct chairs, tables and other furniture. He hopes that he will have a bright future. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy timber to construct furniture

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as motivated. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, juices, biscuits and other items. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of juices, bread, biscuits and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of juices, bread, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Nahum

texts.en: Nahum is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, mangoes, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of bananas, mangoes and other vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add stock of bananas, mangoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a single man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a poultry farm where he keeps chickens. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough deep freezers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chickens. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be independent.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Carnael

texts.en: Carnael is a 32-year-old single woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be faithful and committed. She operates a shoe store. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase additional shoes.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells motor vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of adequate funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of spare parts to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will have financial stability. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of spare parts to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman and has 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent and honest. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area conducive to customers and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional meat. Her business goal is to open more branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a married man. He has two children. He operates a motor vehicle repair business. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy metal sheets for making car exhausts which he sells to motor vehicle owners. He hopes that in the future, he will have financial success. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets

loans.name: Kijapan Group

texts.en:
George is a second-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI), applying for a loan through a group. He is married with one child. He operates a small bar business in Maganjo on the outskirts of Kampala. Here, he also runs a pool table business with a help of one employee. George says that this has enabled him to take care of his family. 

Besides looking after his family, he has also managed to pay tuition for his two young sisters. His major challenge is inadequate stock. He also wants to top up on money to buy another pool table but is constrained by financial ability. This is why he is applying for a loan to buy another pool table such that he can increase his income. His future plan is to work hard and have his own commercial house as well as lift his family to a better financial position.

loans.use: To buy a pool table

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois de Walidaan qui a été créé le 19 novembre 2004. Le Banc Villageois regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier et des membres qui habitent dans d'autres quartiers environnants mais qui inspirent confiance au groupe. La bonne entente et la solidarité constituent leur force. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle s'investit dans le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va dans les marché hebdomadaires ou elle s'approvisionne en huile de palme 01 fût à 155 000 F, poisson fumé 100 000 F, 05 seaux de pâte d'arachide à 11 000 F l'un et le transport lui revient à 20 000 F. Elle utilise son fond propre pour aussi acheter un fût de condiments (nététou) à 35 000 F, piments sec à 35 000 F le sac, gombo en poudre à 15 000 F 
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle prend en charge une partie des dépenses de la famille et aussi renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
This group is part of the "banc villageois" of Walidaan which was created on the 19th of November 2004. The "banc villageois" groups together members who live in the same district and members who live in surrounding districts but who are trusted by the group. The good atmosphere of understanding between them and their solidarity is their biggest strength. Their main businesses are retail and livestock fattening.

Fatou, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are boys. She is a retailer. She has been in this line of work for a long time and is very experienced. She goes to the weekly markets, where she plans to stock up on palm oil (at 155 000 francs per drum), dried fish (for 100 000 francs), 5 buckets of peanut butter (at 11 000 francs per bucket.) The transport charges come to 20 000 francs. She will also use her own money to buy a bucket of condiments (nététou) for 35 000 francs, dried peppers (at 35 000 francs per bag) and powdered gumbo for 15 000 francs. She plans to use her profits to improve her living conditions. She will also cover some of the family's expenses and build her savings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and peanut butter, etc.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrado Corazon de Jesus está en su primer ciclo, donde todas están trabajando juntas y están empezando a conocerse. Ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural, aun en crecimiento, y bastante alejada de la zona céntrica.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jorgelina, quien es peluquera, y ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, que siempre le pide su trabajo. Comenta que a sus clientes y clientas les gusta mucho el trabajo que está haciendo, es por eso que se ha hecho muy conocida.
La Sra. Jorgelina Solicita este crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, y demás insumos para poder seguir prestando su servicio, y esto le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The Sagrado Corazon de Jesus group is in its first loan cycle, with all its members working together and getting to know each other.  They come from the city of Curuguaty, a rural area which is still developing and which lies quite a distance from the central zone.  One of the group's members is Jorgelina who is a hairdresser.  She has already built up a good clientele who often call on her services.  She tells us that her customers (both male and female) like her work very much and it is for that reason that she has become very well known.  Jorgelina is applying for this loan to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes and other supplies which will enable her to continue to offer her services.  This, in turn, will help her to put together her business plan which will enable her to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes and other supplies

loans.name: Agath's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois de Walidaan qui a été créé le 19 novembre 2004. Le Banc Villageois regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier et des membres qui habitent dans d'autres quartiers environnants et qui inspirent confiance. La bonne entente et la solidarité constituent leur force. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Marie, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche ovine. Elles fait cette activité depuis très longtemps et à une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle achète 10 moutons à 30 000 F l'un. Les soins vétérinaires reviennent à 20 000 F et le transport à 10 000 F. Avec son fond propre, elle achète les aliments pour bétail : de l'avoine à 50 000 F et du foin à 50 000 F aussi.
Avec les bénéfices tirés de ses ventes, elle compte investir dans la scolarisation de ses enfants et renforcer son épargne également.
texts.en:
This group of 5 members is part of the  banc villageois" of Walidaan which was created on the 19th of November 2004. The "banc villageois" groups together members who live in the same district and members who live in surrounding districts but who are trustworthy. The good atmosphere of understanding between the group members and their solidarity is their biggest strength. Their main businesses are retail and livestock fattening.

Marie, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her main business is sheep-fattening. She has been doing this for a long time and is very experienced in this area. She will buy 10 sheep at 30 000 per sheep. The veterinary costs will be 20 000 francs and the transport costs, 10 000 francs. She will buy animal feed with her own money: 50 000 francs worth of oats and 50 000 francs worth of hay. She plans to use the profits from her sales to invest in her children's education and build her savings.

loans.use: to carry out her sheep-fattening business.

loans.name: Nael's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 25 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois de Walidaan qui a été créé le 19 novembre 2004. Le BV regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier et des membres qui habitent dans d'autres quartiers environnants et qui inspirent confiance. La bonne entente et la solidarité constituent leur force. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 fille. Elle fait comme activité le petit commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis un bon moment et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va dans les grandes villes où elle s'approvisionne en légumes qu'elle revend au marché de sa localité. 
Elle achète pour 100 000 F de légumes à savoir : 03 sacs de carottes à 30 000 F, navets 5000 F, 03 sacs de choux à 22 500 F, 02 sacs d'aubergines amer à 20 000 F, aubergine douce à 20 000 F et 2500 F de frais de transport. Les 100 000 F vont lui servir de fond de roulement.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va renforcer son épargne et aussi construire une maison sur le terrain qu'elle a déjà acquis.
texts.en:
This group of 25 people is part of the  banc villageois" of Walidaan which was created on the 19th of November 2004. The "banc villageois" groups together members who live in the same district and members who live in surrounding districts and who are trustworthy. The good atmosphere of understanding between the group members and their solidarity is their biggest strength. Their main businesses are retail and livestock fattening.

Fatou, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, one of whom is a girl. She is a small retailer. She has been in this line of work for a long time and is very experienced. She goes to the big towns where she stocks up on vegetables which she then resells at her local market. She will buy 100 000 francs worth of vegetables: 3 bags of carrots (at 30 000 per bag), 5 000 francs worth of turnips, 3 bags of cabbages for 22 500 francs, 2 bags of bitter eggplants for 20 000 francs and 20 000 francs worth of sweet eggplants. Her transport costs will be 2 500 francs. The 100 000 francs she will receive will be used as working capital. She will use the profits she makes to build her savings and build a house on land she has already bought.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old single woman; she describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chickens, and she has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a secure area, and her primary customers are local customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenges to be a lack of finances and a poor market. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add more chickens and buy chicken feed. 

Her business goal is to have a well-established and profitable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add more chickens and buy chicken feed

loans.name: Zerubabel

texts.en:
Zerubabel resides in rural Ibanda. He is 39-years-old and married with six children, all of whom are in school.

He applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy another piece of land with a coffee plantation, this he hopes will increase his income.He also plans to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children. His major challenge is harsh climatic conditions, like heavy sunshine, which affect his coffee seedlings as well as heavy rains during certain seasons.

He hopes to increase his coffee production, take his children to good schools and construct a permanent home for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land with a coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 23 años vive con su mamá, trabaja como ayudante albañil durante el día y por la noche va a la Facultad, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Derecho, y una vez  que termine su carrera quiere  trabajar en su profesión y poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Gerardo, who is 23, lives with his mother.  He works as a builder's labourer during the day and goes to college in the evening.  He is in the second year of a Law course and, when he finishes the course, he wants to work in the profession so that he can help people in need.  He is applying for this loan to pay his university fees which will enable him to continue striving to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rosinah

texts.en:
Rosinah is a 29-year-old single woman; she has one child who is 11 years old. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a M-pesa shop where she offers a mobile-phone-based money transfer service. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a profitable area, and her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy airtime and mobile phones to sell. 

Her business goal is to have a well established business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy airtime and mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old man. He describes himself to be aggressive. 

He operates a shoe repair shop where he repairs shoes; he has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are men and school children. He describes his biggest business challenge to be government policies. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials for repairing shoes, i.e thread, leather, etc. 

His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing shoes, i.e thread, leather, etc...

loans.name: Majidu

texts.en:
Majidu is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Majidu has been working hard to manage his video library & repairs, where he repairs electric items & sells movies. 

To help expand his business, Majidu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electric items and movies to sell, and will help Majidu to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. 

Majidu hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Majidu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Majidu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electric items and movies to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old and blessed with four children, ages 22, 19, 16, and 9. She is a tailor, and she has been doing it for six years. Right now her monthly income is Ksh 30,000. 

She will use her loan to purchase materials for making clothes, and use her anticipated profit to expand her business. 

This is her second loan, and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more material for dress making

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 31 and blessed with two children, ages 9 and 11. She is a business lady; she has been doing it for four years, and her monthly income is Ksh 10,000. 

She will use her loan to add more stock and use her anticipated profit to expand her business. 

This is her second loan, and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to add stock.

loans.name: Shabah

texts.en:
Shabah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge, Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years Shabah has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells foodstuffs and other essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Shabah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more foodstuffs and other essential goods and will help Shabah to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Shabah hopes that in the future he will be able to maximize profits. 

Shabah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shabah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and other essential goods.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba, Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 6 years Edgar has been working hard to manage his restaurant, which sells food. 

To help expand his business, Edgar has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food for the business and will help Edgar to generate greater profits and increase capital. Edgar hopes that in the future he will be able to have a well organized business. 

Edgar is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edgar who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more food for his business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba, Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his phone and accessories business, which deals with the repair and maintenance of phones. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones and accessories for sale and will help Robert to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to have a sustainable business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 41 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Teresiah and they are blessed with three children ages 16, 11 and 1.5 years old.

He is a livestock keeper who keeps animals like cows, sheep, and goats for fattening and resale, a business he has been running for the last fifteen years. Reuben would like to buy more livestock so as to increase his income, and to assist him do this he has applied for his third loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Right now his monthly income is Kshs. 20,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to renovate his house, pay back his loan to Kadet, and educate his children.

He hopes for a brighter future in business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock (goats, sheep, and a heifer) to fatten and re-sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 29 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Ruth and they are blessed with three children ages 6, 5, and 2 years old.

He is a cereal seller, a business he has been running for the last eleven years. He mainly specializes in selling maize and beans. He would like to expand his business by adding more stock of the products he sells, which will be made possible by a loan of Kshs. 70,000 he has applied for from Kadet Ltd. It is his third loan cycle.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 20,000 and he has plans of using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children, pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd, and expand his cereal business further.

In the future, he hopes to buy a piece of land and engage in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry maize and beans to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Armando Del Carmen

texts.es: Armando es un campesino de 54 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una familia humilde y trabajadora que le enseñó desde pequeño a realizar todas las labores del campo; gracias a ello, hoy en día posee algunas tierras con variedad de cultivos y adicionalmente posee ganado de levante y lechero, la producción tanto del ganado, como de los cultivos, es vendida en la plaza de mercado de la región y, de esta manera genera los recursos económicos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su empuje, esmero y dedicación hacen de él, un hombre ejemplar y cada día busca nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando. Por esta razón, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar más terneras y los insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, larvicidas, entre otros), con esto podrá seguir cuidando sus cultivos y adicionalmente tendrá la capacidad para aumentar su producción, dando como resultado un incremento notable en los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Armando sólo desea poder tener salud y bienestar para seguir luchando por sus negocios, pues se han convertido en la principal fuente de ingresos con la que le brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y se encamina a un futuro mucho más productivo y exitoso.
texts.en: Armando is a 54-year-old farmer who was born into a humble and hardworking family who taught him, when he was still small, to do all different types of farm work.  As a result, he now owns some land on which he grows a variety of crops, and also has cattle for rearing and milk production.  He sells both the produce from his cattle and his crops in the local market place, which enables him to generate sufficient income to cover the household expenses.  His drive, attention to detail and dedication have made him an inspirational man who is always on the lookout for new opportunities to continue making progress.  For this reason, he is seeking support in the form of a loan which he would like to use to buy more calves and agricultural supplies (manure, fertiliser, pesticide, larvicide, amongst other things) in bulk.  This will enable him to continue tending his crops and to boost his production and, as a result, achieve a considerable increase in the income from his work. Armando's only wish is to be healthy and well so he can continue to put all his efforts into his businesses, since they are now the main source of income he has to provide better living conditions for his family and to pave the way for a much more productive and successful future.

loans.use: to buy more calves and agricultural supplies (manure, fertiliser, pesticide, larvicide, amongst other things) in bulk

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea viene de una familia de 4 integrantes, ella vino a la ciudad de Pilar a cursar la carrera de Derecho y notariado, es funcionaria judicial.
Actualmente se desempeña como oficial de secretaría.
Ella es una joven con muchas ansias de crecer, y es por eso que se esta esforzando al máximo para poder crecer.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, para que así pueda estar más cerca de cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Andrea comes from a four member family. She came to the city of Pilar to study law and the profession of notary. She is a judicial official. Right now she is working as an official of the clerk's office. 

She is a young woman who really wants to grow and that is why she is works as hard as she can to be able to grow. She is asking for this loan to invest in paying college tuition so that she can be closer to achieving her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is 55 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past nine years, Yasin has been working hard to manage his catering services, which sells cooked food.

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food warmers that will be used for catering services, and will help Yasin to generate greater profits. Yasin hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger catering business. 

Yasin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yasin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food warmers used for catering services

loans.name: Tabisa

texts.en:
Tabisa is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Tabisa has been working hard to manage her bar business, in which she sales beer and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Tabisa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spirits, wine, sodas and beer to sell, and will help Tabisa to generate greater profits and provide for her children's welfare. Tabisa hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Tabisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tabisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spirits, wine, sodas and beer to sell

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Abdul has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells bread, donuts and milk. 

To help expand his business, Abdul has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bread, donuts and milk to sell and will help Abdul to make more profits and pay school fees for his children. Abdul hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wholesale shop. 

Abdul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, donuts and milk to sell

loans.name: Robert Musa

texts.en:
Robert Musa is 31-years-old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the region of Iganga in Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past ten years, Robert Musa has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells various products. 

To help expand his business, Robert Musa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items such as maize flour,beans,sugar and milk to sell and will help Robert Musa to generate greater profits and help pay school fees for his children. Robert Musa hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Robert Musa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert Musa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as maize flour, beans, sugar and milk to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es hijo único, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial. Y cuenta que está estudiando para poder convertirse en un profesional exitoso y  poder servir a los demás por medio de su conocimiento.
Él es un joven muy luchador, que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, para que de esa forma siga luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luis is an only child. He is studying business administration. He says that he is going to school to be able to have a successful career and be able to serve others through his knowledge.

He is a young man who really is a fighter and who wants to get ahead and improve his life through his education. He is asking for this loan to invest in paying college tuition so that in this way he can continue to fight for his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma is 50 years old. She is married and has one child, age 30. Many years ago she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Goma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba, Uganda. He is widower and has two children, with neither of them currently in school. For the past 4 years Julius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells foodstuffs and other essential goods. 

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more foodstuffs and other essential goods and will help Julius to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs.

Julius hopes that in the future he will be able to have a big enterprise. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Julius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more foodstuffs and other essential goods.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as assertive. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a potential area. He describes his biggest business challenge as transport for his products. He will use the KES 75,000 loan to add stock of shoes to sell. His business goal is to be importing shoes to sell within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will do well in business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shoe shop.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 53 years old from Nakuru. She is married to David and they are blessed with one child, age 15 years old.

She is a dairy farmer, a business she has been running for the last 20 years. To enable her buy animal feed and a dairy cow she has applied for her third loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD.

Right now her monthly income is KES. 40,000 and her plan is to use profits realized from her expanded business to start poultry farming and educate her child. She hopes for a prosperous future in business and for her family too.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her school-going kids.

Rose operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau, age 43, is married with 6 children, ages 18, 15, 12, 9, 6 and 3. Only three attend school. Esau also stays with 2 orphans.  

Esau is in agriculture and he sells tomatoes which he grows himself. He started doing this business in 1993 in order to earn income to support his household and meet their basic needs. He has approached Ugafode for a loan of 500,000 UGX to purchase pesticides to spray his tomatoes since it is his main source of income. 

Esau describes himself as hardworking and honest. His main challenges include seasonality and weather, which affects his business. Esau is also challenged by the perishability of his products. He dreams of educating all his children and building a good house.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both currently in school. For the past four years, Herbert has been working hard to manage his photo studio, which deals in still photos and photocopies. 

To help expand his business, Herbert has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more papers that will be used in photo copy, and will help Herbert to generate greater profits and help in paying school fees for his children. Herbert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase more inventory. 

Herbert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Herbert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more paper that will be used to photocopy

loans.name: Erly

texts.es:
Erly trabaja mañana y tarde en una empresa privada y por  las noches se dedica a  estudiar.  Está siguiendo la carrera de Administración de empresas, y cuenta que sus metas futuras es trabajar en lo que es su profesión, y seguir estudiando  y obtener mejores   ingresos para poder mantenerse y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este crédito para invertirlo en sus cuotas y sus gastos de manutención, que le permitirá seguir luchando por sus metas y también poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Erly works mornings and afternoons in a private business and spends her evenings studying. She is studying Business Administration and her future goals are to work in her field and to continue studying and to obtain higher income in order to support herself and her family.

She is asking for this loan to invest in her school fees and other expenses allowing her to continue fighting for her goals and to be able to obtain her dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees and to cover other expenses

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo de si para poder mejorar su estilo de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia, quien es una persona que se está esforzando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella es luchadora y está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de los suyos. Tiene una despensa que con mucho esfuerzo monto y que hoy ya es muy concurrido y tiene una buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser frutas, verduras, bebidas, panificados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Curuguaty and is in the first cycle of the Women's Committee Program. The group members are part of the Poverty Elimination Program, which requires all of them to strive to improve their lifestyles.  

One member is Señora Delia, who strives to achieve a better life both for herself and her family. Delia is determined and makes every effort to improve the conditions in which she and her family live. She owns a small grocery store that has grown thanks to her efforts and is today busy, with a strong customer base. 

Señora Delia is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for the store, such as fruits, vegetables, drinks, baked goods, and other items. Increasing the inventory of these items will allow sales at Delia's store to continue.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, drinks, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Florence has been working hard to manage her restaurant business and retail shop, which sells essential items and foodstuffs. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more essential items and foodstuffs, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and help in paying school fees for her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire more profits from the business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more essential items and foodstuffs

loans.name: Januka

texts.en:
Januka is 40 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 17. Many years ago, she began selling cow’s milk. Working 7 days a week, and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk cow. In the future, Januka plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be used to capture methane in storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk cow.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 56 years old. She is married and has two children aged 39 and 25.  Many years ago, she established her business selling cow's milk. Working seven days a week and fours hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.
 
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about US$0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 37 years old and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is married and has 5 children and 3 of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his coffee shop.
To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy more coffee, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses.
Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve on the business and buy more coffee for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a 38-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she sells general merchandise but also trades in food in order to support her family. Like most responsible mothers she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and set up other income generating activities such as rental houses in order to secure their future. Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent limit her profits while her plan is to trade in wholesale. Gloria is requesting for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Héctor De Jesús

texts.es: Héctor, a sus 53 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos; a los cuales ha sacado adelante con los ingresos que percibe por su labor, es un carpintero dedicado y con amplia experiencia y conocimiento en el oficio, tiene su propio taller hace muchos años y allí vende productos como puertas, tablillas, estantes, entre otros artículos que él mismo fabrica, los cuales son distribuidos en el municipio donde reside y en otro municipio cercano; de esta forma genera los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
