Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una máquina sinfín y madera al por mayor que requiere para dar mejor terminación a sus productos y agilizar más el proceso de producción, lo que se reflejará en la entrega oportuna de los encargos y en el incremento de las ventas; así podrá percibir más ingresos con los que anhela poder cumplir el sueño de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder ampliarlo, para generar más oportunidades de empleo a personas de su familia, pues esto es lo que Héctor se propone como meta principal, pues piensa que ayudando a los suyos, podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutar un mejor bienestar al lado de los que ama.
texts.en: Héctor is 53 years old, married and the father of two children. He has gotten them ahead with the income he makes from his work. He is a dedicated carpenter with a lot of experience and knowledge about the trade. He has had his own workshop for many years and there he sells products such as doors, notice boards, shelves, and other items that he makes himself and are distributed in the town where he lives and in another nearby town. In this way he generates enough income to pay for his household expenses. Right now he is asking for the help of a loan to buy a bandsaw and wood wholesale that he needs to give his products a better finish and speed up the production process. This will be reflected in the timely delivery of the orders and in the increase in sales. This way, he will be able to have more income with which he longs to make his dream come true of continuing to invest in his business and being able to expand it to generate more employment opportunities for people in his family. This is what Hector says is his main objective, because he thinks that by helping his family he will be able to have a better quality of life and enjoy more well being next to his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a bandsaw and wood wholesale.

loans.name: Marlen Yuriana

texts.es: Marlen, a sus 32 años de edad, es madre cabeza de hogar y ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos con gran esfuerzo. Luego de la separación con su esposo, se dedicó a trabajar como independiente, vendiendo productos por catálogo a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, actividad que realiza de manera alterna a la producción y comercialización de cerdos que aprendió de sus padres y que practica desde su casa, con ambas labores ella logra  generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y para brindar educación a sus hijos. Su perseverancia, empuje y tenacidad le han permitido sobrepasar las dificultades que la vida le ha puesto en el camino pero, por el amor y la motivación de sus hijos ella siempre sale victoriosa de cada una de las adversidades. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (cosméticos, cremas corporales y faciales, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros); así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de navidad, en la que las personas más consumen sus productos, logrando generar un mejor nivel de utilidades. Marlen manifiesta su interés en seguir realizando sus labores con disciplina y dedicación, pues es consciente que de ello depende el bienestar de sus hijos, además sueña con poder tener un almacén propio donde pueda vender sus productos y generar mejor rentabilidad para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Marlen is 32 years old. She is a head of household and has gotten her two children ahead with great effort. After separating from her husband, she started working independently selling products via catalog to her family members, friends and neighbors in the area. She does this activity in addition to the raising and selling of pigs, which she learned from her parents and which she does from her home. With both jobs she is able to generate enough income to pay for her household expenses and be able to provide her children with an education. Her perseverance, drive and tenacity have allowed her to overcome the difficulties that life has put in her way. With the love and motivation of her children she always comes out victorious with each and every one of her adversities. Right now, she is asking for the help of the loan in order to invest it in buying merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, body and facial creams, accessories, perfumes and more). This way, she will be able to stock up to satisfy the demand that increases with the Christmas season, when people consume her products more, enabling her to generate a better level of profit. Marlen says that she is interested in continuing to do her work with discipline and dedication. She is aware that her childrens' well being depends on it. She also dreams of having her own store where she can sell her products and generate more profitability to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, body and facial creams, accessories, perfumes and more).

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 35-year-old married man with four children aged between four and twelve years. He runs an electronics shop in Awasi town; he has been in business for the last seven years, earning an average monthly income of KES 35,000. He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 60,000 to purchase items like sockets, aerials and cables to sell. He plans to plough back the profits into the electronics business.

loans.use: To purchase items like sockets, aerials and cables to sell

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is a married mother. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en: Kennedy is 29 years old and married to Achieng whom together are blessed with five children between 1 and 6 years old. He runs a welding business near the Awasi location and is served by Kadet’s Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last five years earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. He has requested a loan for KES 80,000 which he will use to purchase iron rods for making doors and windows. With the anticipated profits he will use part of it to pay his children school fees and the remaining amount in helping to maintain his family.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Speech

texts.en: Speech is a forty-four-year old mother of five children who is determined to look after her family by providing the basic needs of life to the family members. She started doing agriculture twenty years back and is determined to carry it on until she gets her dream in life. She does agriculture in Bugarama, rural Katikamwe and her clients are the people in the surrounding areas of Kyabugimbi County. Speech started the business with an objective of getting a clear source of income which would help her to provide for her children. She would like to use the loan (one million shillings only) to improve on her banana plantation so that she can have better yields and hence get improved income. Her main challenge is competition which affects her too much but she believes the challenge will be overcome if she gets money and she improves her banana plantation since she will then be getting more bananas.

loans.use: To buy mulch which will improve her banana plantation

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en: Saverino is a cattle trader in Kashenshero in Mitooma District and he has traded in cattle since 1999 when he thought it wise to do that business with hope that it would reward him and he would be in a position to cater for the needs of his household. He also does agriculture on a small scale and he is hopeful that the profits from the two businesses will help him cater for the needs of his family adequately. He started the business because the other people who were trading in cattle were doing well and they had model families with their children in better schools so he was optimistic that his family would also be a model family in the village. He would like to use the money to buy more cattle for trade with high hopes that the business will be profitable and his children will have the best education ever. His clients are mostly cattle traders in the same area and those from nearby places. Lack of capital is his greatest challenge but he is hopeful that it will be overcome if he gets the loan.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Villa Del Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villas del Rey  está en su ciclo primer ciclo del programa de comité, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Florencia es parte de este grupo, y pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de estos, y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante y crecer.
texts.en:
The group called Villas del Rey is in its first cycle of the Poverty Stoplight program where they are using a measurement tool to eliminate poverty. Six of them are below the poverty line, that is to say low income, and they need to continue working to advance.

Florencia is part of this group, and she is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, as she works selling these, and through her work support her family.

She is a fighting woman and above all enterprising, who wants to succeed and grow.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 23 years old. She is married and has one child who is 1 year old. In 2008, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. In the future, Ramita hopes to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to be used in vegetable farming.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 40 years old. She is married and has two children aged 19 and 17.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business
